673073818.name: Loreto is doing it right!!
673073818.author: a TripAdvisor user
673073818.reviewBody: The Malecon is beautiful!  In years past, the Malecon was not always the cleanest place. This last trip, the Malecon was emaculate. No bags, cans or other garbage on the walk, in the rocks or it the water.  The amount of wildlife you can see from the Malecon is impressive, crabs, birds, fish, seals and dolphins. Sunset (over the mountains not the water) is a nice time to visit, but the best is sunrise. The sun rises over the water and between the islands. Getting up early for this is well worth it. People of Loreto are really taking pride in there city and it shows.

668086587.name: Beautiful
668086587.author: a TripAdvisor user
668086587.reviewBody: The Loreto malecon is a mix of bars, restaurants,  hotels, abandon buildings, street performers, beach front, fishing boat harbor, swimming, kayaking, paddleboarding, bicycling, pelican diving and so much more.   There is something for everyone!  Come and see fir yourself.  You won\'t be disappointed.

666998197.name: This is the local hangout!
666998197.author: a TripAdvisor user
666998197.reviewBody: We walked along the Malecon everyday during our stay.  No solicitors - local people - fisherman.  Clean breezy and the best display of pelicans we had ever seen!  We sat with a cerveza and watched them for an hour at a time

661171587.name: Well-Maintained and Scenic
661171587.author: a TripAdvisor user
661171587.reviewBody: The walk along Loreto\'s malecon is enjoyable.  A wide walkway, it is anchored at one end by a beach and gathering place for entertainment.  The other end, less than one-half mile away, abuts a sand/dirt peninsula that extends well into the bay. People and vehicles could be seen traversing the area.  It\'s noticeable  that both the malecon and town are very much trash free. We leaned from a resident that the police will fine anyone seen tossing trash.

659124412.name: Very clean
659124412.author: a TripAdvisor user
659124412.reviewBody: Very clean Malecon with places to go to the beach.  The South end though does tend to smell a bit fishy at times though.

658264865.name: Peaceful and Beautiful
658264865.author: a TripAdvisor user
658264865.reviewBody: A still along the Malecon in Loreto is good for the soul. It is peaceful, and the scenery (Islas Carmen and Coronado) are beautiful. It is clean and people are friendly.

657246810.name: Sooo pretty!
657246810.author: a TripAdvisor user
657246810.reviewBody: Short by LaPaz standards but very pleasant and not surrounded by shops and distractions.   From a stunning beach to a marina, this is a great palce for a stroll!

656850502.name: Clean, quiet and beautiful
656850502.author: a TripAdvisor user
656850502.reviewBody: This malec\u00f3n is small, beautifully, clean and so charming.\nFor early walking, for evening sunsets or just for a long  jogging. \nCheck it out without a rush. Just breath and take it all in.

656792586.name: Malecon at Loreto
656792586.author: a TripAdvisor user
656792586.reviewBody: Stayed directly across the street from the Malacon.\nIt is simply beautiful.  There is a walk way from end to end that is very nice.  There is also seating along the way.

653704173.name: The Highlight of Loreto!
653704173.author: a TripAdvisor user
653704173.reviewBody: Lovely walk along the ocean with views of the nearby islands.  Fun to watch the numerous Pelican\u2019s diving for fish in the ocean right in front of us.  Loreto has done a fabulous job making this walkway accessible to everyone.

652460581.name: Take a walk
652460581.author: a TripAdvisor user
652460581.reviewBody: A cool Sunday and we had a lovely walk along the Malecon.  Very clean and handicap friendly.  The views are great and the walk is easy.

650715530.name: Cutest Malecon I\u2019ve ever seen
650715530.author: a TripAdvisor user
650715530.reviewBody: I have traveled all over the planet.  The Malecon in Loreto is the best.  Beautiful, clean, great for a walk or bike ride.

649375600.name: Not very exciting spot vs La Paz
649375600.author: a TripAdvisor user
649375600.reviewBody: We found the malecon not very active given the time of year.  Mostly hotels and tourists vs the malecon in La Paz which is active day and night with locals and visitors.  \nWe also found that it smelled terrible, a mixture of sewer and sea water

649217820.name: Pelicans!
649217820.author: a TripAdvisor user
649217820.reviewBody: It was sunny but very windy during the week we visited so we couldn\'t go sailing, kayaking or snorkeling. We did a lot of walking along the Malecon, back and forth between the estuary and the marina. There were many sea birds: gulls, terns, whimbrels, marbled godwits, sandpipers, egrets, herons, brown pelicans and even a couple of frigate birds one day. There were lots of brown pelicans, fishing and sunning themselves on the beach or sitting on boats at the marina. We never tired watching them dive into the water and, after resurfacing, we would cheer when the bird was successful (tossing the catch up and swallowing it), or "awwwwed" and wished it better luck when the dive was fruitless. One evening, near the estuary, we saw hundreds of pelicans repeated dive into a small patch of water for fish. We could see shimmering close to the surface, possibly herrings that had gathered. Quite a feeding frenzy to behold.

646470042.name: Routine enjoyment
646470042.author: a TripAdvisor user
646470042.reviewBody: Be sure to establish a daily routine to include the Malecon for some action; walking, running, viewing. Although the saltwater has undermined the outer edge, the length is being replaced with a reinforced surface. A few pavilions provide stopping points to sit, people-watch, observe the views, crabs and diving pelicans, or discuss the weather. The town sign brightly offers photo ops, the life-size sculpture of a whale shark is a meeting place for tours, and the marina is based at the north end. The walkway creates the top bar of a T that forms  the tourist zone with the archway entrance to the stone pedestrian promenade of the tree covered Salvatiera where the town plaza and several restaurants are located.

645432236.name: Great Views
645432236.author: a TripAdvisor user
645432236.reviewBody: This is a much smaller town than La Paz and not as long a walk but a very clean and friendly town.  The people were also very helpful even with a language barrier!

645153157.name: Nice walk along the marina and Sea of Cortez
645153157.author: a TripAdvisor user
645153157.reviewBody: We enjoyed the Malecon.  The weather was cool but the walk along the water was nice.  There are some bronze statues of sea lions at the end that provide a nice photo opportunity.  We loved watching all the sea birds dive for fish - amazing!  There are opportunities for you to take a boat to fish and it is fun to watch the birds gather around those boats when they come back in.

644055083.name: Don\'t miss this lovely walk along the Sea of Cortez
644055083.author: a TripAdvisor user
644055083.reviewBody: Great views of the islands of Loreto, fine restaurants, people watching and sculptures make this a great place to stroll while visiting Loreto.

643308150.name: Malecon Loreto
643308150.author: a TripAdvisor user
643308150.reviewBody: Good for a walk\nUnfortunately very bad weather for us when we was there so we can\u2019t go in the sea or stay on the beach, too cold, too much wind

639018829.name: WOW !!!
639018829.author: a TripAdvisor user
639018829.reviewBody: If you are in P.V. Mexico, this is a MUST SEE---all the statues, each with a message & if you are lucky enough, watch the " FLIERS" from their pole on the walk. Check out "Los Arcos" & the Naval Museum.  Worth a slow walk & listen to the stories.

637901263.name: Night time entertainment.
637901263.author: a TripAdvisor user
637901263.reviewBody: Many vendors restaurants and shops you can visit day or night. A lot more excitement and entertainment during the evening hours. A fun place to be and very safe.

626552202.name: Pleasant place for a walk
626552202.author: a TripAdvisor user
626552202.reviewBody: Loreto malecon is a great place for an early morning or sunset walk or bike ride ! It is clean and very uncrowded , the people you do see are freindly and enjoying it as much as you are and they are mostly locals . The malecon is however a weekend cursing spot for pretty much everyone on town so on weekends it can be a bit noisy , Evan so it loses no charm and in some ways ats to it if your someone that\'s ever crused the blvd. on Friday night you will understand .

621191440.name: Pretty
621191440.author: a TripAdvisor user
621191440.reviewBody: Loreto\'s Malecon, which could almost be translated as boardwalk, offers great views and pleasant breezes, but probably even more, it\'s great for people-watching, visitors and locals alike.

592881898.name: Long and beautiful malecon!
592881898.author: a TripAdvisor user
592881898.reviewBody: Malecon is a strip of street perfect for viewing the coast and this is a good one, one of my favorites in Mexico!

592478692.name: View of the Bay, People watching, Dining options!
592478692.author: a TripAdvisor user
592478692.reviewBody: The Malecon fronts Loreto Bay, including the Marina and the town\u2019s main beach. The views are worth frequent visits, but you will also get an opportunity to see how small towns enjoy a simpler life. Even when I\u2019m not fishing, I enjoy getting up early and taking a nice walk along the Malecon and seeing the sunrise, watching the town \u201cwake up\u201d and start the day. There are many eating choices, most offer you water view seating. I have enjoyed each visit, but must say the \u201cearly morning\u201d is best for scenery and my favorite. LOL! We take advantage of evening strolls to walk off dinner. Bet you will visit it more than once. Enjoy!

589852362.name: Malecon
589852362.author: a TripAdvisor user
589852362.reviewBody: Short walk but scenic, especially at sunrise and sunset. Very popular with the locals on the weekends.

583746982.name: Gorgeous walk-
583746982.author: a TripAdvisor user
583746982.reviewBody: Everything is lovely about this walk. The sea wall, the azure water and the white sand beach. There is a really bad smell right where the main street meets the Malecon. Not sure what\'s up here, but other than that it\'s perfect.\n

583508365.name: Wonderful walks, and sites to see here.
583508365.author: a TripAdvisor user
583508365.reviewBody: You can walk along and see crabs sunning themselves on the rocks and the fish near the rocks as well. Stop by a local bar or cafe for a bite, or just enjoy the views.

582516455.name: Peaceful, scenic walk
582516455.author: a TripAdvisor user
582516455.reviewBody: enjoy the peaceful stroll, but the city needs to do something about the odor by the Mision hotel... awful

580507702.name: I\u2019ve place to walk
580507702.author: a TripAdvisor user
580507702.reviewBody: A love walk along the sea. Nice restaurants and lovely views.\nLoreto is a welcome respite after the drive from La Paz

579693883.name: Great views of the Loreto Bay!
579693883.author: a TripAdvisor user
579693883.reviewBody: Generally, a quiet place to walk and enjoy the scenery --- just not when the Baja 1000 race is in town!  Walk out onto the breakwater for the best views, and if you clamber over the rocks (be careful!) the views become unobstructed.  You might even see some nice fish below.

577222090.name: Walking the Malecon is a great way to start your day!
577222090.author: a TripAdvisor user
577222090.reviewBody: Super tidy, well kept seaside walkway with great view of Coronado.  Home to sportsfishing fleet.  Beautiful Sea of Cortez.  Benches to just sit and view the beauty of it all.

576101416.name: Beautiful walk by the water!
576101416.author: a TripAdvisor user
576101416.reviewBody: Lots of great statues, little areas for shade, beautiful scenery! Boat dock is right there for easy access and no hills! Wheel chair accessible as well

576058498.name: Nice place to walk or watch the Sea
576058498.author: a TripAdvisor user
576058498.reviewBody: We noticed lots of people walking and running along the Malecon, especially in the afternoon when the area is very shaded.  It\'s a beautiful place to walk and enjoy the views

575713401.name: Nice quite walk
575713401.author: a TripAdvisor user
575713401.reviewBody: The Malecon in Loreto is nice.  It is a comfortable walk unless it is windy.  The wind can blow hard at times.  It is very quite with just a few people to share it with.  There are no vendors and just a few restaurants to enjoy.  If you find yourself in Loreto take a walk on the Malecon.

575027752.name: Nicely updated walk along the seaside.
575027752.author: a TripAdvisor user
575027752.reviewBody: Great walk from pebbly beach to pebbly beach with the Marina in between. At night cars cruise by a la American Graffiti.... in a nice way

570583939.name: Blue Whale Festival free event on the Malecon
570583939.author: a TripAdvisor user
570583939.reviewBody: The Malecon is where locals and tourists gather. It looks out onto the Sea of Cortez and Isla del Carmen. There are sign boards with the marine mammals you may see in the ocean and a sign about this the national marine park being a UNESCO world heritage site.\nThe Blue Whale Festival was on while we were visiting. There is free entertainment, craft sales, food and presentations during the festival. The sunsets are amazing.

570229352.name: A wonderful place for an early morning walk
570229352.author: a TripAdvisor user
570229352.reviewBody: Sun rise over Isla del Carmen.  Watching the fishers heading out. Almost entirely level, clean, safe ares to walk.

567872832.name: Simple but great view
567872832.author: a TripAdvisor user
567872832.reviewBody: Very simple Malecon. Only a few restaurants. Great for a walk. Beautiful view! Several condos and hotels right on the beach. Beach is very rocky.

566747148.name: Easy to walk with great views, marina, restaurants and hotels
566747148.author: a TripAdvisor user
566747148.reviewBody: Great to stroll along the malecon from one end to the other.  Great ocean views of the islands, a large marina, plenty of restaurants and hotels

566564552.name: Lovely place to walk
566564552.author: a TripAdvisor user
566564552.reviewBody: The Malecon is a beautiful walk. It is clean, safe, very well maintained. A good way to get in your 10,000 steps. I suggest you stop at the Oasis Hotel patio for a drink. Also take the time to wolf out on the break water to see the whale sculpture. A nice way to spend a few hours.

566516030.name: Beautiful vistas!
566516030.author: a TripAdvisor user
566516030.reviewBody: A lovely, safe place for a lovely relaxing walk on a warm afternoon.  Watch for whales, boats and more as you stroll down the malecon.

566322677.name: Well Done!
566322677.author: a TripAdvisor user
566322677.reviewBody: Great to see a community that invests in its waterfront! This ocean front drive and walkway is totally accessible and a beautiful memorial to the ocean

566318042.name: Along the Boardwalk!
566318042.author: a TripAdvisor user
566318042.reviewBody: The Malecon is a wonderful boardwalk along the Loreto waterfront from beyond the harbour on one end to past the Hotel Oasis on the other.  Lots of runners and cyclists as well as families and other tourists come down to birdwatch or just enjoy the waterfront. Don\'t miss having your picture taken in front of the Loreto sign.

561400492.name: Nice simple malecon along the sea
561400492.author: a TripAdvisor user
561400492.reviewBody: this is a easy going small town malecon along the sea of cortez. it is beautiful to observe the sea and people watch.

559816245.name: Beautiful anytime
559816245.author: a TripAdvisor user
559816245.reviewBody: Loreto has a lovely sea walk, bordered by a rock seawall and beaches at both ends.  The small boat harbor is in the middle, and a couple of elevated platforms are wheelchair accessible.  Some sculptures decorate it, although the view of the sea and Coronado Island and the sound of the waves are all you need.  Normally peaceful, on Saturday nights it\'s hopping; cars driving slowly, to see and be seen, and are parked along the side so folks can visit. Across the street are some hotels, condos, and restaurants.  It\'s as clean as the main part of Loreto is, something we really appreciated.  If you\'re looking for a photo op, a statue of brightly colored letters spells out the name of the town.

558698668.name: Best part of Loreto
558698668.author: a TripAdvisor user
558698668.reviewBody: It\u2019s free, beautiful, safe, and interesting. The walk on the water side is pleasant any time of day.

557652999.name: Beautiful Malecon on Picturesque Bay
557652999.author: a TripAdvisor user
557652999.reviewBody: Walking along the Malecon was a highlight of our time in Loreto.  It is perfect for strolling, jogging or riding your bike.  It extends probably at least a kilometer or more along the Bay.  A number of restaurants, sports stores, bars and gift store are across from the Malecon.  It is very clean and well maintained; you will enjoy each moment spent on Loreto\'s Malecon.

556382283.name: Nice place to stroll
556382283.author: a TripAdvisor user
556382283.reviewBody: This is a scenic place to stroll in downtown Loreto. There were not crowds and it is nice and flat. You can go down to the harbor at one end.

555726666.name: Traditonal ocean walk where the city meets the sea.
555726666.author: a TripAdvisor user
555726666.reviewBody: The walkway is an early morning scene for walkers and joggers including a few of their four legged friends. Weekend evenings gets a little busy with slowly circling cars making "the scene". The ocean is always a surprise and ever changing. I\'ve seen dolphin swimming within 50 feet of the edge and whales a few hundred yards offshore.\nThe walk is not far and starts at the public beach continuing past the lighthouse and the marina. A good stroll with nature.

554824111.name: Well kept Melecon
554824111.author: a TripAdvisor user
554824111.reviewBody: 20 ft. Wide walkway along the Sea of Cortes. Much improved in the last 5 years. Beware of occasional dog deposits.

553744680.name: Great stroll
553744680.author: a TripAdvisor user
553744680.reviewBody: Beautiful walkway overlooking Sea of Cortez, marine sanctuary,marina and waterfront. Well lighted at night, beautiful sunrise and safe. Lined with hotels and restaurants and a beach at each end. Enjoyed by locals and visitors alike. A walkway to old square and mission connects to malecon.

553441188.name: Beautiful and relaxing!
553441188.author: a TripAdvisor user
553441188.reviewBody: The Malecon is a wonderful walk along the beach! Most of it is wheel chair accessible, the views are beautiful, and I\'ve been told that during whale season some can be seen from here! It\'s easy to get to and a must while in Loreto!

552819906.name: Casts a magic spell
552819906.author: a TripAdvisor user
552819906.reviewBody: This seaside walkway is charming, especially at night when the lights reflect off the water and the moon casts its glow. The Malecon has its own special charm that is hard to describe. It\u2019s something you feel. The giant boulders, boats tethered in the water, stone carving of Our Lady of Guadalupe, sea lion bronze statues and shimmering glow of street lights all cast a magical spell that will be long-remembered. I walked it with friends and walked it alone a second time and felt very safe both times.

550288153.name: Focal point of area
550288153.author: a TripAdvisor user
550288153.reviewBody: The malecon is about three blocks long with a divided road. The sidewalk is on both the ocean and land side. It is a clean area and well lit. Locals use this area as a place to drive and hang out. The land side has multiple nice restaurants places to stay. The walking street to the central plaza leads off from the malecon. The walk has lovely tree arbors and many shops and restaurants.

550260956.name: Well done Loreto
550260956.author: a TripAdvisor user
550260956.reviewBody: This is a wonderful way to enjoy a leisurely walk or a faster run, along the ocean. Great views of sea birds, neighboring islands, dolphins and local fishermen.

548486836.name: Watch the sun rise over Isla Carmen from the Malecon
548486836.author: a TripAdvisor user
548486836.reviewBody: Walking, running, enjoying the beach or visiting with the local fishermen, the Malecon has a lot of charm. When the water is warmer, swimming, paddle boarding, fishing, watching the sea birds particularly the brown pelicans diving for fish right in the marina. You can book fishing trips, and excursions to Isla Coronado to swim with the colony of sea lions that hang out there.. In town there are bicycles to rent. The Malecon is agreat place to start or end your day in Loreto.

546849240.name: Delightful Stroll
546849240.author: a TripAdvisor user
546849240.reviewBody: Easy stroll along the Loreto Bay with amazing handicapped access every few yards.  Beautiful views of the bay and the town.  Good daily exercise choice.

545128898.name: The Best Place to Walk
545128898.author: a TripAdvisor user
545128898.reviewBody: Every day we walked the Malecon. It extends from beyond the marina to the end of the beach-maybe a mile and a half. It\'s a nice flat surface-great for a walk or a short jog. The views are breathtaking; you can\'t get any closer to the Bay of Loreto. This is a lovely way to spend time with a nice breeze and the sea at your fingertips.

544920025.name: Great Place to Walk
544920025.author: a TripAdvisor user
544920025.reviewBody: the malecon in Loreto is a great place to walk and watch the sunrise. You can ride a bike if you wish and it is wheelchair friendly. Fun for the whole family!

543090763.name: Not much more than a cement walkway at the beach.
543090763.author: a TripAdvisor user
543090763.reviewBody: Nothing special. At the north end past the harbor, the Loreto sign and the sea animal trash cans were picturesque. A walk around the small town of Loreto was more interesting

541155762.name: Stroll along the sea
541155762.author: a TripAdvisor user
541155762.reviewBody: Nice paved walkway along the sea. Pleasant vistas especially at dawn and dusk. Offers benches along the way.

541015642.name: Enjoyed this beautiful site.
541015642.author: a TripAdvisor user
541015642.reviewBody: We spent three days in Loreto and stayed in town on the beach.  Probably the thing we enjoyed most was wondering around the quaint town and along the Malecon.  Not sure we\'ll be back, but we are glad for the quick get-away.

539429876.name: Simple, well-kept malecon
539429876.author: a TripAdvisor user
539429876.reviewBody: Loreto\'s malecon is beloved by locals and visitors.  It is wide, level, and appealing to look at.  It is well kept by the City and serves as a great place to run, walk or slowly stroll.  I particularly like to be out just before sunrise.  Seeing the fishers prepare for the day, followed by the sunrise is a favorite part of my visits to Loreto.  And, of course it offers expansive, beautiful vistas of the Gulf of California and its islands and wildlife.

538100697.name: A breath of Fresh Air
538100697.author: a TripAdvisor user
538100697.reviewBody: I love walking on the Malecon for the fresh sea air, the clean walkway and the pleasant people I meet on the way.  My perfect exercise place.\n

530829216.name: great views
530829216.author: a TripAdvisor user
530829216.reviewBody: a great little sleepy town but take a cab to the resorts out buy the airport about 25 minute ride for the best beaches.

530803880.name: Clean, Clean & CLEAN
530803880.author: a TripAdvisor user
530803880.reviewBody: The Malecon and all of the town of Loreto are so clean.  There is a great sense of pride in the residence of Loreto in keeping there community clean.  Easy to walk around and a very extensive Malecon area to walk and enjoy the scenery with friends or family.  Nothing on the beach side to interrupt your view or your conversations.  Plenty of places to sit and take it all in.

526095390.name: The Malecon at Loredo ...
526095390.author: a TripAdvisor user
526095390.reviewBody: The roadway has a beautiful ocean on one side and colorful shops and unique often covered patio restaurants and cantinas on the other side. Overall, a very pleasant way to start your day!

524130432.name: Lovely way to start your day- walk along the boardwalk
524130432.author: a TripAdvisor user
524130432.reviewBody: An excellent and laid back way to start or end your day with a view of the water.  Nice place to ride bikes, jog or just stroll down with a coffee or iced tea.  The malecon looks right over the water and is stretched between the beach on the S. end and the public beach and harbor on the N. end.

509851027.name: the town on a beach
509851027.author: a TripAdvisor user
509851027.reviewBody: The Malecon is the boulvard along the coast in Loreto. Everyone can be found walking and driving in the evening, as well as the stroll out on the pier. As it is such a lovely way to end a day in this region. Enjoyed by tourists and locals alike.

507091506.name: Nice improvements every year
507091506.author: a TripAdvisor user
507091506.reviewBody: Watching The Malecon change for the better every year has been impressive!  Always used by locals, the City has worked hard to make this Water Front walk something even the Tourists want to experience. Virtually every outing that took us close to the Water Front, somebody said, "let\'s walk back along the Malecon"! They\'ve spruced up the Marina area and put up statues, displays, etc so people could take pictures. Everyone in our group wanted a picture in front of the large multi-colored "LORETO" sign. Enjoy a pleasant walk on the Malecon after a nice meal. The people are friendly, the sights impressive, and you will feel more a part of Loreto!

504197100.name: PEOPLE WATCHING AT ITS BEST
504197100.author: a TripAdvisor user
504197100.reviewBody: locals venture out in the evenings for exercise and just relaxing. We\'ve met so many people just walking around. Everyone is so helpful  and will answer any questions u could ever have. Bien viaje

500429203.name: Very nice & clean.
500429203.author: a TripAdvisor user
500429203.reviewBody: The malecon is very nice and clean.  Not much to do, but pretty.  People around the area are very nice.

498958570.name: Walking the Malecon
498958570.author: a TripAdvisor user
498958570.reviewBody: Not much to see or do on the Malecon.  We came down here twice on our stay in Loretto (once for breakfast and once for lunch) not much going on.  It appears that two blocks South of the Mission hotel you can walk down a tree covered street that takes you to the Mission church and a few nice shops.  We found a thrifty ice cream shop close to the Mission church.  The Mission hotel which looks very nice and serves Starbucks drinks in their lobby.

497175409.name: Center of the city on its watery edge
497175409.author: a TripAdvisor user
497175409.reviewBody: A pleasant version of the classic malecon, lively (but not too) in the evenings, with the paseo and the auto cruising, cafes and restaurants nearby/above, and great sunset emanations from Isla del Carmen in the distance.

497071813.name: Sleepy town
497071813.author: a TripAdvisor user
497071813.reviewBody: Very few people were out and about along the Malecon and to our surprise there\'s no fish market although we found a local fisherman who had super fresh sea bass he sold us that was super delicious. He drives it all the way to Cabo to sell each week!

495183097.name: Great stroll by the bay
495183097.author: a TripAdvisor user
495183097.reviewBody: The 2 nights we stayed in Loreto we walked the Malecon in the evening after dinner and it was so relaxing and easy.  You see many families and couples walking the Malecon in the evening.

494533647.name: modern, well built, good walking close to water//
494533647.author: a TripAdvisor user
494533647.reviewBody: l have been  going to loreto since 1980/ Loreto is growing and improving each .new streets new buildings, new stores...the new promenade is very nice, great for walking with the ocean next to you...very romantic harbor with statues of whales etc//

488771812.name: Beautiful views
488771812.author: a TripAdvisor user
488771812.reviewBody: A clean, attractive place to walk, sit, admire the Sea of Cortez, the sunrise, watch crabs along the rocks. Directly across from many restaurants and hotels.

487965601.name: Nice for a stroll
487965601.author: a TripAdvisor user
487965601.reviewBody: Good anytime of the day to see the fishermen in action and view yhe black sand beaches. Catches the breeze so is nice after the heat of the mall.

487434672.name: Nice.
487434672.author: a TripAdvisor user
487434672.reviewBody: Enjoyable place to stroll or add some extra step count onto your pedometer.  Watch for Rooster fish or whites in the distance.  Plenty of eateries across the street.

485181030.name: Love it!
485181030.author: a TripAdvisor user
485181030.reviewBody: We love this place, relax to walked with family and hopped into the boat!  We also went nearby restaurant and other and really enjoyed to walk around this nice place.

484806952.name: A tradition in Loreto
484806952.author: a TripAdvisor user
484806952.reviewBody: Driving or walking the Malecon in Loreto Baja California Sur is a wonderful tradition!!!! People watching, the wonderful restaurants, shops it\'s just full of colorful beautiful Mexican culture!!!! It gets lively on Friday and Saturday nights, you might even see a wedding party joining in the line of cars!

478692798.name: Walking Loreto
478692798.author: a TripAdvisor user
478692798.reviewBody: The Loreto Malecon is more quiet than some but a beautiful walk from end to end on the Sea of Cortez. The "dry side" has shops, eaterys and hotels. The Sea side is a long open walkway connecting port on one end to park on other. The town itself moves off perpendicular to the walkway.

475597299.name: Stroll along & see sealife + marina
475597299.author: a TripAdvisor user
475597299.reviewBody: Great place to walk, bike ride & look at the Islas of Coronado & Carmen & some lovely restaurants too.

475419305.name: You can go running here during sunset
475419305.author: a TripAdvisor user
475419305.reviewBody: We went jogging here right before the sun set. It was a beautiful run ( although pretty busy).\n\nThe malecon is not too long. You can jog, walk here or only go to one of the awesome restaurants here and watch the sunset

474678295.name: It\'s a beginning...
474678295.author: a TripAdvisor user
474678295.reviewBody: This Malecon is in its\' infancy but it will come along.  It is new, clean, and leads to the pier where you can hire a boat for touring or fishing.  At the opposite end is a public beach.  It\'s a nice little walk along the water and on the opposite side of the street you can find a handful of restaurant/bars.  There\'s still even vacant property for sale so if you have the vision and the patience it\'s probably not a bad investment.  I can\'t help but wonder if Puerto Vallarta started out this way...(?)

474213953.name: Parking is good, plenty of bars, trips
474213953.author: a TripAdvisor user
474213953.reviewBody: We visited the pier to access boat trip. Price of trips here is good as is service, covered small boats with knowledgeable guide, provide food and drink.

471751626.name: Lovely Wheelchair-Accessible Waterfront
471751626.author: a TripAdvisor user
471751626.reviewBody: This is a wonderful seafront walkway, sandwiched between views of the magnificently steep Los Gigantes mountains and the Sea of Cortez and Isla Carmen. It\'s always a spotless and friendly place to stroll, and passersby usually exchange greetings. Don\'t miss a walk onto the pier; one never knows what surprises are waiting there. My first time there I saw two blue-footed boobies in all their glory!

470719814.name: about a mile long
470719814.author: a TripAdvisor user
470719814.reviewBody: clean and a nice walk - a little shorter than many but very, very nice. Passes by the marina and goes out to each end of this quaint town.

468996692.name: Look for blue whales during March
468996692.author: a TripAdvisor user
468996692.reviewBody: We strolled the malecon in March during Spring Break and were amazed to see blue whales right from the sea lion statue. They are pretty far out there but close enough to recognize them as the world\'s largest animals. Wow! This is an amazing place to watch sunset. Besides whales you may see fisherman catching triggerfish from the rocks, guys in pangas catching bait for the next day, and plenty of yellow footed gulls. Buy a beer at the kiosk for $.75 right next to the entrance of the marina.

468979343.name: Beautiful Boardwalk
468979343.author: a TripAdvisor user
468979343.reviewBody: Beautiful strolling along the beach. Views are incredible.  Historical old lighthouse is a huge landmark.

468172976.name: Love the Malecon
468172976.author: a TripAdvisor user
468172976.reviewBody: This is where life happens in Loreto. Watch the birds and the ocean. Enjoy the fishing boats come and go. Enjoy the beautiful sunrise. It\'s all here and it is great.

467916829.name: Lovely walk
467916829.author: a TripAdvisor user
467916829.reviewBody: We took a tender into the bay and walked along the Malecon. I love whale sharks and there was a sculpture of a whale shark by the port. The water lapping up on the rocks was relaxing. The birds were entertaining. It was a great walk and very relaxing.

467247662.name: Great Place for a Stroll
467247662.author: a TripAdvisor user
467247662.reviewBody: Loreto\'s Malecon (seaside walkway) is wonderful place for a leisurely stroll. It is pleasant place for walking any time of the day. You always manage to see old friends and familiar faces. And everyone is ready with a smile and a friendly "Hola". It is usually fairly quiet and peaceful. However during festivals, holidays and community events it can be quite the fun gathering spot. Also a great spot to sit on one of the many benches to read a book and people-watch. It is a must see for any visitors to Loreto! Even being a Loreto resident the Malecon never gets old.

466854096.name: Gorgeous View
466854096.author: a TripAdvisor user
466854096.reviewBody: Wonderful view of the ocean, very clean walkway. I especially enjoyed the giant Loreto sign. Loreto is a beautiful town free from most tourist traps. There is no one selling things on this walkway or yelling about water taxis. It is very relaxing and peaceful.

466317490.name: Stroll along the beautiful Malecon
466317490.author: a TripAdvisor user
466317490.reviewBody: I was only in Loreto when there was no wind, but I imagine it would be even more beautiful to watch a storm from this vista.  Sunrises and sunsets are enchanting looking over the Bay, turning around you look into the craggy mountains.  I also found the Malecon to be very clean and well taken care of.

466175516.name: Beautiful views
466175516.author: a TripAdvisor user
466175516.reviewBody: This malecon is the nicest I have ever seen.  It is right along the water with wheelchair accessibility.  It is very new and I think it is part of Loreto\'s commitment to create a visitor friendly town.  It makes a wonderful spot for a walk.

465147680.name: Perfect for a stroll along the sea
465147680.author: a TripAdvisor user
465147680.reviewBody: If you are looking to walk off one of the amazing Loreto meals, or just want to see how beautiful the Sea of Cortez can be, this is the place to walk. We saw pelicans, fish jumping, a herd of dolphins, and a blue whale spouting in the distance near the islands. Peaceful, relaxing, easy to walk.

463859124.name: Nice walkway
463859124.author: a TripAdvisor user
463859124.reviewBody: Lovely walkway along the sea.  Very clean and breezy.\nOne end ends in a park and the other at the pier.

463248651.name: Loreto\'s malec\u00f3n
463248651.author: a TripAdvisor user
463248651.reviewBody: Loreto has done a superb job of making their Malecon or broad pedestrian walkway along the water beautiful.  There are sculptures and art work along the way and also a iconic sign showing LORETO.

462473869.name: VERY NICE FOR THE FAMILY
462473869.author: a TripAdvisor user
462473869.reviewBody: The malecon is very family oriented with lots of little restaurants and hotels.  It has many small restaurants and a few souvenir shops.  There is a pedestrian walkway to LORETO CENTRO which is a plaza with neat restaurants, souvenir shops and the mission.  Great place.

461568797.name: A Beautiful Stroll
461568797.author: a TripAdvisor user
461568797.reviewBody: The Malecon appears to be fairly new.  The stroll along the shore is relaxing, breathing in the fresh air while watching the pelicans and seagulls gliding overhead is wonderful.  The view of Isla Carmen is picturesque.  Don\'t miss the seal sculpture at the end of the jetty.

460779188.name: Lovely walk on the Sea of Cortes.
460779188.author: a TripAdvisor user
460779188.reviewBody: Paved with flat "cobbles" - easy walking, and the sidewalk is on the water side.Like everywhere else in Loreto, the Malecon is squeaky-clean - no garbage lying around. This is the perfect early-morning activity for many, but just as wonderful later in the day.\n

459024768.name: Great Place for a Walk
459024768.author: a TripAdvisor user
459024768.reviewBody: We stopped in Loreto while on a cruise.  This is a great place for a walk and enjoying the seashore.  It is well maintained with some concessions on the other side of the road.  This was a great place to rest after a full day of site seeing.

458566858.name: Lots of Traffic Noise
458566858.author: a TripAdvisor user
458566858.reviewBody: Its nice to walk along this well made and maintained waterfront but just be aware that the road next to it is noisy with traffic. Try early morning sunrise time for the best experience.

457807665.name: Beautiful views of the Sea of Cortez
457807665.author: a TripAdvisor user
457807665.reviewBody: Very nice place for a quiet stroll. Clean and safe. Lots of things built in Loreto for the anticipated throngs of tourists who never fully made it here for one reason or another\nNice sleepy area of Baja, far from the tourist crowd.

455103046.name: One of the better sunrise of my life
455103046.author: a TripAdvisor user
455103046.reviewBody: I went to Loreto on September and I could watch one of the better sunrise of my life. The little town is very calm and safe. Landscapes are amazing between Gulf of California and La Giganta Mountains.

454635429.name: Well done Loreto city
454635429.author: a TripAdvisor user
454635429.reviewBody: What a beautiful place to stroll, morning noon or night. Hats off the crew that keep it all so pristine and are  sweeping up every morning and night you do a great job.

453373252.name: Congratulations Loreto!!! Lovely sea side walking zone !
453373252.author: a TripAdvisor user
453373252.reviewBody: The malecon is a perfect area to walk along and stare at the sea while enjoying a stroll along the seaside road of Loreto . The regional governments have obviously invested a lot of money on this project.  The pier is very well done and at the end their is a remarkable bronze statue of sea lions.  Another on the main malecon of a whale shark.  Oh yes!  Lovely clean bathrooms available also.  Loreto residents stroll around this happily and everyone we have met in Loreto are genuine , friendly , no pressure type people.  A really nice town with very unspoiled and gracious people !

452823661.name: relaxing
452823661.author: a TripAdvisor user
452823661.reviewBody: This malecon is very relaxing and \'old style\'. nothing to do with noisy La Paz or the crazy Cabos. A taste of real baja california sur!

451801945.name: Malecon
451801945.author: a TripAdvisor user
451801945.reviewBody: Love walking the Malecon every day for exercise and for the beautiful scenery.  The pelicans are definitely  very entertaining.

449741668.name: Great walkway along the waterfront!
449741668.author: a TripAdvisor user
449741668.reviewBody: Nice clean path that you can watch pelicans dive bomb for fish along with other birds. There are blue crabs on the rocks.

448942504.name: A Great Place for a Stroll
448942504.author: a TripAdvisor user
448942504.reviewBody: Loreto\'s malecon is a lovely place. We walk our dog their whenever we are in town, enjoying the scene at the small marina and the local life along the beach.

448706617.name: Clean, well lit, and safe
448706617.author: a TripAdvisor user
448706617.reviewBody: Walking along the Sea of Cortez on New Year\'s Eve was one of the most relaxing times I\'ve had in recent memory.  There was a lot of activity at the restaurants and bars, but walking along the Malecon muted the noise and gave the typical New Year\'s hubbub a filtered quality.  The area around the marina and south is clean, well lit, and level for walking.

446491661.name: Perfect for Biking
446491661.author: a TripAdvisor user
446491661.reviewBody: Loved biking the malecon at night.  lots of activity from locals and tourists.  nice sculptures of a whale shark and sea lions.

445672442.name: Stunning Views!
445672442.author: a TripAdvisor user
445672442.reviewBody: Very clean and modern walk. Totally felt safe walking in the area. There is a pier that can be accessed at the marina, which was spectacular.

444119903.name: A very pleasant way to "walk the beach" in Loreto
444119903.author: a TripAdvisor user
444119903.reviewBody: The Malecon is a well built stone and tile walk way that extends for approximately 1 mile from one end to the other.  It is very interesting to walk and watch the various birds and boating activity.  At one end the fishermen gather - you can book a fishing or sightseeing trip there.  There are several restaurants along the Malecon and provide several different options for dining.  We walked the Malecon from one end to the other a few times - it provides excellent exercise and a variety of views.

444058804.name: Nice stroll
444058804.author: a TripAdvisor user
444058804.reviewBody: Very happy to see that it is already completed. Like that you can stop and sit down and that it has ramps for wheelchairs. Not too long. Kept clean and inviting.

443358707.name: Quiet town with a great vibe
443358707.author: a TripAdvisor user
443358707.reviewBody: We watched a marathon finish at the Malecon then went to a small restaurant and had a really good breakfast for super cheap.  A very nice town to stroll around. Take in the historical buildings, they are a must see.

441249657.name: Nice Walking Area
441249657.author: a TripAdvisor user
441249657.reviewBody: Good for a waterfront walk, but pleasant sea air can be punctuated by noxious sewer gas which is vented onto the street.

441117443.name: Beautiful
441117443.author: a TripAdvisor user
441117443.reviewBody: Great place to walk, shop, sight see the beautiful sea, watch boats and cruise ships, and eat! There\'s even condos to check out if you\'re interested in buying property.

435731162.name: Beautiful Area
435731162.author: a TripAdvisor user
435731162.reviewBody: We were on a liveaboard diving our way down the Sea of Cortez and came into Loreto via the harbour at Malecon.\nWhat struck us from the start was how clean and well maintained the area was. It is a wonderful area to take a walk. We went into the restaurant area and after dinner took a walk along the promenade and then out along the breakwall. The Sea Lion sculpture is wonderful and well worth a visit.

433837672.name: Nice Area
433837672.author: a TripAdvisor user
433837672.reviewBody: The malecon is a great place for walking and the marina is convenient.   Lots of boats going out and walking distance to restaurants.  Nice views of Loreto Bay.

431926544.name: Beautiful
431926544.author: a TripAdvisor user
431926544.reviewBody: Such a beautiful place to walk or just sit and watch the world go by. It seems like everyone hits the malecon early morning for sunrise and evenings for sunset.

424721619.name: Pretty but smelly
424721619.author: a TripAdvisor user
424721619.reviewBody: The waterfront is very picturesque with the islands in view. It\'s peaceful and tranquil. The sea is usually very calm. At the corner near the Mission Hotel there is distinct sewer smell that can ruin the moment if the breeze is going the wrong way. The walk is very safe night or day.

424485719.name: Quiet, Clean, Relaxing, No Vendors
424485719.author: a TripAdvisor user
424485719.reviewBody: A pretty walk along the coast, no vendors, some restaurants with views. Would be great to have bikes or golf carts, but none that we found. Very quiet as compared to PVR. A few small beaches along the way.

391385228.name: Better Every Year
391385228.author: a TripAdvisor user
391385228.reviewBody: A walk along the Loreto Malecon gives you an opportunity to see small town Baja compressed into a few blocks along a spectacular view. Each year the town improves the experience! To the North of the marina, you see the Community enjoying simple family time. Go South, and to be inches from the water and a open view of Loreto Bay. The Malecon is where the community goes for: relaxation; young lovers to find privacy; to walk or jog, etc...and of course, to CRUISE! You can "see" the Malecon from many nice restaurants on the west side, but you won\'t "experience" it, unless you walk it!  I guess in one descriptive word, it\'s  "alive"!

390464862.name: Urgh
390464862.author: a TripAdvisor user
390464862.reviewBody: The shops in town were closed for the most part with the exception of 3-4 souvenir shops with faux mexi stuff made in China.  The malecon was a hot, dusty sidewalk with nothing noteworthy.

385301302.name: Walk along the Malecon
385301302.author: a TripAdvisor user
385301302.reviewBody: This a great place to spend some time. We walked along the sea wall everyday. It\'s a great place to build an appetite before lunch.

379060984.name: Love the views
379060984.author: a TripAdvisor user
379060984.reviewBody: It\'s a really nice place for a waterfront stroll.  The city of Loreto is very quaint, and their waterfront is a great draw.

376439498.name: Beautiful Views Everyday!
376439498.author: a TripAdvisor user
376439498.reviewBody: This walkway fronts the Sea of Cortez and goes along for approximately 1.5 miles. Walkers, runners, families, bikers...perfect for that leisurely stroll any time of day! Safe, we\'ll lit, clean and always a beautiful breeze! Delightful!

373162027.name: Beautiful Sunrise
373162027.author: a TripAdvisor user
373162027.reviewBody: Small, quiet, clean SAFE. I don\'t know if it\'s always like this but i was in Loreto the first week of May and the Malecon was clean and quiet. I went out for a walk every morning it was always clean it felt safe people were friendly a lot of locals out running or walking and like i said very friendly everyone looks you in the eye and greets you EVERYONE.  The people and the sunrise make the malecon a great place...

369681419.name: Gorgeous Walk Along the Sea of Cortez
369681419.author: a TripAdvisor user
369681419.reviewBody: We walked on the Loreto malecon or seawall from the Oasis hotel at the south end to the panga breakwater at the north end.   It may go even farther north but we don\'t know.   The malecon is wide and level and smooth, easy to walk on.   There were ramps which might make it wheelchair accessible.   Loreto is situated along the Sea of Cortez with several islands visible, including Isla Coronado and Isla Carmen.   Striking colours of the water and sky and islands on a sunny day...

367512570.name: Malecon has had lots of improvements.
367512570.author: a TripAdvisor user
367512570.reviewBody: Nice malecon.  Lots of bird life.  Was interesting watching the fishermen catching bait and their various methods.

367311731.name: great walks here
367311731.author: a TripAdvisor user
367311731.reviewBody: I walked the Malecon daily, saw the sun come up here and truly enjoyed the sights of the many birds taking advantage of the updraft. Large pelicans, frigate birds, and turkey vultures floated overhead. Huge crabs on the rocks below made for some great mindless viewing. Looking over to the various islands and enjoying the sea breeze made this a very relaxing place to be.

365796548.name: Wheelchair access and close to eateries and shops
365796548.author: a TripAdvisor user
365796548.reviewBody: Loreto was a port of call on our recent Princess Cruise. Unfortunately, this port requires a tender and my 80+ year old parents who have limited mobility were nervous to try to get in and out of the tender boats. If folks in wheelchairs can walk on and off with assistance, they can take their wheelchairs aboard the tender and Princess has staff specially designated to assist them in getting on and off. Once ashore, the malecon area has been well-marked with wheelchair accessible areas and it is a nice stroll close to shops and eateries. There is a beautiful new hotel called La Mission right across the street from the beach. We had hoped to have a drink there but service was horrible ... perhaps you will have better luck. Beware that some of the sidewalks on the side streets are not easily navigable with a wheelchair or walker, and many streets have cobbles. The center of town is only a couple of streets off the malecon and Mita Gourmet is a must-try restaurant. The gallery next door has incredible local photos ... for sale in large and post card sizes. Also recommend Caf\u00e9 Ole for breakfast. Don\'t miss a peek in to the Hotel Posada de las Flores which has a rooftop pool! The islands of area have some fantastic, uncrowded beaches and a  water taxi can take you and return to pick you up for a reasonable fare. Loreto also hosts a Blue Whale Festival... in 2016 it was in February.

365262894.name: Malecon heart of Loreto\'s sea side
365262894.author: a TripAdvisor user
365262894.reviewBody: Most of the day all is quiet on the Loreto Malecon but evening is a fun time to watch the locals and have them watch you.  Great area to look out at the sea and the islands or enjoy the view from a restaurant or pub.

365241827.name: Beautiful and Relaxing
365241827.author: a TripAdvisor user
365241827.reviewBody: Just a great afternoon of walking and enjoying the Sea of Cortez view.  Clean and long enough to really enjoy, wish to visit it a night one day.

363934718.name: Pleasant to stroll, bike, or drive.
363934718.author: a TripAdvisor user
363934718.reviewBody: The Malecon is a strip of hotels, restaurants, and ships across from the bay in Loreto, delightful to experience in the early morning, to watch the pangos leave with their fishing customers, or in the evening, to enjoy the sights of people strolling along before sunset. On the commercial side of the street, there are plenty of restaurants to pull you in with their wonderful aromas. The bay side is complete with a wide sidewalk for people to jog along, benches to rest and stare at the bay from, and the ever present seagulls and pelicans to entertain you. A most pleasant place to enjoy the atmosphere of Loreto.

359185065.name: Always interesting
359185065.author: a TripAdvisor user
359185065.reviewBody: The malecon in Loreto is often an interesting place to sit and watch. Sometimes people or could be whales, dolphins, or this year we were there when the stingrays were jumping by the hundreds. In the evening there is quite often an interesting cruise of vehicles. Worthwhile place to spend some time.

358285314.name: Lovely Water Views
358285314.author: a TripAdvisor user
358285314.reviewBody: Lovely view of the waters and surrounding islands.  Easy access to the local restaurants and touristy areas.

357714112.name: All Alone
357714112.author: a TripAdvisor user
357714112.reviewBody: We visited the Malecon on a amazing day in March and we were the only ones. Walked the whole strip and never met another soul. Although beautiful, there is really not much to do here.

355723641.name: Perfect for a leisurely walk.
355723641.author: a TripAdvisor user
355723641.reviewBody: The Malecon doesn\'t offer a lot of sights other than the beautiful water of the Gulf, but it is a nice way to breathe in some fresh air during a leisurely stroll along the water.

354393944.name: Gorgeous
354393944.author: a TripAdvisor user
354393944.reviewBody: Beautifully designed. Nice hotels and businesses. Lovely bay. Spotlessly clean as has been the rest of the city. Very friendly people. Can hardly wait to explore further.

354387577.name: Great sights and easy walking on the malecon!
354387577.author: a TripAdvisor user
354387577.reviewBody: We recently returned from Loreto.  Our hotel was across the street from the malecon.  We walked the malecon daily--sometimes in the morning for exercise, but usually later in the day to check out the marina, walk to happy hour or to dinner, or just to check out the sealife and birdlife!  It is used by many walkers--all were so friendly!

354216470.name: Fun, clean, great for bikes, walking, whale-watching
354216470.author: a TripAdvisor user
354216470.reviewBody: We have been all over Mexico. We really like this malecon because you can ride a bike, walk, or jog there and see whales. It is so beautiful. We saw workers sweeping and mopping the cobblestone streets near the malecon. There are many hotels and good restaurants right there. It is a tranquil, clean place.

353967626.name: Beautiful vista!
353967626.author: a TripAdvisor user
353967626.reviewBody: The Malecon is a paved boardwalk on the water front of the town of Loreto. It is quite picturesque, with fishing boats, pelicans and other ocean birds. If you are lucky you will spot whales during migration!

353588104.name: One of the best Malecons in Mexico
353588104.author: a TripAdvisor user
353588104.reviewBody: This Malecon or waterfront boardwalk is one of the best in Mexico especially for a town as small as Loreto.  Great walking ,  no time share sales or vendors harassing you and  an amazing view of the Sea of Cortez.

353441920.name: the heart of Loreto
353441920.author: a TripAdvisor user
353441920.reviewBody: We loved the night time cars, trucks and quads "cruising" down the Malecon. It is extremely clean being swept in its entirely daily. We heard and saw whales from the Malecon every morning. Watching the pelicans and fishing boats, not to mention the sunrises and sunsets become oart of our regular experiences during our 10 day stay in Loreto. Safe (flat and level sidewalk areas) for wheelchairs and baby strollers, unlike much of the other streets in town.  The Malecon is a lovely lovely place to take an early morning run, or stroll any time of day.

353432068.name: Very clean and peaceful
353432068.author: a TripAdvisor user
353432068.reviewBody: This is our favorite malecon.  It is very well maintained with beautiful views and a very enjoyable walk at all times of the day and evening.  We photographed stunning sun and moon rises.  Much quieter than La Paz.

350876777.name: Scenic walk
350876777.author: a TripAdvisor user
350876777.reviewBody: The Malecon is a nice walk next to the waterfront. You pass everything from private homes to restaurants and hotels. On the water side is a nice walking path past a rock wall and the marina. Nice views of the islands across the water and some mountains and hills in the surrounding area.

350603092.name: Peaceful and Well Maintained
350603092.author: a TripAdvisor user
350603092.reviewBody: The Malecon is lengthy, well maintained and follows the Bay.  The sunrise is beautiful and I overlooks the bay where depending  on the time of year you can see Blue Whales in the distance

350006000.name: A pleasant walk to see sunrise
350006000.author: a TripAdvisor user
350006000.reviewBody: The malecon here is smaller than that in La Paz. There aren\'t many sculptures as that in Laz Paz either. But Loreto is much smaller than La Paz too. A walk along the malecon is quite relaxed and pleasant. Better do it around 7am when the sun is going to show its face over the island.

349524054.name: LORETO IS LOOKING AFTER LOCALS
349524054.author: a TripAdvisor user
349524054.reviewBody: This malecon is barely used. I have no doubt that in the future this particular malecon will become a destination. The bay is beautiful, and a good walk from end to end. So why not 5 star? There is a distinct sewage smell in the center portion. I would hope this magical town could funnel the sewage smell somewhere else. Otherwise a beauty!

347188625.name: Enjoy a stroll on the Malecon
347188625.author: a TripAdvisor user
347188625.reviewBody: Nothing says Latin America like a Malecon.  Loreto\'s Malecon is a beauty.  It really got a sprucing up since Loreto was designated a \'Puebla Magica\' (Magic Town).  The boulevard runs 1 mile along the Bay of Loreto.  It is paved and has many benches to stop, rest, enjoy the birdlife and sealife.  Lots of locals do their morning exercise here. And... it is handicap accessible!

346868597.name: What a surprise
346868597.author: a TripAdvisor user
346868597.reviewBody:
This is not what we expected. Only better 
A great view
A great place to take pictures 
Clean 
Quite 
Friendly locals.  Lots of places to eat drink.  Coffee shops.  Augies is a must stop.  Great margarita and food.  Happy hour is busy and fun.

346637178.name: I love pelicans
346637178.author: a TripAdvisor user
346637178.reviewBody: Down by the harbor is so much fun. The pelicans seem to be in charge of the area. They ride with people on their boats as well as dive bomb for fish. Very entertaining.

345300150.name: Clean, well-groomed, pleasant, safe walk way along ocean
345300150.author: a TripAdvisor user
345300150.reviewBody: The malecon sits on the edge of town, bordered by the ocean with a nice beach and side walk and marina, then a 4 land road with restaurants, bars, and hotels lining the other side.  It was always clean, always beautiful, with families on the beach, or a few couples strolling, or with the fishermen waiting for their next customers to go on their pandas out to catch fish.  Always pleasant !!!!

344987452.name: Super clean and romantic...
344987452.author: a TripAdvisor user
344987452.reviewBody: Nice to walk during the evening. Place is spotless. Close to many eateries and Hotels and to the main Road (Hidalgo). Wheel chair accessible.

342142920.name: Great walk!  Lovely views!
342142920.author: a TripAdvisor user
342142920.reviewBody: Just a beautiful stroll along the Sea of Cortez in Loreto, Mexico.  The sculptures are magnificent!  There are also great little restaurants across the street from the Malecon...go and enjoy!

341552204.name: Breathtaking views!
341552204.author: a TripAdvisor user
341552204.reviewBody: Lovelyviews along the malecon, very well maintained and clean roads, sidewalks. Lots of places to eat, and close to City Center.

341501968.name: Very Picturesque
341501968.author: a TripAdvisor user
341501968.reviewBody: We visited from the cruise ship and walked along the Malecon from the tendering dock. There was a beautiful view of the Sea of Cortez and several statues along the way. The breeze was lovely and it was a nice relaxing walk.

339494401.name: beautiful and relaxing
339494401.author: a TripAdvisor user
339494401.reviewBody: Nice place to just stroll long and enjoy. Deserted in January and private. We just relaxed and enjoyed the views.

339017716.name: Beautiful walkway along the Sea of Cortez.
339017716.author: a TripAdvisor user
339017716.reviewBody: The malecon is a walkway that runs parallel to the Sea of Cortez.  It is a wonderful way to walk along the sea watching dolphins and sea cotters swim by.

338717319.name: Sea Walk delight
338717319.author: a TripAdvisor user
338717319.reviewBody: Walking the Malecon was one highlight of our day. There was a slight breeze, so very pleasant. We walked out to the end of the Malecon where the large bronze sculptures are located. On the way we stopped to take numerous photos of the ever-present pelicans, roosting on the boats, quite picturesque .

338200918.name: A rejuvenating view
338200918.author: a TripAdvisor user
338200918.reviewBody: Our hotel faces the Malecon so we walked and enjoyed the picturesque view everyday. The sea is calm, and the islands (Isla Carmen and Coronado) beyond provide perspective to its beautiful surroundings, especially in the morning. There are no beaches off the Malecon. There is a no-so-white-sand beach with palapas just beyond the Harbor/Marina to the north. The best white sand beaches and snorkeling are on the islands beyond, just a boat ride away.

337328170.name: Nice place for a run
337328170.author: a TripAdvisor user
337328170.reviewBody: We spent some time in LaPaz before and after our kayak trip and I had a nice run on the Malecon in the morning. It made me a bit sad. Clearly, when it was built, there was an expectation that LaPaz would be a bigger destination but the strip along the Malecon is a bit scruffy. Still, I felt perfectly safe running alone in the morning.

335247550.name: Malecon Loreto
335247550.author: a TripAdvisor user
335247550.reviewBody: Nice. Great view. As Loreto is small you are able to walk along the Malecon in 15 minutes. Stroll along the harbour and enjoy the sunset. You will find some restaurants right at the malecon or in the main street. Everything is small in Loreto. So enjoy the silence far away from the crowded centers of tourism. You get closer to the Mexican life instead.

334708043.name: Gorgeous views
334708043.author: a TripAdvisor user
334708043.reviewBody: Great place to sit on a bench, drink a cerveza and watch the boats, lots of restaurants and bars across the street.

334337035.name: Pretty
334337035.author: a TripAdvisor user
334337035.reviewBody: A lovely place to walk around. It is very clean & well maintained & has a wide selection of restaurants , bars & a wonderful coffee shop.

333765184.name: about 1/5th the size of La Paz\'s, but nice
333765184.author: a TripAdvisor user
333765184.reviewBody: There are swim beaches at both ends of the Malecon, and hotels at both ends and by the Marina.  Public restrooms are hard to find--check the Marina

332768571.name: Makes for a walk with a great veiw of the Sea of Cortez
332768571.author: a TripAdvisor user
332768571.reviewBody: This is not a long Malecon, but it is very clean and there are no sellers that bug you to buy their wares. Gorgeous views of the Sea of Cortez, seagulls, pelicans and other birds abound. Fun to be had by all. There is a statue with 3 Seals at the end of the pier that you can climb all over and get some great pics too.

330557616.name: Great place for a stroll daytime or evening
330557616.author: a TripAdvisor user
330557616.reviewBody: It is great to walk along the malecon or sit on one of the benches and watch the waves break against the rocks. Loreto is a safe place to walk in the evening.

325726647.name: The malecon just gets better and better
325726647.author: a TripAdvisor user
325726647.reviewBody: Take a morning walk or evening stroll along the Malecon. Very safe with numerous places to stop and eat or drink. Every time I visit, I walk the Malecon numerous times. The views are spectacular and the bird life incredible

324468665.name: Walk and See
324468665.author: a TripAdvisor user
324468665.reviewBody: The Malecon is a lovely walk along the Sea. From one end to the other the views of the neighboring islands are pleasing to the eye. You are also able to rent bikes and peddle the Malecon.

322532083.name: An amazingly clean pavered walk from end to end of the water front.
322532083.author: a TripAdvisor user
322532083.reviewBody: Well cared for and beautiful. It was always clean and in the morning you found locals and tourists using it for exercise and in the evening families gathered to walk, snack and enjoy the waterfront.

321186901.name: Entire Malecon beautiful.
321186901.author: a TripAdvisor user
321186901.reviewBody: This Malecon overlooks the Sea of Cortez with Carmen and Coronado Islands in the distance.  On one end the marina offers a pier that juts out with statues of Sea Lions and a great whale, and real pelicans diving for bait leftover from the fishing boats.  At dawn and dusk, the sun shines pink on the water, and pedestrians, both locals and visitors, walk, bike, and push strollers.  The Malecon continues south with benches to rest, and borders pretty, safe neighborhoods and a few small restaurants with delicious food.  At night in August, I also watched lightning storms in the mountains from the malecon lit with street lamps, we swam under the moon when it\'s cooler.   It\'s a gorgeous place with no commerciality whatsoever; just the occasional yacht parked off shore.

318001733.name: Speaking of Cortez views
318001733.author: a TripAdvisor user
318001733.reviewBody: A great walk or run for exercise with the beauty of the Sea of Cortez at your side.  Although not a long walk or run for the enthusiast, it is definitely worth taking.

310010736.name: The "Waterfront Heart" Of Loreto
310010736.author: a TripAdvisor user
310010736.reviewBody: All roads seem to lead to the Malecon and here you will find loads of restaurants & bars choices from which to enjoy the terrific ocean views, the marina with metal sculptures of sea lions and whale shark (and where you can charter a boat), wander the boardwalk and purchase a treat from one of the mobile vendors, or just sit and enjoy the views - it\'s all here.  My wife and I would often find ourselves seated at a 2nd floor table in one of our favorite restaurants "people watching".  Good fun and when the tide is high and the swells/waves are just right, you can get wet on the walkway and of course those amusing Pelicans never cease to entertain when the fisherman throw them left over bait at day\'s end - \'like old men tossing back shot glasses of bourbon!

299010872.name: wonderful views
299010872.author: a TripAdvisor user
299010872.reviewBody: so nice to have a nice, clean, wide area to walk or bike along the beautiful Sea of Cortez. Every morning we saw workers out sweeping and cleaning the sidewalk of the Malecon.  They take great pride of this walkway they have built.

296370259.name: Relaxing stroll.
296370259.author: a TripAdvisor user
296370259.reviewBody: Fun to walk and see the locals as well as checking out the fishermen returning with their catch of the day!

294886600.name: The Malecon with an Incredible View
294886600.author: a TripAdvisor user
294886600.reviewBody: The Malecon was very inviting for us to enjoy the shopping, restaurants and ocean.  It was a great place to enjoy a drink with sunset and the sounds of the ocean.

293677090.name: Next time
293677090.author: a TripAdvisor user
293677090.reviewBody: Small Malecon where you can get boats chartered and take you to the islands and or fishing. We didnt do either this time around but we will next time.

293171317.name: Lovely walk!
293171317.author: a TripAdvisor user
293171317.reviewBody: Wonderful walk to take in the breezes in the evening. Lots to see at the waterfront and some great bars and cantinas. Good resteraunts

291545082.name: Romantic
291545082.author: a TripAdvisor user
291545082.reviewBody: This malecon is well maintained and great for an evening walk to top off a great dinner at one of the local restaurants.

289694263.name: Revitalized Malecon in Loreto
289694263.author: a TripAdvisor user
289694263.reviewBody: A great place to take in the community in the evenings. Recently revitalized, the Malecon is great for exercising and just relaxing. Also a perfect pack-drop for the Hotel La Mision.

289691684.name: Living large in Loreto.  We snorkel right outside our front door and walk the malecon regularly.  It\'s wonderful!
289691684.author: a TripAdvisor user
289691684.reviewBody: We live on the malecon and have for the pasts 16 years.  We love it and especially love how much the local people use this great resource.

287473656.name: Walkway and port in Loreto
287473656.author: a TripAdvisor user
287473656.reviewBody: This is an amazing waterfront walkway. It is all very new and well maintained. Lots of great places to eat and drink all along it.

286593674.name: Lovely Loreto
286593674.author: a TripAdvisor user
286593674.reviewBody: We visit Loreto annually from our home in San Felipe.  One of the main reasons I love this city is the SHOPPING!  My husband loves the restaurants and we both love walking the Malecon!

283009460.name: Pretty
283009460.author: a TripAdvisor user
283009460.reviewBody: The malecon is kept very clean and the vegetation arches are beautiful. Lots of nice shops and friendly merchants.

282912915.name: Cruizin
282912915.author: a TripAdvisor user
282912915.reviewBody: Cruzin is still in style here and we did it for a bit, unfortunately to long since when we stopped the restaurant we wanted was closed...

282777491.name: great view
282777491.author: a TripAdvisor user
282777491.reviewBody: the walk way has been updated, nice clean and always good to visit a must when in loreto. look a round for the best fishing price, they tend to over charge if they feel they have the opportunity.

280783361.name: Beautiful and serene.....
280783361.author: a TripAdvisor user
280783361.reviewBody: Loreto is a quiet and peaceful little town with a lot of little gems to discover.  Be sure to check out the Hotel La Mision for lunch.  Fantastic!!!!  Also, they have a pizza special every week, I think it is  on Tuesday nights.

278359457.name: Very nice
278359457.author: a TripAdvisor user
278359457.reviewBody: So clean and beautifully done!  Bravo Loreto.   \nThis was recently renovated in 2012 and is kept very clean.  Great area to walk, with benches to sit, shady areas along the way, and nice sculptures of sea life near the marina.  Lots of restaurants and bars along the area as well.

277717708.name: beautiful views of the Sea of Cortez
277717708.author: a TripAdvisor user
277717708.reviewBody: Nice length for a good walk on the Malecon. Lots of resturants across the street as you walk. Excellent views of the Sea of Cortez. End of the Malecon is the marina.

275534498.name: Night Stroll
275534498.author: a TripAdvisor user
275534498.reviewBody: The Malecon is the main feature of Loreto. Great place to meet locals, relax and people watch; you won\'t be disappointed

275360416.name: Very new clean walkway along the bay shows the enormity of the bay and the islands in the distance.
275360416.author: a TripAdvisor user
275360416.reviewBody: Very clean and new walkway along the bay with opportunities for some high end and local flavor restaurants.  Cute trash containers along the way, see photo.

273204509.name: The Walkway In Loreto
273204509.author: a TripAdvisor user
273204509.reviewBody: The Malecon is a happening place throughout the day. Locals walk it in the morning for exercise. You can see that it is a main thoroughfare  through out the day, Lots of people cruise the area in the evening.

271217252.name: Upgraded!
271217252.author: a TripAdvisor user
271217252.reviewBody: The Malecon,the Marina and the Malecon street have been upgraded over the past couple of years and are very nice.  It is a very nice walk from the public beach/marina area to the Oasis Hotel, with nice benches and lights along the way.

270732022.name: Updated walk along the water
270732022.author: a TripAdvisor user
270732022.reviewBody: Lovely place to stroll though beware the handicap cuts which drop off from the sidewalk. Great views of Carmen Island.

270615912.name: Nice place to walk...
270615912.author: a TripAdvisor user
270615912.reviewBody: It is a beautiful, clean, and safe place to walk in Loreto.  There are many benches for resting and some interesting statues.  There are many restaurants and shops off the side streets of the Malecon as well.  Nice place to stroll.

268384553.name: A Perfect Reflection of the Town
268384553.author: a TripAdvisor user
268384553.reviewBody: The Loreto Malecon is a lovely waterfront walk. The leisurely pace of the town is reflected by the uncrowded and relative sedate nature of the place.  The Marina pier has several large sculptures that are fun to see and watching the pelicans, fishermen and boats is fun. Boat tours of the area are also available.   A series of restaurants adjoin one another towards the opposite end of the Malecon, several of which have excellent ratings. Several tree-shaded pedestrian walkways lead towards the town cathedral and squares. \n\nThe Malecon is clearly a source of pride for the town and draws a cross-section of its people.  It is safe, lovely, and somewhat sedate. Lovely, though.

267322237.name: Just a sidewalk along the water
267322237.author: a TripAdvisor user
267322237.reviewBody: Really not much to talk about. Well maintained walkway with an excellent view over the harbor. A very pleasant short walk.

266937256.name: Nicely done
266937256.author: a TripAdvisor user
266937256.reviewBody: Very attractive, always clean and safe waterfront with plenty of bird watching. Many attractions near by including cafes and coffee spots.

265353696.name: Nearly new, very nice sculptures
265353696.author: a TripAdvisor user
265353696.reviewBody: A nice safe place to stroll the waterfront, casual shopping, dining and hotels. Easy access to the beach.

264071701.name: Nice stroll, particularly at sunset and evening
264071701.author: a TripAdvisor user
264071701.reviewBody: A pleasant, scenic walk along the waterfront. Well-maintained path, easily a mile long or more. Great views of offshore islands, diving pelicans, and the local evening promenade. Typical of the layed-back, uncrowded, very friendly, and safe Loreto environment.

262190154.name: Nice, but could do without all the cruising
262190154.author: a TripAdvisor user
262190154.reviewBody: The Malecon is set up to be a beautiful waterfront walkway. Unfortunately, loud cars & motorcycles felt it necessary to zoom by & rev their engines. Other than that (the noise pollution), it was a great place to walk and enjoy the gorgeous Sea of Cortez.

262137084.name: Lovely walk with great views
262137084.author: a TripAdvisor user
262137084.reviewBody: We were very impressed with this walk along the bay. Pretty, clean and easy to enjoy. Our complements to the citizens of Loreto. They got this tourist locale right!. A must see when you visit the historical district. An easy ten minute walk from the entry to the district.

261547350.name: Beautiful place to stroll along the water
261547350.author: a TripAdvisor user
261547350.reviewBody: We were entranced by the hundreds of birds that showed up every day to dive for their supper: brown pelicans, terns, cormorants and the amazing blue footed boobies were abundant and always entertaining. Also a great place to find boats to take out to go to Coronadoo Island or to see the Blue Whales.

260943048.name: A beautiful spot to watch the sun rise
260943048.author: a TripAdvisor user
260943048.reviewBody: Masses of pelicans come here to dine. You can get close and personal to watch them dive. Great fun! The malecon is in a very safe area and has benches where a person can sit and watch the world go by.

259178376.name: FUN
259178376.author: a TripAdvisor user
259178376.reviewBody: Beautiful, safe and fun! We rode our bikes day and night, pet dogs, watched so many birds - perfect.

258380825.name: Walk along the beach
258380825.author: a TripAdvisor user
258380825.reviewBody: This is a sidewalk that parallels the oceanfront. It has benches and statues and plenty of water bird life.

255139884.name: Best walk in town
255139884.author: a TripAdvisor user
255139884.reviewBody: We jump out of bed early daily to walk on the Malecon and experience the opening of the day (sunrise) along this gorgeous walkway! A must do in Loreto! Sunset also prime time here...

254961326.name: Super clean!
254961326.author: a TripAdvisor user
254961326.reviewBody: Visited in November 2014. I found the waterfront to be very clean. Don\'t ride your bike on the pier though. I was yelled at by the guard there for doing so, even though I saw someone else earlier riding a bike there. Just a heads up!!

254037215.name: Malecon
254037215.author: a TripAdvisor user
254037215.reviewBody: Newly remodeled structure along the waterfront - makes for a nice morning or evening walk.  Safety doesn\'t seem to be an issue, everyone is very friendly.  Fun to watch the Pelicans and gulls diving straight into the water for food.

253390280.name: Walking the Malecon
253390280.author: a TripAdvisor user
253390280.reviewBody: The cruise ships TENDER into Loreto, and at the pier is a lovely seaside walk on the Malecon.\nYou can go swimming right there near the pier.You can walk the 5-6 blocks  length of the Malecon,\nwhich has stores and restaurants across the Street. This is a real town, not just for tourists. It\'s only a few blocks  to the city center, which has a lovely, old church, and many stores to shop at. Enjoy a  nice Mexican town.

252167796.name: Eh?
252167796.author: a TripAdvisor user
252167796.reviewBody: I can\'t help but compare our Malecon in Loreto to the one in La Paz.   First of all, there has been a significant upgrade to its previous life.   But when I bring my chick-magnet British Lab, it is rare to see a whole bunch of people there.  In many ways it fits Loreto, our one stoplight, sleepy  Baja town.   But it is not La Paz with all the commercial attractions, mariachi bands on Saturday night.  Oh yeah, the scenery.  A chance to see Coronado and  Carmen Islands up close.  Breathtaking, yup.

251691388.name: Chili Relleno in Puff Pastry!
251691388.author: a TripAdvisor user
251691388.reviewBody: Four of us went for dinner and 3 of had the chili relleno, which is one of their specialties. It\'s ground beef in a chili pepper cooked in a puffed pastry with cilantro cream sauce. YUM! My husband had the sea bass, and he couldn\'t have been happier. Lovely setting on the square. A tip: none of the dinner restaurants we went to in Loreto have what Americans would call fast service. Have a drink and an appetizer while you\'re waiting!

250268110.name: The beautiful malecon
250268110.author: a TripAdvisor user
250268110.reviewBody: The upgrades are done and it looks great. Cleaned and maintained daily, the malecon serves as a great place to watch the water, people and water fowl. Runners and walkers use it daily for their exercise

250257306.name: Nice place to walk and enjoy the view...BUT...
250257306.author: a TripAdvisor user
250257306.reviewBody: The Malecon looks overall nice..you can have a good walk with a  view...see the Pelicans..eating and flying all the time...But the place smell really bad in some places. And over town and inclusive in the Malecon you can see dangerous holes and looks like nobody cares..someone can be really hurt over there.I mention the issue showing photos to our hotel hostess and she said was going to get in touch with the city..But what happens. Why nobody sees the problem in town..The big hole in El Malecon is just in front of the Hotel Mission Loreto.

248852732.name: Bracing sea walk
248852732.author: a TripAdvisor user
248852732.reviewBody: Open views of the Sea of Cortez across the bay, with lots of interesting sea birds to be observed - pelicans, blue-footed boobies, terns, frigate birds, all close to the charming small harbor.

247921675.name: Beautiful Sunrises and Pelicans putting on a show
247921675.author: a TripAdvisor user
