247921675.reviewBody: Very clean and well kept.  The sunrises are very beautiful especially on a broken cloudy day.  In the marina section you can watch Pelicans dive bomb to catch fish.  There was no hordes of salespeople targeting tourists the time we were here and we didn\'t encounter any of the bad odors that others have reported.

247366966.name: Good place to take a walk
247366966.author: a TripAdvisor user
247366966.reviewBody: We were in Loreto on breezy days, so there was not much of a crowd on the Malecon, a wide strip of sidewalk and well paved road right next to the waterfront.  There is a faint smell of sewer, but it did not take away from the beauty of the location.  Great fun was had by our family watching all the pelicans dive into the water as they fished for their meals.  We enjoyed watching the pedestrian traffic go by when having coffee and breakfast at a restaurant located on the 2nd floor of La Mision Hotel.

246904630.name: A Pleasant Walk/Jog
246904630.author: a TripAdvisor user
246904630.reviewBody: Day or night, the Malecon (ocean front walk) is the hub of activity in Loreto.  It is not uncommon to see walkers & runners in the early morning hours, as well as boats and tourists heading to the marina for departure.  In the evening, the many restaurants and night spots make this the place to be, as well. It is short enough that almost anybody can walk the full distance in an outing.

246382769.name: Wonderful place to watch the sunrise
246382769.author: a TripAdvisor user
246382769.reviewBody: We would buy a cup of great coffee that the Sea Coffee and sit and watch the sunrise...wonderful place to just gaze and absorb the ocean activity

242129491.name: All day
242129491.author: a TripAdvisor user
242129491.reviewBody: There\'s something happening on the Malecon at all hours of the day and night, so it\'s a great place for people-watching excellent for walking and jogging too.

240043968.name: Sunrise walks..
240043968.author: a TripAdvisor user
240043968.reviewBody: A beautiful place to admire the outlines of the islands at sunrise.  Take your camera!  And wander into the Marina and enjoy the sculpture of the sea lions.

239585938.name: A nice face for Loreto.
239585938.author: a TripAdvisor user
239585938.reviewBody: The malecon wasn\'t quite complete during our first visit in October 2013 but was finished when we returned a year later. A great place to walk and enjoy the sights. Very nice addition to Loreto.

239246055.name: Clean beautiful walk
239246055.author: a TripAdvisor user
239246055.reviewBody: It\'s a nice clean, safe walk along the shore. Food establishments across the way, but a chance to just enjoy some tranquility without being pestered to buy anything. Slow down and enjoy!

238068158.name: Malecon sightseeing
238068158.author: a TripAdvisor user
238068158.reviewBody: Walked the Malecon daily, great vista for the islands of Loreto. Watched the crabs and fish, boats and birds! Peaceful sunrises.

235432804.name: Upgrades Completed and Clean Up Underway
235432804.author: a TripAdvisor user
235432804.reviewBody: The new additions to the malecon and the harbor area have only increased the town\'s beauty.  The whale shark sculpture and the one of the group of sea lions are very realistic.

233542526.name: new
233542526.author: a TripAdvisor user
233542526.reviewBody: it is fairly newly renovated, great place to sit and look at the sun rise,(sun rises on the ocean their) have coffee or icecream

233290759.name: Nice
233290759.author: a TripAdvisor user
233290759.reviewBody: Despite the recent Hurricane the community was out in force to make sue the lovely stroll was clean and litter free.  Very nice view and the stroll is great.  You can walk from the Marina to the end of town.  Well lit clean andwell maintained.

226760482.name: Nice place to walk, but not much else.
226760482.author: a TripAdvisor user
226760482.reviewBody: View was very nice and the Malecon was pretty, but there wasn\'t much else around. Mostly hotels on the other side. Not as pretty as many we have seen.

224124273.name: Great improvements!
224124273.author: a TripAdvisor user
224124273.reviewBody: The malecon is beautiful after all the improvements that have been made! There are over-walks and benches for viewing the sunrise or sunset, side walks are complete with ADA ramps, and street lights are up. The only suggestion is to somehow get rid of the sewer gas at the intersections.

214733792.name: Great to see it finished!,,
214733792.author: a TripAdvisor user
214733792.reviewBody: Was here in 2008 on a cruise and they were building the Malecon then along with some small hotels. Now we have come back with the same cruise line and what a wonderful surprise at how beautiful, charming and they developed the Malecon. Such nice strolling at sunset along the walk.

214313193.name: Finally!
214313193.author: a TripAdvisor user
214313193.reviewBody: After years of upheaval Loreto has created a lovely waterfront.  Perfect for a stroll or jog it has a couple statues and sitting areas.  Very photogenic.

214092846.name: Perfect place for a stroll
214092846.author: a TripAdvisor user
214092846.reviewBody: Very nice place to walk or ride a bike. It is cobblestone so I would not recommend a skateboard or rollerblades. Very family friendly with people sitting out enjoying the beautiful scenery.

213702182.name: Great for morning and Evening Strolls
213702182.author: a TripAdvisor user
213702182.reviewBody: It was great to see that the construction is finished. Its a fantastic place for your walks and the waterfront views are not to be missed.

212890314.name: Fun watching the pelicans dive for food!
212890314.author: a TripAdvisor user
212890314.reviewBody: The malecon in Loreto is so picturesque and beautiful. It\'s fun to walk along it watching the pelicans dive for food and the boats sail by.

211943669.name: mellow
211943669.author: a TripAdvisor user
211943669.reviewBody: A low key, pleasant stroll along the water. The marina has the most activity and some fun statues. Great place to bike ride too.

209325809.name: Great way to end the day!
209325809.author: a TripAdvisor user
209325809.reviewBody: It\'s great to watch as folks come out and walk or cruise the picturesque Malecon after the sun and heat go down.

208994397.name: Beautiful!
208994397.author: a TripAdvisor user
208994397.reviewBody: Very clean! Beaches raked and streets cleaned at night! No venders or beggars! Playground for kids! The marina area is very picturesque !

207395280.name: Nice place to view the bay
207395280.author: a TripAdvisor user
207395280.reviewBody: Nice to have a place to sit and enjoy looking at the bay and marina. Took a bus trip to the historical area. Very nice. Easy to get to.

207116341.name: Not memorable
207116341.author: a TripAdvisor user
207116341.reviewBody: There are a number of nice hotels and restaurants on the Malecon if one was there for fishing which seems to be Loreto\'s reason for being.  There are few tourist shops streets, sales persons are friendly and not aggressive, there is a well stocked super mercado for food and supplies. We have been to other coastal Mexican cities in Baja and the mainland and found the Malecon as well as the rest of the city not memorable.

205785104.name: Beautiful Sea of Cortez
205785104.author: a TripAdvisor user
205785104.reviewBody: The malecon is a great way to experience tranquillity. It is very clean, safe (patrolled at night);benches along it to be able to  and enjoy the sites and the sea. The only negative aspect was the ATV\'s ,very loud, that careen up and down. Very few, but annoying.

205408737.name: Grab a beer, walk it, and people watch.
205408737.author: a TripAdvisor user
205408737.reviewBody: After everyone gets off work, the sun starts to set, and the fish have all been cleaned, here come the cruisers.  Babies hanging out of windows, kids with twelve 6x9\'s stacked up in the back of their extended cab 1989 nissan, and no shortage of 14-40 year old whistling and hollering at any thing with a vagina walking the malecon.  Usually if you (the husband, boyfriend, or father) whistles back, blows a kiss and winks at them you get a smile and its all good.  You get  to see the same people 6-10 times as they burn gas driving back and forth.  Afterwards, they all park at different spots and check out each others rides.  Last time we went, my brother in law and I hung out with them and drank beer while they showed off their hoopties.  \n\nThere are nice benches to watch all of this go down and the weather is usually great at sunset.

201728481.name: Walking the Malecon
201728481.author: a TripAdvisor user
201728481.reviewBody: Wonderful improvements made to the Loreto Malecon....and so nice to see the town folk enjoying it and using it at all times of day.  Magnificent views of the islands and in the evening, if you happen to be there during a full moon, it\'s one of the best places to be.

201702418.name: Not much to do
201702418.author: a TripAdvisor user
201702418.reviewBody: Not much to do but walk around, or sit and watch the waves.  Not horrible, but a little on the "bland" side of things.

200506993.name: New malecon is wider and handicap accessible.
200506993.author: a TripAdvisor user
200506993.reviewBody: My father-in-law came down with his battery operated scooter and loved that he could go to the malecon on his own with no assistance.  He would motor on ahead whenever we would walk the malecon to the marina or go along side us whenever we walk to the town plaza.

198698789.name: Really nice area to walk around
198698789.author: a TripAdvisor user
198698789.reviewBody: There are a couple funky smells along the walk but for the most part its great!  They did a great job, sure its not 100% finished but its great!\nWe\'ll be back and like this last trip we\'ll walk the Malecon daily, usually a couple times.

197172815.name: Stroll after dinner
197172815.author: a TripAdvisor user
197172815.reviewBody: A beautiful place to stroll after dinner with a view of the mountains and the sea. A nice way to begin or end the day.

196695479.name: Beautiful walk
196695479.author: a TripAdvisor user
196695479.reviewBody: Loved walking this every day and enjoying the peacefulness of Loreto. Our last day we saw a huge cruise ship and smaller boats bringing passengers to shore.

196655297.name: Daily walk on the Malecon
196655297.author: a TripAdvisor user
196655297.reviewBody: Great place for taking a stroll or a brisk walk. Stunning views of the Sea along the entire \'board\'walk (actually cement). Benches for sitting to enjoy the view at points along the way. Appropriate lighting. Kept very clean.

195593916.name: Walking the Malecon
195593916.author: a TripAdvisor user
195593916.reviewBody: Beautiful malecon with excellent view.  Newly updated with many places to sit and enjoy the view or people watch.  One end went to the pier and the other ended near a hotel with several hotel and restaurants along the way.  A great way to get morning exercise with a stroll in both directions.

194469476.name: Seaside Stroll
194469476.author: a TripAdvisor user
194469476.reviewBody: The Malecon is a seaside walk where a lot of restaurants and hotels are.  It is so nice to grab a latte (Sea Coffee) and stroll the Malecon - breathe in the Baja pace of life!

193792031.name: Sea of Cortez View
193792031.author: a TripAdvisor user
193792031.reviewBody: The Malecon at Loreto is a beautiful walk with a view of the sea and the Marina, as well as directly fronts the town of Loreto.  This Mexican town on the Baja is our favorite and as we visited it for a second time we were reminded that the friendly people, quaint shops, clean beaches and sun will bring us back again.

191432434.name: Beautiful
191432434.author: a TripAdvisor user
191432434.reviewBody: The Malecon in Loreto is absolutely beautiful.  It runs along the oceanfront and passes a beach with some palapas, a small marina and several hotels and restaurants.  The views are beautiful looking out at the islands in the distance.

191098610.name: Well designed
191098610.author: a TripAdvisor user
191098610.reviewBody: Mexico prides itself on their Malecons and the pride is evident here. It is well designed to accommodate walkers,runners,bikes and is wheel chair friendly  and just nice to look at.

190052521.name: Lovely walkway
190052521.author: a TripAdvisor user
190052521.reviewBody: This walkway is right along the water and gives you great views of the islands and the Sea of Cortez. Restaurants are just across the street.

190050673.name: Nothing on it
190050673.author: a TripAdvisor user
190050673.reviewBody: No shops\u2026 so don\'t think this is like Puerto Vallarta and you shop the malecon  - it\'s a nice stroll.

189782995.name: Beauty by the sea!
189782995.author: a TripAdvisor user
189782995.reviewBody: Large well paved walkway and in great repair making for a carefree walk along the sea. Great place to bird watch!

189085395.name: o.k.
189085395.author: a TripAdvisor user
189085395.reviewBody: as others have said, a work in progress. I liked the sea lion sculptures and the marina, many pelicans swopping about.

187447084.name: Walk to your heart\'s delight
187447084.author: a TripAdvisor user
187447084.reviewBody: The malecon in Loreto really makes the town.  Loreto suffered greatly from the downturn in tourism after 2008 but the central government\'s investment in the seashore makes this little town worth the time.  It\'s a great place to walk, sit, picnic, talk to locals.

186483604.name: Beautiful view, not much to do there
186483604.author: a TripAdvisor user
186483604.reviewBody: I love walking on the Malecon.  The view of the Sea of Cortez is fantastic, especially at sunrise when the sun comes up over Carmen Island.   You can see fish jumping out of the water and lots of birds.  The Malecon is a great place to walk, but don\'t expect to do much more than that there.  There really aren\'t any shops and only a few restaurants.

184007173.name: The Malecon of Loretto.
184007173.author: a TripAdvisor user
184007173.reviewBody: The Malecon of Loreto or the sea walk is just wonderful. We walked here at least twice a day during our visit. The locals and tourists walk and run this boardwalk. Great for couples or the whole family. You can watch the sea birds dive and the fishing boats come and go.

180804225.name: In progress but coming along
180804225.author: a TripAdvisor user
180804225.reviewBody: We walked the Malecon daily, saying hello to the local fishermen and other strollers and enjoyed several of the restaurants along the way.

172553601.name: Nice walk, nothing amazing.
172553601.author: a TripAdvisor user
172553601.reviewBody: This boulevard, the malecon, along the water has just been completely remodeled. It\'s nice to walk along the water, and at the end of the malecon you can find the marina where you can take a boat to go on a 3/4 hours trip to the Coronado island, which is the best part of visiting Loreto! See my review on the trip! Enjoy!

170590816.name: When it gets finished ...
170590816.author: a TripAdvisor user
170590816.reviewBody: I guess one of the contractors bombed out and left the job unfinished and workers unpaid.  \n\nI will warn you.  Loreto is a place that you must be very careful when you are walking.  The pit falls are numerous.  From thorny plants that reach out and attack you, holes where electrical covers are missing, sidewalks that drop off for driveways, large bolts sticking up that don\'t have a street light yet and there is no sidewalk next to the businesses, you have to walk in the street!  BUT, I loved Loreto.  Friendly people, good food, great fishing.

170213935.name: Great for an evening stroll
170213935.author: a TripAdvisor user
170213935.reviewBody: With fantastic views of the mountains of the coastal islands, Pelicans, Frigate Birds and crabs on the rocks, there is plenty of entertainment. There are also interesting sculptures and the marina.

168334099.name: Upkeep anyone??
168334099.author: a TripAdvisor user
168334099.reviewBody: The new malecon looks and feels similar to the old malecon. The new artwork is very nice and adds a touch of class.  Although less than one year old there are many broken lights and fixtures throughout.  Based on past experience these things will not be fixed any time soon.  I hope we are wrong.  Still a great place to take a walk in the evening and enjoy the fresh breeze and people watching.

167723236.name: Great Update
167723236.author: a TripAdvisor user
167723236.reviewBody: Last year they were redoing the malecon while I was there.  They did a very nice job and it has a lot of character.  It goes all around the marina and has sea lions in bronze, one eating a yellowtail.  That may have not been the best choice.

161845275.name: Great place to watch the sunrise
161845275.author: a TripAdvisor user
161845275.reviewBody: Loved getting up early and taking the short bike ride to the Malecon to see the sunrise. It was absolutely beautiful! The malecon is nicely landscaped and has a wide walkway along the waterfront where you will encounter many people getting their morning exercise.

161037594.name: Windy
161037594.author: a TripAdvisor user
161037594.reviewBody: Windy, hot and NO shade or trees during day along the malecon. Might have been a good location to watch the sunset

159441981.name: Getting better.
159441981.author: a TripAdvisor user
159441981.reviewBody: They have been working on the Malecon in Loreto for a few years.  We were there in Feb. 2013 and there has been some progress made.  The walkways are better and well lit. (although the lights coming up from the walkway are really bright and blind you).  When it is finished it will be nice.

156449457.name: Pretty views, funky smell
156449457.author: a TripAdvisor user
156449457.reviewBody: The Malecon has nice views of the water and some nice hotels/restuarants. However, the town has some sewage issues and it seems to pool in the pipes under the Malecon. Depending on the time and breeze, there can be odors in different spots. I think the best place to stay is in and around the plaza. It\'s only two blocks to the water.

155658453.name: Lovely and real attempts to keep it clean
155658453.author: a TripAdvisor user
155658453.reviewBody: It was a lovely experience strolling down the family-friendly malecon There are some small beaches with palapas occupied mostly by locals.  Not the nicest beaches, but convenient and okay for a family outing.

155027779.name: Nice place for a walk or run
155027779.author: a TripAdvisor user
155027779.reviewBody: They are extending the malecon to the edges of town. It will be fantastic when it\'s completed. Cab\'t wait to go back there and stroll along the Sea of Cortez

152679802.name: Hopefully soon to be completed.
152679802.author: a TripAdvisor user
152679802.reviewBody: Not to much to do now to finish off this refurbished frontage to Loreto. When completed it will be a lovely place to take a stroll anytime. Not sure how it will affect the properties/restaurants alongside the Malecon as the traffic will probably return.

151837505.name: Almost ready
151837505.author: a TripAdvisor user
151837505.reviewBody: The malecon shows promise of what it will be.  It was largely completed in early February, and it will no doubt be a major attraction for Loreto

151433314.name: It will be, very good, when it finally gets completed!
151433314.author: a TripAdvisor user
151433314.reviewBody: The Malecon will be a wonderful walkway all along the beach when it is finally completed.  It actually has cut-outs and ramps for wheelchairs, so everyone can enjoy it.  At this time, you have to be very careful not to trip over stuff or get poked by rebar and wires sticking out all over the place.  But be patient; it will be a most stunning addition to this delightful little town.

151091905.name: Not yet finished, but looking good
151091905.author: a TripAdvisor user
151091905.reviewBody: The Malecon, or \'boardwalk\' is not yet finished, but it sure will be nice when it is. Much of the work of laying cobblestones or tiles is being done by hand.

150382071.name: Nice Change
150382071.author: a TripAdvisor user
150382071.reviewBody: I was in Loreto a few years ago and saw dirt streets (not an issue for me) and a little bit of the new Malecon but they have done so much work to the town and Malecon it\'s beautiful now

150219044.name: Under Construction
150219044.author: a TripAdvisor user
150219044.reviewBody: They are repaving the entire Malecon, but the restaurants are still open. It is complete in front of La Mision. It will be GORGEOUS!

149998803.name: Construction
149998803.author: a TripAdvisor user
149998803.reviewBody: It will be nice when it is done but it pounds like it is taking forever. It is nice to walk on and with the fisherman come and go.

149472955.name: Not quite done
149472955.author: a TripAdvisor user
149472955.reviewBody: What was finished is Superb!!  They are doing a great job here!!  It is a diamond in the ruff.  When complete, will be fabulous!  Carry a flashlight at night...

148649818.name: jan/13 still in the middle of construction, but will be nice when done.
148649818.author: a TripAdvisor user
148649818.reviewBody: This is a major project that when done will be awesome, but at present its in the middle of a real mess. no driving and been like this for almost 3 years.  i would give it one more year.

147877338.name: So far so good
147877338.author: a TripAdvisor user
147877338.reviewBody: The malecon is in a state of constant construction. We enjoyed the completed sections. The south end was being worked on when we were there. It was nice to see the folks in town and visitors walking the completed sections early to late. Hopefully they will complete it soon.

147269363.name: Currently under construction
147269363.author: a TripAdvisor user
147269363.reviewBody: It is currently under construction, can\'t really walk along it at this point.  It will be beautiful to walk down once it is completed

146877936.name: Attractive
146877936.author: a TripAdvisor user
146877936.reviewBody: It is taking years for the completion, but the finished parts look gret. It is becoming a destination, especially in the evening for walking. It is lovely.

144792304.name: Malecon at Sunset
144792304.author: a TripAdvisor user
144792304.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the fabulous view walking along the Malecon at sunset or sunrise if you are an early bird, it is beautiful!

143730822.name: Under renovation and washed out.
143730822.author: a TripAdvisor user
143730822.reviewBody: Give this one sometime as it\'s under renovation and has had major washout from the hurricane. Consider visiting the beaches either near Mulaje or south of Loreto for better beaches and vistas.

143162154.name: Main street
143162154.author: a TripAdvisor user
143162154.reviewBody: The malecon is under reconstruction. It will be nice when it is completed. Until then it is a construction zone.

141264681.name: They still working on upgrades
141264681.author: a TripAdvisor user
141264681.reviewBody: The Malecon has a few restaurants. It will be nice once is done, There was lots of construction while we were there, dusty pot holes and no traffic could drive thru

140705310.name: Malecon still under Construction
140705310.author: a TripAdvisor user
140705310.reviewBody: We were in Loreto in September 2012 and the Malecon is still under construction--they started construction around January 2012 and they are less than 1/2 done,  It has really affected the businesses right on Malecon--You can bet this will not be complete until sometime in 2013. But Loreto is still a wonderful place to visit--quaint little town--good restaurants--good fishing and good diving.  Not that many tourists--which is not a bad thing for those that do visit

140601196.name: Malecon Reconstruction
140601196.author: a TripAdvisor user
140601196.reviewBody: While the Malecon is under major construction, what is complete is spectacular.  Love it now because there are no cars, just foot traffic.  Loreto should make that permanent.

137169975.name: Loreto Malecon
137169975.author: a TripAdvisor user
137169975.reviewBody: Awesome waterfront walk. I really like the old world charm and the island is so beautiful from the malecon.

136159249.name: Under Construction
136159249.author: a TripAdvisor user
136159249.reviewBody: The malecon of Loreto has promise.  Right now it is completely torn up and the roads are a mess.  One is unable to drive on most of the malecon stretch except along the beach near the Marina.  I saw progress in our visit and I think the finished product will be worth the mess.  There are a few businesses which front the malecon, it seemed that many were shut down due to construction.  I hope that more will move into the area as it becomes more attractive for vendors and tourists to frequent.

134940902.name: nice little marina
134940902.author: a TripAdvisor user
134940902.reviewBody: Didn\'t really do much at the Malecon as the south half of it was being resurfaced. But what we did like was that it lead us to the marina where we noticed the parked pangas and their drivers nearby. It was there where we struck a deal to get a ride out to beautiful Coronado Island. You can also catch a boat to take you out fishing for the day. We enjoyed how relaxed and friendly our experience was. Before going out they conveniently have a little office where you can purchase a park permit to spend the day on the island and I believe they also carry fishing licenses. Next to it is a snack store where you can purchase snacks & drinks to take on the trip.

134239102.name: Under constrution
134239102.author: a TripAdvisor user
134239102.reviewBody: Malecon is under construction.Hard to get to Marnia streets are closed.

132924050.name: Beautiful & Quaint
132924050.author: a TripAdvisor user
132924050.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous sunsets, very, very low traffic and serene sea. Check out the locals fishing by the marina...

132898535.name: Loreto Malecon
132898535.author: a TripAdvisor user
132898535.reviewBody: They are currently working on the malecon so construction noise abounds.

132195618.name: A Nice Short Walk
132195618.author: a TripAdvisor user
132195618.reviewBody: The Malecon in Loreto is a lovely walk and only takes a short amount of time. The views of the Sea of Cortez is beautiful and the walk also takes you buy restaurants and a few hotels that are located a across from the Malecon. We were there in June, so a morning or evening walk would probably be the best. But do go and enjoy the view and the wonderful, sea breeze.

128433357.name: Walk along the beach is always great
128433357.author: a TripAdvisor user
128433357.reviewBody: Walk along the beach is always great... even when the street is torn up.  Loreto is a wonderful place to spent a few hours or a few days.

126935770.name: Under construction - great views
126935770.author: a TripAdvisor user
126935770.reviewBody: The Malecon walkway is under construction; partway finished. Nice views of the sea of cortez. Lots of benches to observe from -- some facing the sea, some facing the town.

126873253.name: North end is under construction.
126873253.author: a TripAdvisor user
126873253.reviewBody: The walkable part was quite pleasant.  There is basically no surf in Loreto but lots of ocean to look at.

126491128.name: Loreto Malecon is a highlight of the town.
126491128.author: a TripAdvisor user
126491128.reviewBody: The Malecon extends from the Oasis Hotel at the south end all the way up to the Marina at the north end.  It is a beautiful wide walkway with pretty wrought iron benches placed along the way.  The views of the Sea of Cortez are spectacular at any time of the day or evening.  Once can spot birds diving or just sitting atop the water.  Sunrises and sunsets are never boring to watch from here as well.  There are restaurants on the main road that runs north/south here so it is natural to eat outside on a patio and look out to the sea.\nAt the moment in Loreto, the road alongside the Malecon has bee torn up for reconstruction.  Hopefully it will be completed in a timely manner as driving back and forth has been disrupted and it is no doubt annoying.

126288444.name: Malecon walks
126288444.author: a TripAdvisor user
126288444.reviewBody: Malecon was nice to walk on in the mornings mostly, before doing other activities. They are redoing the southern part of it, but most of it is in tact.

125867725.name: beautiful but somewhat torn up
125867725.author: a TripAdvisor user
125867725.reviewBody: Lots of beauty and great potential; however being torn up and extensions not yet done

124486274.name: Wonderful
124486274.author: a TripAdvisor user
124486274.reviewBody: We walked on the Malecon for sunrise and sunsets and in between.  It is just wonderful.

123496077.name: quiet, beautiful and sometimes windy
123496077.author: a TripAdvisor user
123496077.reviewBody: I liked it all.  It is the Sea of Cortez and a view of the islands in the Marine Park.

122743313.name: Loreto Malecon
122743313.author: a TripAdvisor user
122743313.reviewBody: Beautiful & peaceful Malecon.  A great view of the bay as you walk along the malecon.  This is old time Mexico!

121715316.name: Beautiful walk
121715316.author: a TripAdvisor user
121715316.reviewBody: This is a beautiful walk way right along the waterfront. At night it is the place where the local people hang out and sell snacks.

121701636.name: Marvelous Malecon
121701636.author: a TripAdvisor user
121701636.reviewBody: breathtaking walk that we did every morning! At low tide, fun beachcombing; lots of water birds!

120601939.name: malecon
120601939.author: a TripAdvisor user
120601939.reviewBody: uncrowded easy to bike and walk run on great view Birding near the harbor is excellent

74231113.name: Loreto is small town. It is interesting...
74231113.author: a TripAdvisor user
74231113.reviewBody: Loreto is small town. It is interesting to go there by night since it\'s too hot during the day, and watch the night and ships that come near the Malecon. There are families or friends playing volleyball or just chill at the beach. When going to Loreto don\'t forget to go to La Michoacana. They have the best ice cream and waters in town. No expensive and very clean and confortable!

648033284.name: Whales, birds and moederately rough water
648033284.author: a TripAdvisor user
648033284.reviewBody: A boat trip into park by tour boat is an excellent idea. Our trip included a number of sightings of great blue whales. No breaches, just the great roll of backs breaking the water. The bird rookeries are excellent and the best sight is the brown pelicans dive bombing into the water head first after fish. The islands are wild and rough so the scenery is enchanting. The water can be very rough since it is usually quite windy. Overdress for the ride since it can be rather cold on the water.

646155505.name: Boat trip around and on ISLA CORONADO was our super experience with Fransisco on El Pajaro .
646155505.author: a TripAdvisor user
646155505.reviewBody: We had a great time the 4 travellers from one hotel with Fransisco as our captain. His fluent explanations and answers in English made it really comfortable . The day was glorious and the  water was clear for snorkelling. He  served up homemade burritos as a snack. Many dolphins cavorted around the boat and leapt right out from the sea once or twice! It was a great photo day as the sun was out In a clear blue sky. A warm interesting walk on a  well marked trail was followed by lunch,and then snorkelling around the shore.

631923109.name: Layers of beautiful blue waters
631923109.author: a TripAdvisor user
631923109.reviewBody: Instead of booking a trip from your hotel or travel agent, walk down to the pier and hire a panga to take you out to the Marina Park for 3-5 hours.  You will save about 40% in costs.  You can also order delicious burritos (etc.) from the food truck and drinks from the pier store for much less money.  Dolphins and sea lions, cormorants and frigates surround your boat as you motor around Coronado Island.  You stop on clear water, sandy white beaches to snorkel and picnic.  Be sure to have the boat captain talk you into stopping for cocktails and more delicious food at the most northern house along the shore.  He will wait for you while you enjoy a family owned restaurant that is reached only by boat. Go early in the day before the wind kicks up and makes the water choppy.

627837133.name: Danzante Tours
627837133.author: a TripAdvisor user
627837133.reviewBody: Thanks again to the amazing knowledge and experience that our tour guide and Rib Boat captain Ramses the tour of the Mexican Archipelago in Danzante Bay is one you don\u2019t want to miss. You will get an eco- tour around two of the 5 islands in Danzante Bay. Then you have an hour snorkeling with Ramses pointing out both flora and fauna of the islands. This tour group works out of the only hotel resort in the Marine Park Villa Del Palmar.

623284561.name: The reason to visit Loreto
623284561.author: a TripAdvisor user
623284561.reviewBody: We paid $65 to one vendor and $75 to another to tour two islands in this park. It is wonderful for snorkeling, and good for diving. We swam near sea lions, lunched at a spectacularly beautiful beach, and saw amazing lava formations and cactus. Of the two vendors, Land & Sea was far superior and cheaper.

622210113.name: Next pass up a boat ride to a remote beach in mexico.
622210113.author: a TripAdvisor user
622210113.reviewBody: Really, don\'t ever pass it up! We have done quite a few, always wondering if it\'s worth the money spent and are always beyond satisfied. We booked a trip from an outfitter next to the bank at the Centro. Bryan made excellent recommendations of things to do and ultimately booked our party of 3 on a panga out to Isla Coronado. We were able to be picked up right from our hotel because it was right on the beach.  Our Captain Juan and guide Adrian were INCREDIBLE. They are a young crew and extremely talented and great hosts. I cannot speak enough for their hospitality. They listened to what we wanted to do and made recommendations for the trip. We snorkeled and saw an amazing variety of fish in Crystal clear water. The crew was able to fish along the way (ask about tacking on your fishing permit) and catch some fantastic fish. If you\'re lucky you can land Mahi. We saw the sea lions and the blue foots before we continued onto the beach where we had a cooler of soda and water with lunch prepared. We swam and snorkeled at the beach and saw more fish (parrot, angel, trigger, grouper and a star fish) including a large school of fish. There were manta rays peppered throughout the bay too. After leaving we had dolphins swimming past the boat. If you want the ULTIMATE experience, ask about the amazing restaurant on the beach that you get to by boat where they will prepare your fresh fish the way you like it while staring over the beautiful water. This was truly an experience I will never forget and largely because of our crew - Juan & Adrian who were just incredible and hard-working guys.

595611191.name: An absolute treasure for anyone to experience!
595611191.author: a TripAdvisor user
595611191.reviewBody: The love the locals have for this National Treasure is amazing! They not only love to share it with others, but teach us how best to take care of this environment that is rich with wildlife, crystal clear waters and some of the most impressive views our amazing planet has to offer. The younger the kids the better, I\'ve found no better way of teaching our children how to take care of our amazing planet!

570231619.name: Beautiful
570231619.author: a TripAdvisor user
570231619.reviewBody: Breathtakingly beautiful park.  Better managed than most.  Sight seeing, whale watching, snorkeling etc.  Small fee to enter, bracelet to wear to show you you are legally in the park.

563232108.name: Great dive getaway
563232108.author: a TripAdvisor user
563232108.reviewBody:
Loreto is a lovely quaint little town on the water in a very geologically unique place.
The sea of cortex and the baja have such dramatic sites. Red mountains, desert, volcanic formations, and beautiful blue water.  Famous for fishing but lots of great dive spots.
Water 82-84 July to October. 
Inexpensive quality hotels, great food.
Just 1.5 hours by jet service to modern airport 5 minutes to Hotels.
Can't beat this place if you live in Southern Ca.
Love loreto

561400200.name: beautiful sites, nature and vistas
561400200.author: a TripAdvisor user
561400200.reviewBody: we enjoyed this area full of beauty. pelicans, cormarants, dolphins, whales, and beautiful fish of all sorts.

555201234.name: Underwhelming.
555201234.author: a TripAdvisor user
555201234.reviewBody: The boat tour itself was great.  Saw Sea Lions and three members of our group snorkelled with them.  If you stop for lunch, be prepared.  They say there is a bathroom but you are safer to go in the bushes.  We were travelling with two seniors and this was difficult.  Also while the beach is lovely where the boats stop, there is very little shade and no seating.  Fine for the younger agile folks.  Just some things to consider if travelling with a mixed group.  Also, having been to several locations in Mexico, we agreed that Loreto wasn\'t as pretty as other areas.

550285654.name: Lovely area
550285654.author: a TripAdvisor user
550285654.reviewBody: We took a dive boat into the park. It is,a large area where there is some fishing in the area. It is also a location for scuba diving and snorkeling. The water was very clear and we got to get very close to the sea lions on land while on the boat. The divers also got close to the sea lions in the water.

524131214.name: Take a Guided Tour
524131214.author: a TripAdvisor user
524131214.reviewBody: The Marina park really has no way to be accessed unless you take a tour or rent gear on your own but a guided tour is probably the best option unless you are an experienced boater or kyaker.  The water is beautiful, warm in the summer (80 degrees plus), and boasts lots of wildlife.  We did the boat tour around Coronado Island and it was well worth it.

505308033.name: Amazing tour and experience with Capt. Rammses
505308033.author: a TripAdvisor user
505308033.reviewBody: We had an amazing multi island tour which included snorkeling and some dolphin interaction which was the highlight for our girls. Captain Rammses is knowledgeable about the area and works extremely hard to meet the needs of each individual tour and person within the tour. The amount of marine life we saw in a half day trip and while snorkeling was incredible and the water was the clearest and most beautiful that we have ever experienced. The entire experience was amazing from start to finish. Roberto was very helpful in the sales office in getting us set up with the right tour to meet the needs of our family and Captain Rammses stole the show with his knowledge and efforts on the tour! I would highly recommend if staying in Loreto or Villa Del Palmar.

488770549.name: Spectacular!
488770549.author: a TripAdvisor user
488770549.reviewBody: We went to Isla Coronado twice.  We saw manta rays, colorful fish, a blue-footed booby, frigate birds, pelicans, dolphins, sea lions, and a couple of orcas!! Don\'t miss this incredible place!

485971522.name: Second only to the Galapagos!
485971522.author: a TripAdvisor user
485971522.reviewBody: The Marine Park of Loreto continually showcases its sea life.  Fin whales and dolphins frolic most of the year as well as an abundant sea life of crustaceans, seals, sea lions, sea birds, and other smaller fish.\n\nThe winter months are especially good when the humpback and blue whales visit the pristine waters.

477435610.name: Blue whales galore!
477435610.author: a TripAdvisor user
477435610.reviewBody: Small boat touring on a calm morning is an adventure, especially during whale season. Take your camera and water/sunscreen.\n

471131818.name: Amazing Wildlife abounds
471131818.author: a TripAdvisor user
471131818.reviewBody: Beautiful Marina, clean safe and a stroll worth the time to walk out to the end and see the beautiful views and sculptures.

442984885.name: Visit to Marine Park with Captain Fracisco Martinez
442984885.author: a TripAdvisor user
442984885.reviewBody: Captain Martinez took our family out in his super panga to the islands. His boat is both quick and comfortable. We spent half day circling Coronado Island and snorkeling at a sandy beach .  There were many birds and sea life including pelican, sea lions, puffins, Dolphins and many other birds.  The snorkeling eas at a shallow portion of the  island which hand a nice sandy beach.  Plenty of fish to see in very shallow water appropriate for kids of any age!  Captain Martinez dropped us off and went fishing for an hour.  We all had fun.\n

434405555.name: Capt Rammses with Danzante Tours is the Bomb!!!
434405555.author: a TripAdvisor user
434405555.reviewBody: Clearest cleanest waters can be found throughout the Marine Park we saw osprey, cormorants, pelicans, blue heron, turkey vultures and magnificent friggit birds as well as great sea life including 20-30 different types of fish, anemones, multi colored starfish, eel. 2 snorkeling spots one on Danzante Island and one on Carmen. Rammses is a local and knows and loves these islands and this bay. If paradise is what your looking for this is it. \n

369623724.name: Worthwhile -
369623724.author: a TripAdvisor user
369623724.reviewBody: Enjoyed the trip itself out into the Sea of Cortez - snorkeling - lots of fish - beautiful water - rugged, rugged country.  Saw dolphins aplenty and sea lions.  However, our guide - Ramzis (sp?) was somewhat questionable.  Too much balderdash.

348615658.name: Beautiful!
348615658.author: a TripAdvisor user
348615658.reviewBody: Well, it\'s not called Jacques Cousteau\'s playground for no reason!  Spectacular ocean wildlife and views, not to mention great snorkeling and protected inlets, etc.  \n

338240913.name: Great place for bird watching
338240913.author: a TripAdvisor user
338240913.reviewBody: I spent some time at the seals sculpture just watching the pelicans do coordinated dive bombs in the marina for fish. It is quite fun to watch. In addition, there are a small number of blue-footed boobies amongst the cormorants, sea gulls and pelicans standing on the rocky breakers. Be sure to look for the blue feet when you motor out of the marina. It was delightful. \ud83d\ude04

335447958.name: Beauty in the Baja
335447958.author: a TripAdvisor user
335447958.reviewBody: Highly recommend the boat tours - we had a great time with Danzante Tours (captain Danny) and with Wild Loreto we got to see a sea lion colony!

335204487.name: Visit the World\'s Aquarium
335204487.author: a TripAdvisor user
335204487.reviewBody: My husband and I have been flying to Loreto for many, many years.  What keeps bringing us back?  Great food, awesome people and the breathtaking Sea of Cortez.  J. Cousteau said, the Sea of Cortez is the world\'s aquarium.  So true.  We love to snorkel and the sea shares some of the most amazing things to see.  If you come down to snorkel, make sure you bring a fish card to help you ID all the amazing sea life.  It seems like each time I snorkel, and new "friend" comes to visit me in the warm waters of the Baja.  Underwater cameras?!?!  Oh yes, by all means.  The park is protected so remember to play by the rules and keep this magical body of water the World\'s Aquarium.

321944303.name: Beautiful marine park
321944303.author: a TripAdvisor user
321944303.reviewBody: We went on snorkeling trips, scuba diving and a sunset dinner cruise. we were able to see sea lions and were surrounded by a pack of dolphins

299015418.name: amazing Sea of Cortez
299015418.author: a TripAdvisor user
299015418.reviewBody: the men in our group fished for 3 days and caught dorado and yellow fin tuna.  The sea was calm and amazingly blue.  We also spent an afternoon snorkeling and that was also fantastic!

282777710.name: Fishing is top in the world
282777710.author: a TripAdvisor user
282777710.reviewBody: Talk about catching fish by the buckets, yes that good. Don\'t go by the first price, always shop around, some tend to over charge when they see the opportunity.

278364043.name: Go out with Captain Rammses of Danzante Tours
278364043.author: a TripAdvisor user
278364043.reviewBody:
YOu will have the BEST experience!  We took Capt Rammses tour of Coronado Island which leaves out of the marina and we had an amazing day.
Captain Rammses has a wonderful quick and very comfortable new boat that will get you around the bay and around the islands to see some amazing sites.  He is a local and is very knowledgeable about the area, the sea life and fauna and flora of the area and surrounding islands.  He is also very concerned about the environment and maintaining the bay in pristine condition and even stopped the boat several times to pick up trash that was floating.  
We started out by meeting up with a large school of dolpins and he allowed us to interact with them for quite awhile and told us the best spot to sit to get great photos.  We then went around Coronado island and he pointed out different formations and told us the history and ecology of the area and animals on the islands. No one but me wanted to snorkel so I did not want to make everyone wait for me however snorkeling is definitely part of the tour and I would recommend doing it as the water clarity and sea life are amazing in the area.  We ended the day with a nice hour of beach time on Coronado island with some for the clearest water and beautiful white sand beach!  I did snorkel in this area and was able to see flounder, eels, starfish, and lots of juvenile fish.  
Plenty of beer, soda, water, and box lunch for the 4+ hr tour 
Call Captain Rammses for an unforgettable day.  (you can book directly if staying at Villa Del Palmar) or 011 6131095655 from stateside

270732512.name: Pelican watching paradise
270732512.author: a TripAdvisor user
270732512.reviewBody: Great place to watch fishing boats come in and get a feel for real life in Loreto. Pelicans feed here and provide entertainment for bird lovers.

257676277.name: Go with R.O.W. trip (extended)---google for info
257676277.author: a TripAdvisor user
257676277.reviewBody: independent trips are problematic in that boat owners think we so want to touch these potentially friendly whales that they are in too much pursuit...they harass them, crowd them, circle them....the whales can dive and escape BUT this behavior is bound to lead to them being LESS friendly, more overwhelmed and less likely to want to bring their babies for an experience with too many surrounding boats.  if you do go independently PLEASE CURB YOUR DRIVER, MAKE SURE HE UNDERSTANDS YOU DO NOT WANT TO HARASS THESE GENTLE CREATURES. \n

201085093.name: World class everything
201085093.author: a TripAdvisor user
201085093.reviewBody: The bay at Loreto to Puerto Escondido is a world heritage site with some of the best fishing, diving and snorkelling. Lots of beautiful resorts, hotels and casitas available with varying prices. Incredible sunrises and sunsets giving the area the title Vermillion Sea, because that is what happens at those times. Food, people, vistas, and many things to do from sports fishing, all kinds of swimming, mountains to explore for a memorial vacation. I like it so much I have moved here. This is a destination and covers many miles, not a pass through visit.

184919558.name: Fantastic place for adventure
184919558.author: a TripAdvisor user
184919558.reviewBody: The marine park is a fantastic place for adventure both above and below the waters surface. The protected waters allow visitors to see what a healthy Eco system can really be like with pods of dolphins that number into the hundreds as seen while boating out to the different islands. Below the surface you can see schools of fish that are tens-of-thousands strong.

159091444.name: Baja is Our Galapagos Islands
159091444.author: a TripAdvisor user
159091444.reviewBody: Never have I been on an aventure with so many spectacular things to see and do.  Fom fishing to snorkel, eco adventure to kayking, paddle boarding and culinary tasting. It felt like an Ernest Hemingway fishing story.

151091789.name: The Bay is teaming with life!
151091789.author: a TripAdvisor user
151091789.reviewBody: I have seldom been to an area that is so full of life. The Marine Park has been protected for over 10 years, and the locals say the wildlife is healthier than ever. Even if you don\'t fish, you will likely see dozens or hundreds of playful dolphins, sea lions, sea birds, schools of bait fish and turtles. The abundance of fish is amazing and ever changing.

147199257.name: Beautiful!
147199257.author: a TripAdvisor user
147199257.reviewBody: You almost can\'t go out on the Sea of Cortez here at Loreto without seeing groups of playful dolphins swimming alongside you boat!

146189395.name: Amazing
146189395.author: a TripAdvisor user
146189395.reviewBody: The marina is spectacular and unique sea life lives amongst the waters.  Love the fact it is being protected.  The memories are just as incredible.

136159422.name: Beautiful little beach in town
136159422.author: a TripAdvisor user
136159422.reviewBody: Nice little shade palapas along the course of this public beach.  Bathrooms were nonexistent at present, but perhaps will be added as the Malecon construction continues.  I see signs of lots of development and improvement to this little town thanks to many work corp projects funded by the Mexican Federal government.\n\nA few ice cream and ice treat vendors are along the street and sidewalk, but plan to bring a lunch or walk a few blocks to find food until the malecon construction is finished and new business moves in.

124486799.name: Great Place
124486799.author: a TripAdvisor user
124486799.reviewBody: We ended up kayaking and snorkeling on Islas Coronado.  It was great fun.  We set the trip up with Sea Kayak Baja.  Both Ginni and Ivette  at Sea Kayak Baja were very helpful in setting up the trip.

121701804.name: Birdwatcher\'s Paradise
121701804.author: a TripAdvisor user
121701804.reviewBody: Watch pelicans and cormorants frolick among the pangas; then rent a panga for an outing to Coronado--renting directly from the owner of the boat is significantlybetter for you and him financially

17283353.name: what a cool trip with SKA ... crazy paddling, desert camping, fun companions !!
17283353.author: a TripAdvisor user
17283353.reviewBody:
this Baja trip was such a great way to experience another part of the world !!
We were VERY glad to reach our hotel and hot shower at the end of the trip, but our trip to the Baja would have been so much less without the SKA experience, we have been talking about it ever since !
We paddled water that tested our abilities , camped in the wild blowy desert, shared flat water with fin whales and porpoise, hiked our way around and over islands in the most stunning scenery. We snorkelled s often as we wanted to , with puffer fish and octopus ....
There is no other way we could have had this experience, and enjoyed good food, and great care ( really really good guides !! )
so thank you to Sea Kayak Adventures !!

360763.name: Kayaking in Parque Nacional Bahia de Loreto
360763.author: a TripAdvisor user
360763.reviewBody:
I lived in Loreto six months in winter 2000-1, working as a sea kayak guide for Sea Kayak Adventures (www.seakayakadventures.com).  I ran 6-day selfsupported sea kayak trips in the Loreto Bay National Marine Park, and loved every minute of every day.  The scenery is stunning, the geology fascinating, and the wildlife ubiquitous.

We went snorkelling almost every day over the coral reefs, and hiking in the coastal desert on the days we didn't.  We saw so many varieties of fish in the ocean I can't begin to name them, whales and dolphins on top of the ocean, and desert wildlife and cactus ashore.  I will be back sometime - I've taken a different job this winter, indoors unfortunately.

Baja and Loreto were beautiful, and Sea Kayak Adventures is the best company I've worked for in my 6 years as a guide.

652460281.name: History!!!
652460281.author: a TripAdvisor user
652460281.reviewBody: Stop in here and you can just feel the history around you.  So well preserved and still have mass.  The place was packed on the Sunday we were there.  JUST BEAUTIFUL!!

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

646471447.name: A marvellous piece of culture
646471447.author: a TripAdvisor user
646471447.reviewBody: Not only is the history of the mission interesting with the founding year of 1697 imprinted above the door, but there are more interesting things than the Spanish mass time. Shortly after our arrival, the carillon bells delighted with Christmas carols, Jingle Bells, Silent Night, Drummer Boy. The mounting of ribbons and bows above the door and on the pews signalled \u2018wedding\u2019 and I was fortunate to see three different wedding parties celebrate their marriage during a regular mass. In the courtyard was a nativity scene, strangely with an empty cradle until the missing Jesus appeared on Chrustmas Eve. The mission is a link to past and present culture as well as place of worship.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

627773372.name: Very affordable and great views!
627773372.author: a TripAdvisor user
627773372.reviewBody: We had a room facing the ocean with a sliding glass door that was just feet from the ocean - the view was amazing! I do wish the inside of the room was more updated, but it was very affordable. We received excellent service, including dry cleaning which we utilized. Loreto is gorgeous!

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

575714750.name: Enjoy the History
575714750.author: a TripAdvisor user
575714750.reviewBody: The Mission de Nuestra Senora de Loreto is in the heart of Loreto and well worth the visit. You can feel the history and read about it as well.  If lucky you will be there when they ring the bells.  The mission has many restaurants within the square, so make sure you enjoy lunch with your history. Also take in the view of the 1st capital of California right next door.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

558379506.name: Worth a look
558379506.author: a TripAdvisor user
558379506.reviewBody: A small community church providing an insight into the life of the catholic community of Loreto. The mission purports to be the first on the Camino Real trail. It has been rebuilt following an earthquake but in the style of the original. Worth seeing.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

556382420.name: Beautiful historic mission
556382420.author: a TripAdvisor user
556382420.reviewBody: This is in the heart of Loreto and has a very interesting history. Take the time to read about it. This was the first mission in the area and is very old.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

501254718.name: Do not miss this piece of history
501254718.author: a TripAdvisor user
501254718.reviewBody: The padre\'s presence in Baja cannot be ignored.  This mission, among others, is a massive example of the impact of the Spaniard\'s arrival on the Baja peninsula.  To see the extent of the native\'s forced  labor and involvement is unfathomable.  The mission is a testimony to the inventive construction techniques.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

501064465.name: The 1st of the CA Missions Was Built Here!
501064465.author: a TripAdvisor user
501064465.reviewBody: As per Mexican custom, this beautiful structure does not have fanfare or crowds or embellishment; the architectural details suffice, the grand scale interiors providing an understated elegance.  Regrettably, I didn\'t have the opportunity to attend a mass here, but perhaps you may.  Enjoy an outdoor meal at one the nearby restaurantes and then enjoy a tour and visit the museum.  Workmanship of a bygone era!

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

485970413.name: First Misidentified n in Baja
485970413.author: a TripAdvisor user
485970413.reviewBody: Established in 1697 Loreto is not only the first permanent settlement in the Baja, but home to the First Mision in the Californias.  \n\nEssentially in continuous operation since 1697, the Mision continues with weekly services tho this day.  Many local cultural events take place n the outer yard of the Mision.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

476584359.name: Nice piece of history for The Californias
476584359.author: a TripAdvisor user
476584359.reviewBody: This place is a small church with beautiful architecture! A must see if you are interested on how the California Region started...

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

475597114.name: Beautiful a must see. The history explains itself as it is the original and first Mision of this area, completed in 1696
475597114.author: a TripAdvisor user
475597114.reviewBody: All around the town square, it stands out.  There is a museum, tourist office and of course the church with multilingual services.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

470169656.name: There are really two attractions to see
470169656.author: a TripAdvisor user
470169656.reviewBody: There are two attractions to see at the Mission.  There is the Mission Church itself and also the attached museum.  The church is a well preserved example of an early (1697) California Mission well worth a 15-20 minute visit.  However you feel about the purpose of the missions, one cannot leave the church without a sense of the drive and dedication it must have taken to build and maintain the mission at the time and place it was built.  \n\nThe Museum is quaint but needs some updating and not is very representation of the history of the Loreto Mission itself.  It is mostly focused on the history of the mission building in Baja from 1697 to about 1767). That said, for the price (50 pesos or about $2.75) and time (about half an hour) it is well worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

466483784.name: Go to the museum for the history lesson
466483784.author: a TripAdvisor user
466483784.reviewBody: Great finding out about the origins of Loreto.  I was particularly interested having been educated by Jesuits.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

466403722.name: Beautiful and well majntained
466403722.author: a TripAdvisor user
466403722.reviewBody: Such a beautiful Mission and setting in Loreto. The inside is very simple and quite beautiful. Huge beams and wood adorn the ceiling and the outside is highlighted by beautiful tall palms.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

464884204.name: Very well Maintained
464884204.author: a TripAdvisor user
464884204.reviewBody: This is the called the Mother of all Baja missions and I see why. It is very well maintained and the city has many attractions. It is the only Baja mission to have been continuously used since it founding as well as the only one which has fans for those hot Baja days,\n\nOverall certainly worth seeing however I personally found Mission San Javier more impressive.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

457711914.name: Our Lady of Loreto
457711914.author: a TripAdvisor user
457711914.reviewBody: In Loreto, easy to get to, close to Loreto bay, shops, restaurants and hotels. We were on a mission to see the missions of Loreto and this was our second one of the day, very nice and easy to get to.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

448900337.name: The heart of the town
448900337.author: a TripAdvisor user
448900337.reviewBody: The history, beauty ( architecture) and faith are exquist.  Loved walking there everyday.  The have guided tours by resovation and small fee.  We were here at Christmas 2016 and the mission would play their bells ( Christmas music ) on the hour which, could be heard all over town.  Loved it.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

441249966.name: If You Are In Loreto...
441249966.author: a TripAdvisor user
441249966.reviewBody: Go see the first Jesuit mission in Baja. It is a small church, but heck, the site was established in the late 1600s, so they were working with what they could manage to get locally after that long journey from Spain. This is a community church to this day, hosting weddings and other services. The clock bell tower is very pretty.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

435960000.name: Beautiful Historic Mission
435960000.author: a TripAdvisor user
435960000.reviewBody: We were spending the evening in Loreto and waked up to the square and then along the wonderful corridor of trees to the mission.\nFounded in 1687 it was the first mission built by Juan Jose de Salvatierra . He also was the one who built the first settlement of Spanish origin in the area.\nThe church is worth visiting and when you go inside you can see its simple altar piece. Also  worth visiting is the nearby museum which has on display a large number of Catholic objects which were used in religious rites.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

431953315.name: First mission
431953315.author: a TripAdvisor user
431953315.reviewBody: For all us Californians who remember 4th grade mission projects, this is awesome. The very first mission. It\'s really beautiful and still an active center of the community. It\'s the cornerstone of the town square. Something was going on every time we walked by.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

424569157.name: Beautiful Historic Mission
424569157.author: a TripAdvisor user
424569157.reviewBody: Definitely worth the drive. The Mission is well preserved and the grounds are interesting. Make sure you walk the grounds around and behind the church. There are nice locally made sweets that you should try also.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

388815358.name: Beautiful old mission
388815358.author: a TripAdvisor user
388815358.reviewBody: This mission has been well cared for but has many interesting and very old elements. It is actually the first mission in the succession of missions to be built by the Franciscans.

itemReviewed.name: Mision de Nuestra Senora de Loreto

676000524.name: Beautiful beyond your wildest imagination
676000524.author: a TripAdvisor user
676000524.reviewBody: Jacques Cousteau was not lying. This place truly is the aquarium of the world. The color of the water set against the back drop of the desert and mountains is spectacular. If you really want to experience all Loreto Bay has to offer, I would highly recommend BajaPDX. Their expert guides can take you fishing or to any of the amazing islands.

674264134.name: Beautiful Marine Park and Area
674264134.author: a TripAdvisor user
674264134.reviewBody: If you have an opportunity to see the National Marine Park and take the boat trip, do it!  You will not be sorry. Many birds and we saw a pod of about 400 dolphins. Was great!

672234321.name: Don\u2019t miss this scenic wonder in Loreto
672234321.author: a TripAdvisor user
672234321.reviewBody: We took a boat excursion with Paul through the Villa del Palmar Resort excursion desk. Wonderful boat ride through a gorgeous Marine Park!  Great snorkeling with tons of dolphins alongside the boat. Interesting history about the area from Paul.

664819898.name: Beautiful, but chose your guide carefully
664819898.author: a TripAdvisor user
664819898.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous pristine place -- albeit with the grossest bathroom I\'ve ever had the misfortune of having to use. I would suggest finding a guide who will take a long kayaks as it is quiet and shallow water that would make for great peaceful paddling. I would have liked it to be more of a picnic and did not realize we needed to pack our own towels, beer, etc. \n

661471788.name: Gorgeous!
661471788.author: a TripAdvisor user
661471788.reviewBody: We explored the marine park by boat and then went diving around the site too. So much marine life to see there! We will be back to explore more.

660905553.name: Whales, Whales & more Whales
660905553.author: a TripAdvisor user
660905553.reviewBody: March is a great time to be in Loreto and the protected Marine Reserve.  We saw plenty of blue whales.  The area is so clean adn the locals really respect their little slice of heaven.  There are several islands you can visit with a salt mine, with great fishing, and great snorkling.

658263697.name: Where Mother Nature Puts on a Show!
658263697.author: a TripAdvisor user
658263697.reviewBody: A beautiful area off the coast of Loreto. Dolphin, seals, birds and beautiful scenery make Isla Coronado a great destination. Hopefully, with our protection, this area will remain as it is-- and people will be able to enjoy it for generations.

658129390.name: Stunning Natural Beauty filled with Marine Biodiversity
658129390.author: a TripAdvisor user
658129390.reviewBody:
We took a Private Coronado Island tour yesterday. To be honest, I didn’t expect to be wowed by this tour as I had just came from an unbelievable whale watching trip in San Ignacio Lagoon. However, I was pleasantly surprised. We saw 3 pods of dolphins on our trip, a ton of seals, pelican feedings, blue footed boobies, ducks that can snorkel and an amazing volcanic coastline. Although the weather was not optimal on this day, the secluded beach we arrived at was still very beautiful. We took a little hike behind the beach and thoroughly enjoyed it. Don’t use the toilet on this beach. You are better off going in the bushes, trust me. 

We did not pre-book this tour. We found someone at the marina and negotiated a private tour. We only wanted a tour of the Coronado Island and a visit to the secluded beach. We were not interested in a snorkeling trip because it was way too cold for that. The private tour ended up being around 2.5-3 hours long and it costed us 1500 pesos. Negotiate in pesos, you are more likely to get a cheaper price. Otherwise, it is usually $100 USD for 2 people. 

The thing that impressed me the most is the way the locals take care of their land. It is unbelievably clean. I did not see one piece of trash in the water. There was one small piece of paper on the front of our   pangas and the captain stopped the boat to pick it up so it doesn’t end up in the ocean. By his action, I can tell they take pride in their land and is doing their part to sustain this beautiful ecosystem for future generations. It is indeed a must see when in Loreto.

657838638.name: Amazing wildlife!
657838638.author: a TripAdvisor user
657838638.reviewBody: We visited the Park twice, once to see the blue whales and then to spend the day at Isla Coronado.  It was splendid.

657264638.name: Nature\u2019s Aquarium
657264638.author: a TripAdvisor user
657264638.reviewBody: We experienced a tour of Isla Coronado that was simply magical. The sea was glassy calm. We lingered to watch a humpback whale feeding as dolphins leaped and pelicans circled overhead. Extraordinary.\n\nThe geology of the island is lovely and endlessly fascinating. The sea lions were playful and active, sunning themselves and frolicking in the sea. We were thrilled to see several blue-footed boobies and dozens of other birds. Lunch and snorkeling at a lovely white sand beach capped a perfect day. This was a once-in-a -lifetime experience that my family will never forget.

647391214.name: Coronado Island
647391214.author: a TripAdvisor user
647391214.reviewBody: Booked a trip through Wild Loreto and had a great boat captain (Harvey). We saw dolphins and sea lions and many birds. The beach was great and snorkling was good but the water was a little too cool in December to stay in too long. The box lunch provided was awful and the driver that took us to and from Villa del Palmar drove like a manaic! He did NOT work for Villa. I don\'t think I would do the Coronado tour again but try Danzante isle tour from the resort next time.

646467445.name: Deserving of Preserving
646467445.author: a TripAdvisor user
646467445.reviewBody: The park is a treasure that without forethought could easily be misused. The locals appreciate the protection of this unique land and sea environment. What surprised me the most was experiencing the deserted quietude of a real desert island (Carmen) with sand, shells, volcanic peaks and cactus. Cactus! Within the ring of mountains and islands circling Loreto are the salt waters for boating, fishing, diving, snorkelling and kayaking. We missed the whales, but the dolphins were delightful playing around the bow and wake of our Blue Nation tour boat. Jacques Cousteau remarked on the beauty of the Sea of Cortes. He should have said, \u2018Awesome!\u2019

646183368.name: Fantastic private tour of Coronado island with Abraham
646183368.author: a TripAdvisor user
646183368.reviewBody: We booked this tour with the guys in the shop adjacent to the Mision in downtown Loreto. The service was excellent. For $55 US per person, for four of us, the boat picked us up on the beach in front of the Hotel at Loreto Bay. The captain\'s name was Abraham. He was very kind and helpful. He explained features around Coronado Island, including the Sea Lion colony, lava flow, monkey face, and took us into the white sandy beach for a box lunch and time to go hiking. When we got back on the water, he went into some shallow water offshore to find us a sea turtle. He then pointed out a dolphin pod. He allowed us the time we wanted to observe and ask questions.\n\nSpectacular scenery. Great experience overall!

644832043.name: Take the Glass Bottom Boat Tour!
644832043.author: a TripAdvisor user
644832043.reviewBody: We took the glass bottom boat tour and it was wonderful!  The Marine Park is beautiful, and the snorkeling was fantastic!!

639369062.name: Great National Park, but work with the right tour group
639369062.author: a TripAdvisor user
639369062.reviewBody: This is my second return to Loreto in 2018, February then Nov-Dec and January 2019. The tour operators you select make it a trip of a lifetime or a waste of time. First the bad: Anything to do with the Danzante development is a sales pitch for timeshares despite what they tell you. Tours provided by them are usually a disappointment. They promised me a discounted scuba trip then upon arrival at the development, that never materialized. I was shuttled from one salesman to another until I demanded my return trip back to Loreto. THE GOOD STUFF: Dolphin Dive is locally-owned by caring, competent professionals who have become good friends. They provide scuba and snorkel trips year round, seasonal whale watching, No fishing (better to watch than kill), and will do land tours upon request and when the weather prevents water sports. Rafa also will meet custom requests for hiking and kayaking. He is a lifetime Loretan and knows EVERYTHING and EVERYONE in the area. He is a Baja Sur Travel Advisor-not an official title but just because of what he knows. Drop in and talk if nothing else. Blue Nation is new in town, but has very high standards for their eco-friendly scuba and snorkeling trips. Yago has world-wide scuba and snorkeling experience and has made a superb effort to learn the area and islands. He and Moni are very helpful and friendly. Once you pick your tour operator, you have the opportunity to see dolphins, fish, whales, fish, mobila, fish, bullseye electric rays, morey eels, bird life, fantastic views, nudibranches, and lots of kinds of fish. Enjoy! And wear shoes to go into the water from the sandy beaches. Stingrays pack a punch.

638707159.name: Amazing!!
638707159.author: a TripAdvisor user
638707159.reviewBody: Our boat Captain for the tour was Paul, he was outstanding. He happened to notice two pods of dolphins during our tour and went out of his was way to take us to them and it was INCREDIBLE!  We had never been so close to dolphins in the wild.  There were dozens of them swimming next to the boat and playfully jumping.  So cool!  This was on top of the snorkeling and swimming is beautiful, crystal clear water.

632271576.name: Revisit take 2
632271576.author: a TripAdvisor user
632271576.reviewBody: Beautiful tour, always great to be on the Sea of Cortes. Saw a fin whale this trip, spotted sting ray, lots of fish. Water is clearer than the bath water, and perfect for snorkeling.

631946811.name: Wonderful day on the water
631946811.author: a TripAdvisor user
631946811.reviewBody: Great snorkeling crystal clear water.  We saw a school of dolphin and yellow tail.  Weather was perfect

627817339.name: Pristine waters, great snorkeling
627817339.author: a TripAdvisor user
627817339.reviewBody: The Loreto Bay National Marine Park was amazing.  We took a four hour guided tour that included an opportunity to snorkel.  The guide was very informative and added a lot to the visual experience. Once you visit this marine park you will want to return to Loreto and explore more of the marine sanctuary every day.   This was our first trip to Loreto and we look forward to the next.

627065398.name: Make sure to snorkel here
627065398.author: a TripAdvisor user
627065398.reviewBody: We snorkeled at the window rock in the picture and around the islands, wonderful with clear clean water and lots of fish.

612861929.name: 5 islands and some white sand beaches make up the most beautiful coastline.  We fished, swam and scuba dove daily!
612861929.author: a TripAdvisor user
612861929.reviewBody: Teaming with life!!  We caught our limit of fish every day, pargo, yellow tail, trigger, bass and was dolphins, huge manta, marlin, sea turtles, etc daily.  We are spoiled now, this is a hidden gem.

603254330.name: A world-class eco-tourism destination
603254330.author: a TripAdvisor user
603254330.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to experience unspoiled marine life and coastline. This area is not overdeveloped like many resort destinations.

598646580.name: Natural beauty
598646580.author: a TripAdvisor user
598646580.reviewBody: We fished around Carmen Island for 3 day. It is a natural rugged paradise. The cliffs were beautiful. The fishing was good and there were even big horn sheep on the rocks.  Amazing place

597485632.name: Every visit outdoes the previous one
597485632.author: a TripAdvisor user
597485632.reviewBody: Just when I think I\u2019ve seen everything, this Park blows me away! On our second day, we spotted something rising and sinking from a respectable distance. When we got close enough, we could see it was a small group of Orcas. We kept out of their way, and enjoyed for quite awhile. The real treat was the 4th when we were heading in from fishing. We came across a 25ft Whale Shark that decided to \u201ccheck us out\u201d.  After about 30 minutes, the WS came along side and gave us a chance to \u201cpet\u201d him/her before slowly swimming off. Don\u2019t even remember how the fishing, but ended up with lots of great pix and two nice videos.  Not sure what will be next, but there will be a next trip!

595991796.name: Amazing pristine islands and abundance of marine life
595991796.author: a TripAdvisor user
595991796.reviewBody: We just got back from Loreto and spent most of our time fishing and snorkeling. It\u2019s a beautiful area where you can get away from it all!\n

595398300.name: Paul our captain was amazing!
595398300.author: a TripAdvisor user
595398300.reviewBody: Paul kept us all engaged and active, he dove down and would bring the marine life up to us and tech us about the critter, all very safe we leaned a lot out there Eco system and had a blast!

594718896.name: Nature at it\'s best
594718896.author: a TripAdvisor user
594718896.reviewBody: Stayed at a nearby resort and took both a boat tour and later kayaks around the Islands for loreto. Amazing!

594400244.name: Incredible wildlife
594400244.author: a TripAdvisor user
594400244.reviewBody: Hundreds of dolphin, leaping rays, huge schools of fish, colorful birds and more - all you might expect from a protected area.

593663411.name: Absolutely one of the best places to see wild life!
593663411.author: a TripAdvisor user
593663411.reviewBody: This place is an absolute treasure, I can\'t speak an higher of how amazing the beauty you see everywhere is. My favorite things are, how light the footprint is, so secluded that this is by no means similar to any of the other big marine parks in Mexico, I also absolutely love the passion the locals and tour guides have for protecting the natural beauty here and their love shows in how they share and explain everything you\'re experiencing. Go there, go there often, but remember to share it with people with a love of conserving natural beauty at its finest!

590999176.name: A must see
590999176.author: a TripAdvisor user
590999176.reviewBody: I\'m not sure I have the words to describe how nice this was. Blue whales were in and we had a beautiful day on the water and saw many whales!

589573914.name: Stunning Marine Park
589573914.author: a TripAdvisor user
589573914.reviewBody: We paddled on Xmas Day and saw one other water craft way off in the distance. Lunched on a deserted beach and snorkelled after. Doesn\'t get any better!

588665802.name: Gorgeus Place worth the sail!!!
588665802.author: a TripAdvisor user
588665802.reviewBody: We sailed with Peter, from our review "Peter\'s Peaceful Paradise", there are 5  islands within the park. We spent the day at Coronado island which is the closest and more popular. That day was going to had bad weather so we just have time to sail to the closest one and we had the island to ourselves on that day. The place is just paradise!! The water on the beach is so clear you can see the aquatic wildlife from the heights of the island. You can walk all around the island. There is just so much to see to describe it all. From strange plants we have seen nowhere else, to the variety of birds and aquatic life. We didn\'t get to see Danzante Island, none wanted to sail there because of the bad weather, but a Marine Biologist we met recommended it highly for the amount of wildlife. Also we could see whales jumping afar in the canyon that forms between Coronado and Carmen islands. Here your money and time will be well spent.

586455361.name: Beautiful area
586455361.author: a TripAdvisor user
586455361.reviewBody: Interesting and beautiful.  Lots of different birds, was a real kick to see the Blue Footed Boobies.    Saw Dolphins on both trips to the islands  (we were there out of whale season).  The water and beach in one bay on Coronado island was my favorite - crystal clear turquoise, calm water, picture perfect curved white sand, birds and fish.  Do watch out for the bees - they were annoying but not overly aggressive.  I did get stung right before we left when I absent mindedly felt a tickle on my hand and didn\'t immediately think bee and stay still.  I felt bad for the bee as they die when they sting but it hurt and was swollen and itchy for several days. Make sure you take Epi-pen if seriously allergic.

584259560.name: Isla Coronado
584259560.author: a TripAdvisor user
584259560.reviewBody: We were picked up on Nopolo Bay ( near where we were staying). The boat ride took about 45 min. The beach at Isla Coronado was beautiful!! White sand and clear blue water.
