We snorkeled . Visability was about 30 ft. . Saw many fish, star fish, tube worms. Several palapas for shade was wonderful. The only drawback was that there were numerous bees. They seemed thirsty. We were able to focus some of them on beer cans.

583746656.name: Absolutely Stunning
583746656.author: a TripAdvisor user
583746656.reviewBody: This beautiful area is amazingly clear and chock full of fish and wildlife. It is a wonderful brew of azure water, fish, rays, and sea mammals. Not to be missed.

583457681.name: The Second Largest Marine Preserve in the World WHO KNEW???
583457681.author: a TripAdvisor user
583457681.reviewBody:
Our kids own a timeshare that includes a place in Loreto, so when they offered to gift us their week, we gratefully accepted, not knowing anything about the area. This is in spite of the fact that as residents of southern California, Loreto is only about a 2 hour flight.

The resort offered an affordable Zodiak boat half-day excursion to the Marine Park, which included some snorkeling time, so we went.

Well the excursion company and the captain of our little boat was fabulous, but you want to know about the Marine Park ... so ...

... OMG! I don't use this term lightly. After all, I'm a 70 year old grandmother and we don't generally start our sentences with OMG!  But honestly, this really is an OMG type of experience.

You like birds? You'll see birds. You like fishies? You'll see fishies. You like dolphins? They'll literally be dancing at your feet! You like sea lions? We found quite a few sunning themselves on rocks at the edge of one of the islands and they were unfazed when we all grabbed our cameras and phones to take their photos. You like stunning scenery? NO PROBLEMA!!

I understand that this jewel of a place is second only to The Great Barrier Reef in size and scope. It's protected by the Mexican government and is a UNESCO World Heritage Center. I'm very grateful ... and I think you will be too.

Although you can find excursions that include longer time snorkeling, we were content with our 1/2 hour or so. Our goal was primarily to become acquainted with as large an area of the park as possible and we did.

But there's more to be explored. Our captain told us that at the beginning of the year the migrating whales are present in abundant numbers and that's worth a visit. There are also sea turtles to see and lots of other amazing life.

My husband and I plan to be VERY NICE to our son and daughter in law. Yeah, yeah they're great and deserve to be treated well by their parents ... 

... but we want them to send us down to Loreto again! 

Next time, we think we'll take a snorkeling adventure excursion!!

582741603.name: DANZANTE TOURS SNORKLE
582741603.author: a TripAdvisor user
582741603.reviewBody: Beautiful day seeing this window from the boat on trip and next day dove here with Christian. Underwater was amazing saw beautiful fish and other sea life here

581259732.name: Ocean life, big time
581259732.author: a TripAdvisor user
581259732.reviewBody: Loreto is comparable to the worlds largest protected water life National sanuaries, whales, seals, many variety of fish both large & small, fun filled porpose chase your boats just a deliteful place

575708753.name: Buitiful day on the water
575708753.author: a TripAdvisor user
575708753.reviewBody: We took an boat tour of the area and visited the national park.  It was beautiful, with something to see everywhere you looked (fish, birds, and rock formations).  I would highly recommend a visit.

573266427.name: Incredible Dolophins
573266427.author: a TripAdvisor user
573266427.reviewBody: This is what my wife enjoyed most in Loreto.  We say over 200 dolphins. We also saw whales, sea lions, mountain goats, went snorkeling.

571572040.name: Coronado Island tour
571572040.author: a TripAdvisor user
571572040.reviewBody: Interesting experience going around that volcanic island. We took a tour with Wild Loreto, The service was very good, but the tour is pricy compared to similar tours in other parts of the world\n. the island has the  attractive of watching wild life (sea lions, birds nesting) and sandy beach. Snorkelling was not good; water still cold and "dirty" close to the sea lions. the beach is very good for wandering and appreciate seagulls nesting; tide was extremely low.

569939396.name: Private Tour with Said Orozco
569939396.author: a TripAdvisor user
569939396.reviewBody: Before we traveled to Loreto my husband and I both searched the Loreto forum to find out who we might hire for a private tour of the islands/marine park.  The name we both decided on was Said  (pronounced saw-eed)  When we arrived in Loreto he sent me an email to confirm but to also say that it would be windy on the day we had picked for the tour so he suggested another day.  We went with his advice and he was SO-O-O right. :-)  All the other days were windy with choppy water but our day turned out to be perfect.  We had one of the nicer boats and a captain named Edie who took us out and around Coronado Island.  We parked on one side and took the short hike/walk across the island to the main bay.  Then we went back to the boat and circled the island and saw flocks of birds, lots of dolphins (two different kinds) and sea lions.  Then Said to us to a smaller beach that was lovely with only one other group there  (the main beach was PACKED) so it was almost like having the beach to ourselves.  Then Said, his friend Leslie, and Edie set up a canopy and served us an amazing lunch of homemade ceviche, guacamole and a salad.  They offered juice, water, and even beer.  We relaxed in the shade while lunch was prepared and then took a nice walk on the beach.  Did I mention what a beautiful day it was?  Just perfect.  We talked with several other couples during our stay and while they were happy with their tours, they paid considerably more than we did AND they didn\'t get that amazing lunch on the beach.  I strongly recommend Said if you want a private tour and if/when we return to Loreto we will certainly use him again.

567257490.name: Loreto o the sea is stunning!
567257490.author: a TripAdvisor user
567257490.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful part of Baja!  I do t live on the sea usually and it is wonderful to be able to walk a hard block from my hotel and be on this beautiful sea front!

565279388.name: Amazing
565279388.author: a TripAdvisor user
565279388.reviewBody: We enjoyed snorkeling, kayaking, fishing, and walking on the beach.  Very beautiful and enjoyable.  This is truly an wonder.

564363781.name: A Mexican Wonder
564363781.author: a TripAdvisor user
564363781.reviewBody: Fantastic land and water features respectfully protected by the National Park System. Wonderful snorkelling and quiet coral sand beaches. You can hire a guide boat from the Loretto marina for very reasonable prices. The guides can find you whales dolphins fishing or just beaches to play on. Wonderful to see such a fantastic park system in place. We saw hundreds of dolphins and a blue whale! The fishing was great and the geography was un-touchable.

564019293.name: Blue Whale Panga Tour - Outstanding!
564019293.author: a TripAdvisor user
564019293.reviewBody: On our last day at Villa del Palmar, we booked Danzante Tours, with the wonderful guide Rammsis, for a Blue Whale watching tour in the Loreto Bay Marine Park. 12 of us waded out from the resort\u2019s beach to a panga for our 8:30 AM departure. Within about 15 minutes or so, we had our first sighting! A mom and baby that we stayed with for quite some time. It was spectacular. Over the course of about 4 hours we saw approx. 10 whales, including one Finn whale. Rammsis was fun and very knowledgeable. The tour provided snacks and beverages. Because Blue whales are so large, unless you are in very deep water it\u2019s unusual to see their tales, but just as we were heading back to the resort, our last whale graced us with a beautiful deep dive and everyone cheered as the tail surfaced! It does take patience since the whales are often under water for 10-15 minutes at a time and we moved to different parts of the bay in search of them, but I highly recommend this tour when the whales are in the bay.

563435982.name: Beautiful and serene, don\u2019t miss
563435982.author: a TripAdvisor user
563435982.reviewBody: Fabulous waters off of Loreto. Take a boat , snorkeling or scuba trip. Not crowded. Gorgeous scenery with all the islands and mountains. A little chilly in February, rent or bring a Wetsuit.

562818237.name: Beautiful Sight but Avoid Desert and Sea Expeditions
562818237.author: a TripAdvisor user
562818237.reviewBody:
Coronado Island is beautiful, the crescent white sand beach is gorgeous and a wonderful place to relax. I would just choose a different company to go with. 

We used Desert and Sea Expeditions for this trip and had a very disappointing experience. While we had a better experience, with a different guide and captain, on another of their trips, the organizational issues with the company itself caused problems and led us to have expectations of the captain that were not fulfilled.

When we first went to get information, there were two people on staff, a man and a woman. We spoke primarily with the woman, and the information she provided, her responsiveness to our questions, and her warm personality caused us to choose this company after gathering information from several. When we returned to make reservations, she wasn’t there and we dealt only with the man (manager or owner?). We talked in a combination of English and Spanish, since his English was not better than our Spanish, as far as we could tell. However, some things we understood fairly clearly: The first trip we wanted to take was a snorkeling trip to Coronado Island, and we had been advised that a specific spot (by the rock called “Snoopy”) was the best place to snorkel, and he made it abundantly clear that we could do that, in fact, that the boat would be at our disposal to do whatever we wanted during the time of the excursion; we also asked about the need for wet suits, and he replied that “It depends. Sometimes you need them, sometimes not.” We understood this to mean that we could decide at the time of the trip, depending on conditions. At no time did he suggest that we would need to reserve the wet suits in advance.

In the brochure that the company provides about this specific trip “Día de paseo a Isla Coronado,” it states that “La expedición incluye: . . . Guía capitán experimentado, equipo para hacer esnórkel.” My understanding of Spanish is that “experimentado” does not mean “experimental,” but “experienced.” This statement led us to expect the captain to act as an experienced guide and also that snorkeling equipment (including wet suits) would be provided.

There were three groups of clients on the boat. One group spoke only English. One group spoke French and Spanish. We spoke English, French, and some Spanish. The captain of the boat, Enrique, was fine as a driver of the boat. He did that and passed out lunch (simple sandwiches) and cold drinks. He didn’t really give any instructions or information in either English or Spanish. He didn’t provide anything remotely resembling “guiding.” He didn’t provide any options or choices. Because of the different groups (total of 10 passengers), we did not have a coordinated plan or request for him. My husband was able to share a little history and geology of the Marine Sanctuary and the islands based on a kayaking trip he had taken with another company that provided an excellent guide (in addition to the boat captain that took the kayaks out to the area where they were going to kayak). To be fair, the costs through that company were significantly higher. 

First, we discovered that while one group had reserved wet suits, those were the only wet suits on board. There was no option for the rest of us to use wet suits. If you didn’t reserve them in advance, they were not on the boat. When we observed people from another boat snorkeling with sea lions, the group with the wet suits asked to stop there so they could snorkel. I joined in, without a wet suit (I’m pretty used to cold water), but the others in my party didn’t because of the cold water.

Next, Enrique took us to a beautiful beach, where we stopped. He gave no information, not how long we would stay, not that we would have lunch there, nothing about where to snorkel, not that there was a trail (which my husband discovered and hiked ), not that there were restrooms at one end of the beach (which my husband discovered on the hike, but of which others were not aware). My husband and I snorkeled but saw little for most of the time, finally seeing one school of colorful fish. My grandson was more cautious due to the coldness of the water and mostly stayed near the beach, playing in the shallow water. I asked then about “Snoopy” rock, and Enrique said it was too late to go there since we had already passed it. (Okay, I should have made my request known at the outset, but I had told the owner or manager, and he was there when we got on the boat and conversed with Enrique; also, since there was never any discussion among the three groups about what each wanted, and no indication from Enrique that we had any choices, I never really felt there was an opening to do that.) 

While nothing could spoil the beauty of this island and beach, our purpose of seeing interesting and colorful fish while snorkeling was not met. I was very disappointed. Our reason for taking this excursion was snorkeling, and we were thwarted by the lack of wet suits and the limitations on where we snorkeled. (My husband and grandson saw many more fish from their kayaks and when snorkeling on the kayak trip I’ve mentioned with a different company.) The promises extended by the company were not met.

561399919.name: beautiful and interesting
561399919.author: a TripAdvisor user
561399919.reviewBody: we took a zodiac day trip through this absolutely breathtaking and beautiful marine park. so very nice seeing whales, dolphins, snorkeling and birds in the area.

560540526.name: Coronado Island Tour
560540526.author: a TripAdvisor user
560540526.reviewBody: Did the boat trip to Coronado Island.  Did try the snorkeling with the sea lions.  But it was February and even with wetsuits the water was too cold to enjoy the experience.  Stopped on the beach for lunch.  Walked the path to the other side of the island.  Not much different to see.  Was a good way to waste away a half of day, but nothing spectacular.

559821401.name: Great day
559821401.author: a TripAdvisor user
559821401.reviewBody: We booked with Danzante Tours from Villas del Palmar just south of Loreto.  Great staff.  They showed us dolphins, sea lions, hiking, snorkeling and lunch.  Great staff with a passion for teaching us about their beautiful marine park.  Fun bunch.

559417610.name: A Memorable Day
559417610.author: a TripAdvisor user
559417610.reviewBody:
We went by hired panga twice, to various islands within the Marine
Park: the first, all day, to Isla Danzantes & Honeymoon Bay, and Isla Carmen. The second shorter trip was to Isla Coronado, the closest of the Islands to Loreto. It's astounding geologically, with lava flows into the sea left over from volcanic days. The water, air,
and rocks are full of life- sea-lions, seals, pelicans, frigate-birds- the water is pristine. There are several pretty beaches, filled with
birds fishing. I'd go again- highly recommended.

559086253.name: Glass bottom boat
559086253.author: a TripAdvisor user
559086253.reviewBody: Excellent tour of one of the islands of Loreto. Our tour guide was very informative and knowledgeable of marine life. They include a very nice picnic lunch and snacks.

558705388.name: Saw Many Creatures in the Marine Park
558705388.author: a TripAdvisor user
558705388.reviewBody: Had two, two-dive trips so I knew I\u2019d see fish, but there is so much more. Sea lions to swim with the first day. Then Blue Whales and an unexpected whale shark the second day. Brown pelicans, White Egrets, Great Blue Heron, Frigate Birds, Blue-footed Boobies, hawks, Grebes. So glad this is a sanctuary. So many critters to protect.

558380321.name: Not to be missed
558380321.author: a TripAdvisor user
558380321.reviewBody: Beautiful, protected marine park. Clear waters, mostly calm seas, great snorkeling, fishing, swimming and photo ops. Beaches for sunning, sitting and sand castles too.

556591445.name: Good base to see Gray whales in Magdalena Bay
556591445.author: a TripAdvisor user
556591445.reviewBody: Loreto doesn\u2019t have a lot to see but look around and you will find nice walks and boat rides. It\u2019s a great base from which to drive to see the gray whales of Magdalena Bay at Lopez Mateos

556383319.name: Take a trip by boat to one of the islands
556383319.author: a TripAdvisor user
556383319.reviewBody: We hired a boat for $125/day and that was for 5 of us. Our guide did not speak much English but we managed with our not so good Spanish. Got out and took a hike on a trail that goes back into the dune and desert. Cabanas for eating lunch. Bring snorkeling gear if you want to do that. One beware: do NOT under and circumstances go into the bathroom. It was the most disgusting thing I\'ve ever seen in all my years of traveling. And I\'ve been to primitive bathrooms. There was feces everywhere. I had to go around the back and pee where it is obvious lots of others have gone. That bathroom should just be burned to the ground. \n

554953043.name: nice visit if....
554953043.author: a TripAdvisor user
554953043.reviewBody: Nice visit if you have knowledgable guides.  While we really enjoyed the marine life, the surrounding waters and the overall experience, one must have a very knowledgeble guide to appreciate a walk on the island((s), specifically Coronado.  The signage for plants and geology are in poor condition or non-existent, so an academic or professionally trained guide is needed to appreciate the visit.  Unfortunately, the local tour company guides are pretty much useless beyond pointing out a few things.   One is better off researching Coronado on their own before a visit.

553006029.name: Don\'t miss this!
553006029.author: a TripAdvisor user
553006029.reviewBody: Snorkeling is the best we have ever done.  Boat rides take you to beautiful places. The boats carry small groups, so you feel like you are nearly all alone in that beautiful bay.

551835372.name: Great kayaking!
551835372.author: a TripAdvisor user
551835372.reviewBody: Went on a 6 day trip with Sea Kayak Baja Mexico out of Loreto.  Excellent guides, excellent scenery, paddling and snorkeling.  Great camping on beach.

551244126.name: So Beautiful and Peaceful
551244126.author: a TripAdvisor user
551244126.reviewBody: We went on a snorkel trip thru the park. The guides took the time to educate us on the area and the history of the park. So many breathtaking views. We snorkeled at Dantanze island and could not believe the amount and variety of different fish. Our guide dove down and grabbed a puffer fish and we were able to touch it as well as a star fish. So cool!! We booked our tour right at the hotel.

551056187.name: Wow, do not miss
551056187.author: a TripAdvisor user
551056187.reviewBody: Hurry before the mega resort expands and this natural wonder nataional park bring in Yosemite-like crowds.  Convenience, affordable!  30 minutes by panga (fast boat) gets you to a white sandy beach to frolick and snorkel. That\'s not the highlight for most. How manhy darn dolphins can there be, surrounding us all the time!   2 speciies, too many schools to count.  Sea lions to swim with and an aquarium 4 ft deep to plop into.  All for under $70 per person (1/2 price for kids).  Get there before the timeshare people turn this into a water park like sea world and recruit the dolphins as the starring act!

550513222.name: Wonderful place to visit with the whole family
550513222.author: a TripAdvisor user
550513222.reviewBody: A good guide is a must. Ours was Said Orozco. He was very solicitous and always looking out for us. He is knowledgeable, courteous, and funny. He kows the marine park like his back hand. We saw things that we would have never imagined.

550262344.name: Gorgeous excursion
550262344.author: a TripAdvisor user
550262344.reviewBody: We took a charter out for the day and had a wonderful time taking in the nature, dolphins and vast varieties of fish while snorkeling and birds while hiking. Only alert is that there are not any bathroom facilities and you\u2019ll need to get creative. Take all trash out with you.

549767878.name: Must visit while in Loreto
549767878.author: a TripAdvisor user
549767878.reviewBody: We saw many dolphins, sea lions, and birds. We had ten dolphins swimming with our boat. Unfortunately, we did not see any blue footed boobies. \nThe beach on Coronado island was also very nice!

547940933.name: Mexico at its Finest
547940933.author: a TripAdvisor user
547940933.reviewBody: More areas of this fantastic country should follow Loreto\'s lead and preserve the specially unique places before foreign interests and $ destroy them all.  This is an absolutely pristine area, well monitored and protected by numerous organizations - hooray for Loreto!

545388717.name: Great snorkeling, bird watching
545388717.author: a TripAdvisor user
545388717.reviewBody: We saw Blue Footed Boobies, pelicans, frigate birds, herons, and saw quite a variety of fish while snorkeling.

544239704.name: Inspired Conservation
544239704.author: a TripAdvisor user
544239704.reviewBody: Setting a wonderful example of preserving natural beauty and wildlife habitat, the Loretto bay national Marine Park is awe inspiring. We swam with sea lions, saw many dolphins,\nAnd marveled at the number and diversity of birds.

543089532.name: Wow!!
543089532.author: a TripAdvisor user
543089532.reviewBody: Beautiful waters and islands. Must do sailing to the islands!!  The snorkeling was fabulous, with so much variety and quantity of fish and marine life\u2014 sea stars, abalone, fish by the thousands, dolphins, sea lions.  Little coral. Danzante and Coronado Islands we\u2019re our favorites.

541154273.name: Kayaking the Islands of Loreto Bay
541154273.author: a TripAdvisor user
541154273.reviewBody: We booked an 8-day guided kayak/camping tour of Isla Danzante and Isla del Carmen through Sea Kayak Adventures and would highly recommend this trip to anyone who loves being in and on the water. Great guides, equipment and itinerary.

540995393.name: Some interesting Diving on Isla Coranado
540995393.author: a TripAdvisor user
540995393.reviewBody: We went with Dolphin Divers in on elf their pandas to the dive on the sea lion colony on Isla Coranado to the north of Loreto and on the north of the island. It was around an hours ride across calm blue water. Very bracing!We first dived just to the north of the colony on a deep set of rocky steps going down to around 40 -45 metres 130 -140 feet. We had very good visibility around 20 metres( 60 feet) horizontal. There was a superb black coral forest which had  bright yellow feeding polyps giving the appearance of a beautiful bright yellow forest. There was a reasonable amount of fish , mainly fairly small although we were assured that at times it was possible to see the big groupers in that location. I could quite believe that and going from past experience in similar locations it was the lack of a current that diminished the amount of fish life we saw. I am sure had there been a current the numbers of fish would have been considerably more. However, there was plenty of life in warm clear current free water to make it a very pleasant and interesting dive. On the surface the rock formations of the island are stunning and our second dive of the day on the sea lion colony showed that these formations continued under the sea. The interaction with the sea lions was wonderful as they showed an interest is coming to see us and also went through a whole bunch of acrobatic movements right there infant of us. Although we were scuba diving there is plenty of opportunity for snorkelers to see and interact with the sea lions and even if you don\'t go into the water at all there is still plenty of animal life to be seen. It was a splendid day out with a friendly and knowledgable dive guide and captain. Would I go again? definitely!

539279288.name: National Park
539279288.author: a TripAdvisor user
539279288.reviewBody: Five beautiful islands in Sea of Cortez with abundant sea life. Great for a boat trip and snorkeling. \n\n

537238054.name: The best activity in the area!
537238054.author: a TripAdvisor user
537238054.reviewBody: Pay for a boat ride to snorkel and see the Marine Park.  We saw fish, turtles, and dolphins up close and personal.  The price is very reasonable for what you get and the guides are all excellent.  You will not be dissapointed.

536719325.name: Amazing!
536719325.author: a TripAdvisor user
536719325.reviewBody: We went in late May and saw two pods of dolphins, rays, blue footed boobies, sea lions, tons of other birds, crabs, fish, and the highlight, a whale! The driver said he was surprised that late in the season, but he came up twice that we saw! Overall incredible experience! Just our family and the boat owner/driver, who was very kind, pointed everything out to us, and very knowledgable in what appeared to be all areas of the wildlife! We took a whole day to do this and it was totally worth it! Since it was a cool day we didn\'t realize how much sun exposure we actually got, so the next day we needed some aloe, and the local stores had everything we needed! It was seriously an incredible experience!

536459886.name: Beautiful, but...
536459886.author: a TripAdvisor user
536459886.reviewBody: Populations of fish have nosedived. Commercial \u201cartisanal\u201d panga fishing is virtually unregulated, and the sport fishing sector also suffers from a lack of conservation ethic. It\u2019s a shame to see wildlife populations devastated to the extent that the fisheries have been harmed here.

534967645.name: Beautiful!
534967645.author: a TripAdvisor user
534967645.reviewBody: Awesome area, great views with sea/dessert contrast. Just be sure to ask for legal "almeja chocolata" in restaurants! Let\'s help preserve this beautiful ocean, home of the blue whale!

533285126.name: My favorite thing in Loreto!
533285126.author: a TripAdvisor user
533285126.reviewBody: The national protected marine park is my absolute favorite place in Loreto, Mexico. I love the wild and marine life, the crystal clear water, and the stunning views!

532212692.name: Coronado Island tour
532212692.author: a TripAdvisor user
532212692.reviewBody: We took the Isla Coronado tour, great experience.TIP: Los Metates beach is the best, even her is not shadow over there ;

531536197.name: Plenty of nature
531536197.author: a TripAdvisor user
531536197.reviewBody: The VDP Loreto is surrounded by the National Park. We fished, snorkeled and toured the area via boats.

530829557.name: great place
530829557.author: a TripAdvisor user
530829557.reviewBody: a great little sleepy town but take a cab to the resorts out buy the airport about 25 minute ride for the best beaches. the churches and cafes are very peaceful

528467412.name: Loreto beauty
528467412.author: a TripAdvisor user
528467412.reviewBody: Breathtaking views of protected waters and marine life. No loud boating and very peaceful. Great Sailing and kayaking.

525964168.name: Came to fish
525964168.author: a TripAdvisor user
525964168.reviewBody: And there were none. Lots of bait but with water temp of 87 degrees there was nothing eating the sardines except pods of common dolphin. Came here to kayak fish as I saw an article in a magazine that looked great. Maybe wrong time of year. Also bring your own kayak. Lots of birds, goats on Isla Carmen and sea lions. Also saw mantas a couple of days. So although not much fish lots to see. Would go again but when water was colder.

525400210.name: Amazing and awe inspiring
525400210.author: a TripAdvisor user
525400210.reviewBody: I fell in love with this  place.  Took a trip to the islands around Danzante, stopped at a Del Carmen beach then Coronado Beach . OMG!  Calm water, so clear. Saw lots of dolphins, sea lions, a sea turtle, many fish, many birds, including blue footed boobies that are found here and in the Galapagos! I must return.

521838320.name: Natural beauty everywhere you look.
521838320.author: a TripAdvisor user
521838320.reviewBody: Five islands with diverse ocean environment all around. Coronado Island is the most visited and also has the most beautiful bay and beach in many miles. Superb diving and snorkeling from June through November. Several sea lion colonies, blue footed boobies, dolphin and whale watching season, February through April.....

507100087.name: More impressive every visit!
507100087.author: a TripAdvisor user
507100087.reviewBody: The sheer beauty of this entire area changes minute by minute regardless when you visit! As your enjoy the sights on your boat around 6am, you see it still beautiful, but differently, at 2pm ! You wonder why you didn\'t see that cave or that cactus formation the first time. Every visit, the wildlife treats me to something new. This time, we stopped to photo a sea turtle and rather than dive he actually swam up to the boat, like he was saying hi, before swimming off. While fishing, we feed a young shark some of our bait, right next the boat. Almost makes the whale, dolphin, bird sightings kind of common. Not really, it\'s amazing each and every time. A visit to an island or two, is also a must!

506253891.name: Visiting the Islands is a must
506253891.author: a TripAdvisor user
506253891.reviewBody: Visited Isla Danzante and Isla Del Carmen (7/21/17). Beautiful clear blue water perfect for snorkeling. Lots of birds and crabs. We didn\'t see any dolphins, out tour guy looked everywhere, but no luck. But even without the dolphins this experience was awesome!

501433001.name: Reef fish, dolphins, and a blue whale
501433001.author: a TripAdvisor user
501433001.reviewBody: Lots to see by boat, snorkeling, and scuba diving. Upwelling from deep in the sea of Cortez brings nutrients which support diverse sea life. The steep under water walls of the volcanic islands support diverse, beautiful, colorful life. It wasn\'t even crowded. Leave the all inclusive resort and explore the gorgeous world in and under the water. Wish we brought our paddle boards.

500471590.name: Coronado island day trip
500471590.author: a TripAdvisor user
500471590.reviewBody: My wife and two kids boy 10 daughter 8 took a boat ride on a Pangs out to Cornado Island.  Saw about 100 dolphins on the way out swimming right by the boat.  It was about a 50 minute ride going around the island where we saw a few sea lions and one of the blue foot birds.  Finally getting around the island you come into a nice cove where the water is very clear and the kids were able to go snorkeling.  I thought the water was cold but the kids just jumped right in.  We spent about 90 minutes looking for shells and sea life in the rocks.  You can walk the trail that takes you throughout the island but we didn\'t.  The trip was nice but I wouldn\'t do it twice.  You can probably just go to marina and get a boat and save some money.  We paid 140 through a hotel which did include water soda and some burritos.

499923348.name: Beautiful islands, azure water, multitude of birds & sealife
499923348.author: a TripAdvisor user
499923348.reviewBody: We toured with Dolphin Dive Baja and Necki & Cyndi were great.  We chose the "island tour" which goes around la Isla Coronado.  We saw birds, dolphins, sea lions, gorgeous rock formations, enjoyed a quick hike, and practiced our Spanish while they, their English. Beautiful outing!

499514856.name: Beautiful
499514856.author: a TripAdvisor user
499514856.reviewBody: While staying at the Barcello in Loreto we went on an excursion here.  It was beautiful.   So much marine life.  There was a school of dolphins playing with the boat waves and we all got our fill of photos and video.

499509128.name: Great to see the Dolphins and sea lions
499509128.author: a TripAdvisor user
499509128.reviewBody: Took a boat ride around the island. Takes a bit of time to get there from Loretto but well worth it when you get a good close up of the animals.

497314983.name: Naturally Beautiful and only a few Lucky One has seen it\'s wonder
497314983.author: a TripAdvisor user
497314983.reviewBody: We signed up with the Danzante Tours in Loreto, Mexico to expore the islands in Danzante Bay, which is the equivalent of our National Marine preserve.It is Majestic and Heavenly beautiful.  It\'s naturally magnificent but with few visitors.  We were lucky to have Ramsey as our high speed zodiac boat captain.  He is very polite, knowledgeable, patient.  He knows the history of these rocks and island, the wild life that lives on it.  He would point out all the scenery, special rocks and plants.  He knows animals that lives in these rocks and islands, and fish that lives under the sea.  He took us snorkeling for about half an hour.  He could name a lot of fish.  He pointed out the sea urchin, star fish, trumpet fish, puffy fish and a giant grouper.  The ride lasted for 3 and a half hours.  It was a very safe and talking to Ramsey was like attending a Marine Science seminar.  It was just great. I cannot explain more. Joe, from Monterey Park, Ca.

497174129.name: Vast, as-yet unspoiled expanse of gulf waters
497174129.author: a TripAdvisor user
497174129.reviewBody: Excellent locale for general boating, porpoise encounter sightseeing and photography, snorkeling (especially areas around Isla del Carmen that local captains know), kayaking, and of course fishing.

497069906.name: Great diving and swam with couple Whale Sharks!
497069906.author: a TripAdvisor user
497069906.reviewBody: The water is many gorgeous shades of turquoise, green and blue especially in the many coves that remind me of the movie The Blue Lagoon. Large variety of life under the surface makes for great diving and the rock formations are stunning as well. Swimming next to giant Whale Sharks for an hour as they circled around with curiosity over me definitely the high-lite of the trip and in only 20 feet of water!

495719656.name: Magic and Pristine.
495719656.author: a TripAdvisor user
495719656.reviewBody: At least there is one place on earth humans haven\'t mucked up.\nOn the glass bottom boat tour we saw zillions of fish, seabirds and dolphins!

492264028.name: Muy Tranquil
492264028.author: a TripAdvisor user
492264028.reviewBody: Cruising around the islands of Loreto Bay is beautiful.  Great water, nice temperatures and interesting scenery.  Snorkel, paddleboard, hike, fish... all great.  Visit the deserted Salt Mining location on Carmen Island.

492204552.name: Beautiful!
492204552.author: a TripAdvisor user
492204552.reviewBody: Clear, clean, warm water. Lots of marine life to see. Great fishing. Well preserved and protected areas.

489884466.name: dolphins
489884466.author: a TripAdvisor user
489884466.reviewBody: Took a 4 hr tour from our resort ,Villa del Palmar Fast vessel and lots of sea life viewing form the boat and Snorkeling from Danzante Island

489220941.name: Just a great way to spend the day
489220941.author: a TripAdvisor user
489220941.reviewBody: The waters around Loreto are so full of marine life, we say dolphins, jumping Manta Reys, Sea Lions,  and  jumping fish all in one after noon.

488752558.name: Spectacular scenery, amazing variety of animals and sealife!
488752558.author: a TripAdvisor user
488752558.reviewBody: We took 2 trips to Isla Coronado, the closest island to the Loreto marina.  The Glass Bottom Boat tour was informative, and we saw turtles and manta rays under our boat, and many sea creatures while stopping to snorkel at 3 spots around the island.  We went with Noe from Sea & Land Tours on our second trip. He speaks perfect English and is witty and knowledgeable.  He took lots of time to enjoy the dolphins jumping near our boat and even spotted orcas on our way back. The sandy beach on the back side of Isla Coronado has a couple of palapas and the most beautiful reef for snorkeling, shallow and easy even for a novice like me. Both planned trips included wristbands for entry to the marine park, and delicious, homemade foods.

484776500.name: Absolutely breath taking!!!!!
484776500.author: a TripAdvisor user
484776500.reviewBody: We take our own ocean going boat, there are guided trips for fishing and sight seeing. If you are in Loreto, BCS get out on the BEAUTIFUL Sea of Cortez!!!!!

482663963.name: Ramses our guide, was  great, very knowledgeable
482663963.author: a TripAdvisor user
482663963.reviewBody: We saw dolphins and manta rays as well a many types of fish. He explained the legends about the indigenous peoples.  Th

481250227.name: A beautiful spot not to be missed
481250227.author: a TripAdvisor user
481250227.reviewBody: Hire a panga with a Naturalist and get out on the Sea of Cortez! Head out to neighboring islands and enjoy the plentiful wildlife.

481095183.name: You must see when visiting Loreto
481095183.author: a TripAdvisor user
481095183.reviewBody: A beautiful national park that is a must see for anyone traveling to the loreto area. Amazing amount of stingrays and fish to observe while snorkeling.  I know others haven\'t mentioned this but I feel it\'s better than Playa or Cozumel or the Bahamas- and absolutely no comparison to Hawaii

480706124.name: Marine Sanctuary
480706124.author: a TripAdvisor user
480706124.reviewBody: Loreto, Baja Sur is on a beautiful bay that is the breeding and calving place for blue whales and other marine mammals. It was too late in the season for us to view them as they all had migrated away. We were told we could drive to the other side of the peninsula to see whales but we loved our spot in Nopolo that we didn\'t want to leave. We went kayaking off the golf course and the water was so clean and clear we were able to see lots of fish from above the water. The water is shallow for a long way out which makes it great for small children and The pelicans did belly flops to catch fish since it wasn\'t at all deep....very entertaining.\n

479778255.name: Beautiful
479778255.author: a TripAdvisor user
479778255.reviewBody: We went on a snorkeling tour. I enjoyed the sights in/around the National Marine Park. Guide was particularly helpful and knowledgeable about the marine life in the park and the park in general.

478370796.name: Isla Coronado
478370796.author: a TripAdvisor user
478370796.reviewBody: We took a panga to a beautiful beach on this island.  On the way we stopped to swim with sea lions, quite an experience!  Next time we will allow enough time to hike to the volcano at the top.

477689501.name: Stunning views and animal life
477689501.author: a TripAdvisor user
477689501.reviewBody: Enjoyed a boat tour of the island and the opportunity to see sea lions and a variety of birds including blue footed boobies. Took kayaks out for the display of a lifetime when a school of manta rays began jumping in a feeding frenzy within meters of our boats. A great day!

477484555.name: Sea of cortez
477484555.author: a TripAdvisor user
477484555.reviewBody: We love this place! The beauty,  adventures an sea life is outstanding!  We love to go out in the morning add the sunrises it is magnificent! Plan on showing meant more years discovering the hidden treasures of this area!

477438850.name: Best way to see the Marine Park is on the Glass Bottom Boat!
477438850.author: a TripAdvisor user
477438850.reviewBody: The marine life in this park is spectacular. We have been out on this beautiful area many rimes. The water is crystal clear so snorkeling and scuba diving are the perfect activities. There are many local captains all ready to take you out in the park. The best way is on the glass bottom boat adventure available Thur Loreto Coastal Expeditions.

477436381.name: Amazing blue whale encounters
477436381.author: a TripAdvisor user
477436381.reviewBody: Small boat tours are the best way to appreciate the inshore islands of Loreto. Lots of blue whales from Dec-Mar.

476856156.name: Stunning  Marine and Bird life
476856156.author: a TripAdvisor user
476856156.reviewBody: Took a Panga for five people from Loreto to Coronado island March 24th 2017 .We have been fortunate to visit many places in the world. However this trip rated very highly.  The bird life ranges form Terns,  to pelicans, herons, egrets  to Seahawks and eagles.  The highlights of this trip include a pod of 200 bottle nose dolphins, sea lions, with pups. The volcanic structure around Coronado is stunning, the water crystal clear. I saw three blue whales while golfing at Danzante bay as well. The snorkeling  at the halfway point ,was very good but not quite as clear as Danzante island .We had a great lunch on the beach, and drinks! all included,  A nice walk and rest on a beautiful white beach  with turquoise water. We  were stunned by the Dolphins, who put on the show of a life time, flipping, squeaking and jumping with their young .This is not a trip to be missed.  We paid about 4500 pesos ( for five adults)for the trip which include transportation from Danzante  to Loreto. That\'s about 800 pesos each. I would have paid more!!

475636964.name: Amazing sealife!
475636964.author: a TripAdvisor user
475636964.reviewBody: If you love to fish, snorkel, white sand beach or just look at sealife, this area is abundant!  I snorkeled with sea lions, watched a huge pod of dolphins swim by, manta rays jumping, humpback whale meander, lots of types of sea birds including blue foot boobies and enjoyed an amazing day of fishing.  Loved it!!

474652606.name: Don\'t miss it
474652606.author: a TripAdvisor user
474652606.reviewBody: Take a boat tour of the area and if you snorkel, make sure to bring your gear.  Ramssay from Danzante Tours (out of Villa del Palmar Islands of Loreto Resort) does a bang-up job as tour guide.  He is super knowledgeable and very funny.  Great way to spend 1/2 a day or more if you can.  I didn\'t verify this but I was told that this marine park is the largest in the world.

473939151.name: Awesooommmmee
473939151.author: a TripAdvisor user
473939151.reviewBody:
We asked a guy at the make on if he could take us to the park. His name was efren and he offered a tour to isla del carmen + isla Coronado for 2500 total ( we were two). 

So we bought some sandwiches at a store next to the port and got up the little boat. The tour was really nice and we saw lots of animals! 

The park is a must do for everyone visiting. Please make sure you take your garbage back with you.

472443256.name: Abundant Wildlife
472443256.author: a TripAdvisor user
472443256.reviewBody: We joined an organised Kayak tour in the Marine Park. Superb experience with daily whale and dolphin sightings.\nWe also joined a boat trip to see Blue Whales. Fabulous.

472408619.name: Nice setting and good food
472408619.author: a TripAdvisor user
472408619.reviewBody: Dinner was very good starting with tasty chocolate clam chowder (who knew there were chocolate clams). Our friend thought the chili rellenos with brisket was excellent. The margaritas were quite good too.

471133040.name: Wonderful way to relax close to everything
471133040.author: a TripAdvisor user
471133040.reviewBody: Whale watching, snorkeling, kayaking and fishing.  Beautiful crystal clean water and beaches.  A great way to spend the day!

470399866.name: Beautiful Marine Park
470399866.author: a TripAdvisor user
470399866.reviewBody: This marine park offers protection to many species of whales and other marine life.  It is a spectacularly beautiful place and still unspoiled by too many visitors.

469652800.name: Breathtaking!
469652800.author: a TripAdvisor user
469652800.reviewBody: An incredible natural paradise! Be sure to spend at least one day on a boat in this marine reserve, including a lunch stop on a secluded island beach!

468676595.name: Tours
468676595.author: a TripAdvisor user
468676595.reviewBody: Stayed at Villa De Palmar. Took tour of islands. Paul was our guide. He was informative, gracious and helpful. He made every effort to make sure we all had a great time.

468173293.name: A true treasure
468173293.author: a TripAdvisor user
468173293.reviewBody: From whales to fish to island hopping, this park is magnificent. Those that have not been here are missing a true worldly treasure. So much above and below the water and it is truly treated with respect. Very clean.

467251908.name: One of Loreto\'s Wonders
467251908.author: a TripAdvisor user
467251908.reviewBody: Make sure your trip to Loreto includes a boat trip to one of our Islands! I cannot stress this enough, we lived here for 3 years before we went "out to sea". We had no idea what we were missing! The water is crystalline, sea life is abundant, the air is pure, and the island beaches are pristine. You can snorkel, sunbath, fish, swim, beach-comb, or just enjoy the company of the boat. Another Loreto "must-do"!

467054322.name: Beautiful and dramatic
467054322.author: a TripAdvisor user
467054322.reviewBody: Took a six day kayaking trip that included Isla Carmen and Danzante.  Kayaking was fabulous for those with good skills ( recommend Sea Kayak Baja Mexico for guides or outfitting).  Could hang out at the tide pools for hours.  Saw blue whale blows, dolphins, all manner of birds.  Beaches are dramatic and short hikes for great views at some spots.

466671696.name: Take the time
466671696.author: a TripAdvisor user
466671696.reviewBody: Get on a boat tour and go for a ride.Even if you don\'t snorkel, Coronado Island, the sea life and the scenery are totally worth the money.

465310095.name: Gorgeous views
465310095.author: a TripAdvisor user
465310095.reviewBody: So much to do in this park. Anything from whale watching to diving to kayaking to camping, all with amazing views

464624098.name: Beautiful sunset, just like the one above
464624098.author: a TripAdvisor user
464624098.reviewBody: Snorkling, boating, lunch on the beach. The water was so flat when we started out. This is a pristine area that is clearly being protected. There are seals, birds, dolphins and whales. The water is clear and there are many fish.

463248061.name: Pristine Nature in this Marine Park
463248061.author: a TripAdvisor user
463248061.reviewBody: All kinds of bird life and shells on this long stretch of sand along the bay.  Hardly anyone out there just you and nature!

463211999.name: Wonderful
463211999.author: a TripAdvisor user
463211999.reviewBody: We took a tour with Danzante Tours at the resort to see the blue whales. Excellent experience. Our guide Rammses was fantastic and knowledgeable. Not only did we see blue whales but also a hump back whale. \nThe whole area is wild with scrubland, wildlife and some great walks. Well worth a visit.

462006857.name: Incredible Bay of Cortez
462006857.author: a TripAdvisor user
462006857.reviewBody: The waters on the Sea of Cortez are protected and not subject to waves and currents on the Pacific Ocean side of Baja, so the fish and whales have calm, warm water with few predators to live and birth their babies. Wonderful that the Mexican government makes this a National Park. You pay a little and are given a wristband when you hire a panga, a boat to take you out, but it\'s the best money you can spend to preserve ocean life. Kudos to the Mexican government for doing this, and not allowing large fishing boats inside the lagoon. Your tourist dollars help continue their conservation efforts. We saw two blue whales and many dolphins. Fantastic experience.

461828416.name: Take time to visit
461828416.author: a TripAdvisor user
461828416.reviewBody: The Loreto Bay National Marine Park area is beautiful.  We swam, snorkeled, kayaked, had lunch on a spectacular beach.  There is also an option for hiking a volcano.  We went with a company out of Loreto that charged $90 per person, which seemed reasonable for a day trip.  I would recommend you take the time to enjoy this area.

461591101.name: You\'d be surprised how much Mexico cares about the Sea of Cortez
461591101.author: a TripAdvisor user
461591101.reviewBody: They are very conscious of pollution. U will not see any local throw so much as a cigarette butt into the Sea. Of course the Canadian and American dollars are the heart of this area. The Sea is abundant w Sea life.

461452602.name: Seeing blue whales
461452602.author: a TripAdvisor user
461452602.reviewBody: We used Land and Sea tour company. Very good. Arturo was our captain and had a lovely demeanor and also wanted us to see the blue whales and we did!

461445758.name: Beautiful
461445758.author: a TripAdvisor user
461445758.reviewBody: What a beautiful place, we saw dolphins and blue whales, could not ask for more. Great tours are offered all over.

461240540.name: Fabulous
461240540.author: a TripAdvisor user
461240540.reviewBody: This is a beautiful national Park. I came to observe Blue Whales. I highly recommend a visit if you are a respectful \nnature lover

459377930.name: Don\'t miss this
459377930.author: a TripAdvisor user
459377930.reviewBody: Fascinating to see the variety of marine life in this desert setting.  We stayed at the time share south of Loreto and took the boat tour - well worth while

458566574.name: Beautiful
458566574.author: a TripAdvisor user
458566574.reviewBody: This park is made up of 5 islands off the coast of Loreto. We only visited Coronado Island and it was a wonderful wildlife, scenery and beach experience.

458485640.name: Snorkel trip
458485640.author: a TripAdvisor user
458485640.reviewBody: Excellent. Many islands. We saw 6 blue whales and 2 hump back whales. Also saw dolphins. We snorkel off Carmen island and saw many fish and sting rays

457441573.name: Blue Whale Watching and Snorkeling
457441573.author: a TripAdvisor user
457441573.reviewBody: We got lucky in that blue whales, that we had never seen before, were just coming into the Sea of Cortez.  We got to see eight or ten of them on the tour, and then some of the best snorkeling we\'ve seen in a while.  The water was cold but the tour provided wet suits.  It was a great time.

454590118.name: Amazing area
454590118.author: a TripAdvisor user
454590118.reviewBody: Many islands, snorkeling places, kayaking, marine life. Need permit to enter sanctuary. Definitely a place to see

453370158.name: Boat to Coronado beach.  Beautiful beach to hang out.
453370158.author: a TripAdvisor user
453370158.reviewBody: We took a boat to Coronado Island ( one of the islands in the park area) and it is very worth it . We also walked the other direction ( south ) from the Malecon and saw many birds . I think the entire area around Loreto town is part of this huge marine park. It is such an honourable thing that the Mexican government has designated this area as protected.

452822180.name: WOW
452822180.author: a TripAdvisor user
452822180.reviewBody: the bay is very beautiful and breathtaking, very different from the crowd LA paz and opposite from Cabo. Still natural and undeveloped! Love it

451965439.name: Great to visit if the sea is calm
451965439.author: a TripAdvisor user
451965439.reviewBody: Went out fishing twice and also took a tour of the islands. Great rugged scenery. Nice to see porpoises and sea lions. The fishing was real good. Seas were quite choppy.

451930692.name: Fishing in the Bay
451930692.author: a TripAdvisor user
451930692.reviewBody: Fishing is what brought me and my father to this beautiful part of the world and we were not the least bit unimpressed.

450014968.name: Great day trip!
450014968.author: a TripAdvisor user
450014968.reviewBody:
Had a really nice day tour with Placido- very scenic with good bird sightings, habituated sea lions, and great snorkeling without a wetsuit despite being January. Chilly, but not too bad...
Placido prides himself with a spotless boat in good condition, and charged just $100 for the 5-6 hour day. Need to bring everything for a days outing yourself- food water towel and the usual out in the sun necessities.
He has no internet and knows nothing about TripAdvisor.
We arranged our outing a day ahead of time- just drive out to the boat harbor at the end of the malecon about 8 am and you'll find several boats and captains available for hire. Advisable to take a look at the boat and inquire about prices and what's included beforehand and drop a deposit to secure a great experience!
On Coronado Island there is a nice hike option of 600 feet elevation gain in 1.8 miles but good footwear is needed for the last bit- this from a popular place with shaded eating and outhouses- and excellent snorkeling out a couple hundred yards. 
Must do while in Loreto- Placido's boat is the Cristhian.

447202148.name: fishing!
447202148.author: a TripAdvisor user
447202148.reviewBody: excellent fishing in the Sea of Cortez! Plus dolphin\'s followed us out and swam along side. A fin whale came by and surfaced near the boat, and we toured around some of the Islands.

446143034.name: So beautiful!
446143034.author: a TripAdvisor user
446143034.reviewBody: This is a treasure! The views are stunning and both times we were out there on this trip the water was smooth as glass!

444059290.name: Out and about
444059290.author: a TripAdvisor user
444059290.reviewBody: We took the day trip to the Coronado Islands. Marine life is abundant and you can see seals and sealions and all kinds of local birds. The water was not particularly warm (whales come here after all) but if you\'re snorkeling, you see a lot of very colorful fish. White sand in the Island, and a perfect day at sea.

441246759.name: Swim With Sea Lions? Yes, Please!
441246759.author: a TripAdvisor user
441246759.reviewBody:
Coronado Island is bigger than it looks, with lots of scenic volcanic rock formations and a sandy picnic beach. The snorkeling is good, though sometimes the plankton can obscure visibility. But, the whales like it so...

The highlight form me was being  able to get close to the sea lion colony in the water and see them dive and swim below me. They don't seem to mind the people and go about their business as if you aren't there.

We were not there during whale season, but I'd come back just for that.

440930026.name: Most beautiful spot on earth
440930026.author: a TripAdvisor user
440930026.reviewBody: We love Loreto bay national marine park. The sea life changes every month . We have seen blue whales, humpbacks, Menke whales , fin backs, hundreds of dolphin, rays and the list could go on! Once out on our kayak a whale shark swam beneath us. If you love nature this is an amazing place! I think February is my favorite month!

440905055.name: Nice, but not Cozumel
440905055.author: a TripAdvisor user
440905055.reviewBody: We dove and there\'s not much coral, just a rocky coast.  If you want great diving do Cozumel.  Blah blah

435993347.name: Fantastic Baja Islands
435993347.author: a TripAdvisor user
435993347.reviewBody: Jacques Cousteau listed the Sea of Cortez as one of his all-time favorite dive/water destinations. These waters are special and we\'ve seen everything from sperm whales to orcas and blue whales in these amazing waters.

435671911.name: Marine Parks Do Make a Difference
435671911.author: a TripAdvisor user
435671911.reviewBody:
We were on a liveaboard diving throughout the full length of the Sea of Cortez. In the north the fish life was scarce. It wasn't until we reached the Loreto Bay National Marine Park that we had wonderful marine life.
The Sea Lions are so much fun to swim with and while we down we saw  a huge school of Jacks and a school of Mobula Rays. There was also lots of tropical fish including the magnificent King Angelfish.
The scenery above water is just as spectacular with rugged cactus covered island which are home to lots and lots of birds.
This place is well worth the visit. It is fabulous.

435623511.name: Absolutely unparalelled
435623511.author: a TripAdvisor user
435623511.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beaches, unbelievable landscapes, birds, animals and sea life.  A true sanctuary unadulterated by the hand of man.

434399650.name: Island of Loreto
434399650.author: a TripAdvisor user
434399650.reviewBody: Danzante Bay is an aquarium. Great Snorkeling Fishing Scuba perfect Paradise. \nHighly recommend Danzante Bay Tours- Ask for Rammases, he knows this Bay inside and out and is an informed naturalist.

433695728.name: The Aquarium of the World
433695728.author: a TripAdvisor user
433695728.reviewBody: I would encourage anyone who loves Nature, the Ocean and swims to visit here fairly soon, before developers arrive and start filling the area with large hotels, etc.The visibility in the water is amazing! 20- 80 feet! We saw angelfish, starfish, a few rays, and hundreds of gold and blue stripers during our snorkeling expedition. Those that went scuba diving, saw turtles and a huge variety of other fish. In February the whales return to birth their calves and we will go for that next year. Amaaaazing place!

433377323.name: Tantalizing-- Above & Below!
433377323.author: a TripAdvisor user
433377323.reviewBody: We toured the National Marine Park as part of dive experience w/ Dolphin Dive Baja.  We got to see a variety of fish (including sea lions, baracuda (in a ball), seals, porpoise, parrot fish, lobster, etc).

432803358.name: Epic fishing and boating activities
432803358.author: a TripAdvisor user
432803358.reviewBody:
We went on 4 quieted fishing trips with guide Francisco Omar Mayoral Davis, the best quite in all of Baja.
He put me on fish everyday and showed us all the islands off Loreto.
On one trip, after catching snapper and triggerfish, he took us to Coronado Island and barbecued the fish and then made fish tacos with chocolate clam dip on the side... Delicious!
My wife had broke her arm on the vacation and could not snorkel or kayak, but I did snorkel off the island and it was Hawaii quality.
We have never been to such pristine water with that much marine life... Dolphins, whales, flying fish, seals, sea lions, you name it.
Go here!!!!

431875507.name: Beautiful
431875507.author: a TripAdvisor user
431875507.reviewBody: It\'s so beautiful here and so much to do. Snorkeling, fishing, kayaking and just hanging out. The water is so clear. I watch the fish while we were fishing. We saw dolphins, turtles, sea lions, marlin and even a minke whale! Awesome!

431661619.name: Outstanding snorkel trip
431661619.author: a TripAdvisor user
431661619.reviewBody: So many places to snorkel. Beautiful scenery. Seals, dolphins and many types birds. Caves, cactus and white sand beach.

430027928.name: Nature Lovers
430027928.author: a TripAdvisor user
430027928.reviewBody: Sea lions, snorkeling, birds, beautiful secluded beaches, birds! Take the boat ride around the island.

428957935.name: Beautiful Place to Enjoy Nature
428957935.author: a TripAdvisor user
428957935.reviewBody: Amazing place-so glad it is a National Marine Park.  It is a pristine, natural spiritual place everyone should be lucky enough to visit.\nLots of beautiful coves, sea life, interesting rock formations, and \nwhite sand beaches.  Good snorkeling in the reefs.  Sea lions, dolphins and schools of fish.

428949100.name: Beauty and sea life
428949100.author: a TripAdvisor user
428949100.reviewBody: Went on a panga (small fishing boat) to Coronado Island which is in the Marine Park.  On the way to wonderful snorkeling locations we saw dolphins, sea turtles, seal colony.  The snorkeling is lovely with great reef fish including rays, damsels, puffers, etc.  If you want to relax on the beach, there are several lovely beaches with golden sand on the island.  The water is shallow and clear.  Lovely day trip.

428906634.name: Outstanding place!
428906634.author: a TripAdvisor user
428906634.reviewBody: We just took a boat tour around the islands and it was fantastic!   Just amazing.  I wanted to stay out there.....

424484317.name: Stunning, many islands to see, great snorkeling and diving
424484317.author: a TripAdvisor user
424484317.reviewBody: Many tours, lots of great diving and snorkeling spots. We did get into a lot of jelly fish, so recommend rash guards. In fall the viz is amazing, the water looks like carribean. The islands are plentiful and offer different wildlife on each, so very interesting to tour around. There is a square arch you can get to by boat, catamaran tours, etc. February is supposed to be the best for whale-watching, which boasts 9 varieties of whales. It\'s worth going to Loreto just for this scenery.

419475475.name: Snorkeling and scuba diving
419475475.author: a TripAdvisor user
419475475.reviewBody: Water was great in temperature and clarity.we saw many creatures and beautiful views of the many islands in the sea of Cortez

417677923.name: Beautiful Area
417677923.author: a TripAdvisor user
417677923.reviewBody: Did 2 dives here. Area was healthy with water temp in the mid 80s and reefs were healthy.The visibility was at least 80 feet or more.

410095396.name: Secluded bays
410095396.author: a TripAdvisor user
410095396.reviewBody: I\'ve been fishing here a number of times, and there are usually a ton of fish.  There weren\'t this trip.  A couple of grouper and snapper.  So we turned our attention to snorkelling.  On every island in the park there are a ton of secluded bays perfect to jump off the boat and get out of the heat.  Make sure you buy your fishing license at the harbour, and the marine park bracelet.  The money goes to protecting the park.  This trip we saw tons of dolphins, little manta rays jumping, and plenty of reef fish.  If you don\'t have your own boat, there are plenty of pangas for rent.

408833421.name: Amaze balls!
408833421.author: a TripAdvisor user
408833421.reviewBody: First you must go with Daniel from Land and Sea tours. He cares, he knows his stuff, he serves a good lunch and he doesn\'t get in a hurry. Be sure to tip him. He is a doll. \nWe got to see Sea Lions, Dolphins, Frigate birds, Osprey, Blue Footed Boobies, snorkel with fish and starfish. You will not want to get out of the water. \nBring your camera and sunscreen.

406778759.name: Better than Sea World
406778759.author: a TripAdvisor user
406778759.reviewBody: Such a wonderful experience. We rented a panga for a 4-hour tour tour around Danzante and Playa del Carmen and were fortunate enough to encounter a couple of whales and several dolphins

400985952.name: Snorkle and scuba paradise
400985952.author: a TripAdvisor user
400985952.reviewBody: This is a must go for snorklers and scuba divers, although in the summer the top 6-8 inches of water can get very hot as the sea of Cortez does not disturb the warter here. Also watch for pufferfish

396787415.name: Snorkeling in the waters around the islands - saw whales as well
396787415.author: a TripAdvisor user
396787415.reviewBody:
We went snorkeling on a RIB (Rigid inflatable boat) around Danzante and Sherman islands. The boat picked us up at VDP, although they have others that leave from the marina.
This last trip we say huge Fin whales - multiple pods of mothers with their calf. All breaching within 100 feet of us: a truly amazing experience. These are the 2nd largest whales and their size is quite impressive.
Snorkeling is great with clear water and a lot of sea life (tangs, wrasses, puffers, pipe fish, star fish, etc) and the guide picked up an octopus for us to touch (and he put it back of course) as well as pointing out more unusual things.
We also ran into a massive school of Manta Rays - looks like a black cloud under the water until you get close and can see each one. Really worth it.
May want to bring your own lunch as they have just simple tasteless sandwiches (not mexican food oddly) and chips.
The boat captain is very informed and provides a lot of history and detail about the park (sea of cortez marine sanctuary).

395918315.name: Beautiful Park Studded with small mountain islands
395918315.author: a TripAdvisor user
395918315.reviewBody: We just got back from a week at the Villa Palmar situated on Danzante Bay in the Park.  The Park is breathtakingly beautiful and fairly pristine as it is a Mexican Sanctuary (restricted development, no jet ski\'s or powerboats allowed. We took a sunset catamaran cruise through Wild Loreto Tours. We saw a bowfin whale and a large pod of dolphins in the Park as well as a beautiful sunset against the hillsides and mountains thet surround the bay. On previous trips we also took a snorkle tour to the Coronado Island in the Park. We love the Loreto area and now own a timeshare at the Villa del Palmar resort.

392137822.name: A nice day, but spoiled by jellyfish
392137822.author: a TripAdvisor user
392137822.reviewBody: We rented a panga for a 6-hour tour to Coronado Island and saw a grey whale, sea lions, a large pod of dolphin and an octopus.  the "pearls of the sea" invisible jellyfish were rampant on the east side of the island, but the sandy white beach coves on the west side were thankfully not affected.  The sandy white coves had rocky outcrops with live coral.  I saw a small octopus -- about 10 inches in length -- in a coral field.  It changed color as it moved from spot to spot.  Very cool.  Otherwise, the snorkeling was fairly unexciting.  Reef fish (mostly Sergeant Majors along with some wrasse, triggerfish and a couple of barracuda) -- approximately on par with that island off the coast of Puerto Vallarta (side note -- the Puerto Vallarta tour is not worth the cost or time).  One of the ex pats in town said the a long sleeve rash guard would help protect against the jellyfish.  They also intimated that this was a year round problem, but no one really wanted to talk about it much.  And a rash guard would not help with leg stings or face stings...

390722607.name: Whales!
390722607.author: a TripAdvisor user
390722607.reviewBody: Wildlife is not to be missed. We saw lots of whales, manta rays, doulphins, blue footed booby and great scenery

389170700.name: Marine Wildlife!
389170700.author: a TripAdvisor user
389170700.reviewBody: Went out on a chartered fishing trip and got to see whales, dolphin, manta rays, leaping marlin and more!

386665527.name: A must see!
386665527.author: a TripAdvisor user
386665527.reviewBody: Just to see the beautiful waters in the islands of Carmen and Danzante, is breathtaking. The different marine species, the different avian species, added bonus. The dolphins giving you a free show- Priceless! Many stingrays jumping and hitting the waters, so exciting!

376420861.name: A most special place
376420861.author: a TripAdvisor user
376420861.reviewBody: We toured both Coronado and Danzante Islands. Very different tours and we loved both.   Even when it isn\'t whale season there is plenty of wildlife including sea lions, Dolphins, and usual birds. Coronado has one of the beautiful beaches you will ever see

375013334.name: It is So Nice.
375013334.author: a TripAdvisor user
375013334.reviewBody: Sparkling beaches full of fish. Shuffle your feet when walking in the water as there are sting rays, Speaking of rays in May the rays they call Mantas there breed in May and jump out of the water 8 feet and land with a slap attracting the females to the sound which you can hear from far away. You can see the water black with them.

374230883.name: My favorite water park
374230883.author: a TripAdvisor user
374230883.reviewBody: I made 2 boat trips this holiday. Once to isla Carmen and a separate trip to isla Coronado. While sand beaches, crystal clear blue turquoise waters are breathtaking.\nWe saw big mana rays, big sea turtles, Dolphins, sea lions and\nLots of birds. Did you know there are snakes on the islands? Love the marine park. Ask your boat captain to stop at La  Picazon for a cold drink or lunch. Lunch will take an hour or more so negotiation with the boat captain total cost.

372693874.name: Very cool
372693874.author: a TripAdvisor user
372693874.reviewBody: If in the Loreto area, go! Beautiful, lots of beautiful fish, live coral. You can scuba, snorkel and snuba. There are kayak tours from Loreto where you tour for days with a guide and sleep on the beaches! There are also tour boats that will take you out for the day. In late winter, early spring the whales come into the Sea of Cortez and can be seen at the preserve.

372656824.name: best of sea de cortez
372656824.author: a TripAdvisor user
372656824.reviewBody: loreto bay is became a big town. former Nopolo, is a resort very lovely. the sea is magnificent.. when the sun rise ,the spectacle is superb......it is wonderful to go boating, fishing or .....very romantic... life time experience///

372209272.name: Out of this world
372209272.author: a TripAdvisor user
372209272.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful.We rented a panga for 1/2 a day to take us around Coronado island. We saw so much marine life, Rays,Dolphins,Turtles to name a few.\nThe white sand beaches on the island are exquisite.

371328697.name: A life time experience
371328697.author: a TripAdvisor user
371328697.reviewBody: We arranged a tour of the Marine Park through our resort and experienced a memory that will remainder a life time.  Not only did we see beautiful vistas but our guide would us a school of porpoises which we estimated at close to a thousand of these extraordinary creatures.  What fun it was to enjoy them frolicking around our boat.

369684816.name: Beautiful BUT - Nature Bites Back Sometimes
369684816.author: a TripAdvisor user
369684816.reviewBody: We visited islands in the park on our sailboat. We have cruised the coasts of North America, Central America and the Caribbean for 20,000 miles over 13 years. We anchored in three bays in the islands and were pleased with the stark beauty of the land and seascapes.   We hiked on Isla Carmen and did a nice walk on Isla Danzante.   But there were some problems as well.   The water was full of long, thin jelly-fish with the appearance of stings of pearls about 2-3 mm in diameter and perhaps up to a meter or more in length - and they sting.   So we could not snorkel when and where we wanted to.  On Isla Carmen were were inundated by pesky black flies - they did not bite but they did distract from our enjoyment of our hike across to Bahia Salinas .   As well, on Isla Carmen there was a sign posted at Bahia Ballandra, a popular anchorage, stating that the land was off limits to hiking at it was licensed to hunting operations.   At Isla Coronado I snorkelled and when I returned to wash myself and my gear with fresh water we were swarmed by wasps seeking fresh water.   As well, in April the water can be chilly for swimming without a wet suit.    I will post a lovely photo showing the beauty of the sunset at Isla Carmen, but also another showing wasps on our snorkel gear as it soaks in water....  Honestly, nature can be beautiful but also can be very unpleasant at times.

367432380.name: Desert and the Sea of Cortez side-by-side
367432380.author: a TripAdvisor user
367432380.reviewBody: We recently finished a guided kayak/snorkeling/camping trip here with ROW Adventures and had the time of our lives!  Everything was well kept and clean, but kept natural and limited man intervention.  We say numerous tropical fish, manta rays, sting rays, dolphins, a scorpion and spectacular views of aqua waters alongside desert vistas. We can\'t say enough good things.  What a treasure!

367051270.name: Great Day of Boating
367051270.author: a TripAdvisor user
367051270.reviewBody: The islands in the National Marine Park offer endless opportunity for scuba, snorkeling, fishing, kayaking and hiking

365773661.name: Dolphins galore
365773661.author: a TripAdvisor user
365773661.reviewBody: Went out for the day to one of the islands Coronado, where having passed through a large pod of dolphins who played in the bow wave of the boat, we went snorkelling, saw a colony of sealions and had a tasty burritos lunch. Also saw a humming bird during the walk round the island. Our boat captain, Marcos, was very helpful explaining what we saw and took time to ensure we had a good day. It was supposed to be a whale watching trip but by the time we had arrived in Loreto the whales had moved on. That said one of the other boats managed to find two humpbacks.\nAn excellent day out

365262672.name: Beautiful Loreto area
365262672.author: a TripAdvisor user
365262672.reviewBody: This wonderful area and Marine Park is one of the most beautiful places in the world.  Worth anyones time that wishes to explore the beauty of water, islands, and the wonderful folks that live here.

364137326.name: Amazing place
364137326.author: a TripAdvisor user
364137326.reviewBody: I go to Loreto every year for 2 weeks, it is an amazing place. I love the solitude. There are no McDonalds or Burger Kings but there is plenty to do if you want too. My specialty is Whale watching the gently giants .. The Blue whale.  They are only there Jan and Feb and a little of March.  A must is to visit the Whale Museum just off of the board walk.  The people are friendly and most helpful, shops of all kinds.  Some of the best food at Hotel 1697.  Enjoy

359563895.name: Beautiful and Untouched
359563895.author: a TripAdvisor user
359563895.reviewBody: They don\'t allow jet skis or speeding boats, they care for the marine life and keep it very protected. It is a very special place :)

359472816.name: Whales and dolphins and rays, oh my!
359472816.author: a TripAdvisor user
359472816.reviewBody: This protected area off the coast of Loreto is a nature lover\'s paradise. During my Feb/March stay, I saw blue whales, manta rays, pods of dolphins, and incredible array of fish. Lots of tour companies will take you diving or snorkelling from town - the islands have sandy beaches, and at some, like Coronado, you can snorkel with sea lions! Fabulous day.

357593281.name: One of the most stunning places
357593281.author: a TripAdvisor user
357593281.reviewBody: in the world. Not to be missed. Islands, water, desert atmosphere. Great for kayaking or just enjoying.

356586793.name: Natural & Proud of it
356586793.author: a TripAdvisor user
356586793.reviewBody: The marine park has an a uncle of wildlife & spectacular geography that is worth taking the time to experience.  Blue whales calving and sea lion colonies can be expected in February & March.  The tours are available for all levels of interest & time, from large boats to kayaks by the hour, day or days.  The local pride in nature is obvious & one of the best reasons for visiting the Loreto area is to experience it\'s natural wonders,....then enjoy the cuisine in town.

355150588.name: Beautiful!
355150588.author: a TripAdvisor user
355150588.reviewBody: We spent the day on the ocean experiencing Dolphins and other marine life. On the front of Coronado Island there is a beautiful white sand beach with huts where you can stop, swim, snorkle and have lunch,

354324707.name: Terrific Marine Life
354324707.author: a TripAdvisor user
354324707.reviewBody: The islands in the park are all very interesting and worth visiting, but the highlight is the whales, dolphins, rays and assorted tropical fish that can be seen in abundance by either diving or snorkeling.

354215574.name: Breaching whales everywhere.
354215574.author: a TripAdvisor user
354215574.reviewBody: This is a clean, well-maintained marine park. We saw whales everywhere and we were able to get close. It is sheltered from the wind, for the most part. We highly recommend whale-watching here. Iris very reasonable.

353675974.name: Loreto Bay
353675974.author: a TripAdvisor user
353675974.reviewBody: This national park is clean and quiet and offers plenty to see. We toured by boat and hiked to see different beaches and marine life along the shores.

353458093.name: Wonderful time with Rodrigo aboard the Paulita.
353458093.author: a TripAdvisor user
353458093.reviewBody: When in Loreto last week, we wanted to check out the area by water.  Our concierge at La Mision, Lucio, gave us some ideas, and booked a trip for the two of us with Rodrigo on his boat the Paulita.  We met Rodrigo in the morning at the marina, he took us out to Coronado Island.  While en route, we encountered dolphins in the water, humpback whales, and lots of pelicans and other birds.  My husband snorkeled with the sea lions on the backside of the island.  It was very exciting to see these animals in the wild!  We also stopped at the beach.  Several pangas were there, but it was not crowded!  It was a wonderful day on the water, and Rodrigo was a great and knowledgeable captain.

353431056.name: Beautiful!
353431056.author: a TripAdvisor user
353431056.reviewBody: Went out looking for the elusive blue whales and had great success. Tour guide was Julio with Desert and Sea in Loreto and he was fabulous!! Saw four blue whales, a pod of about 50 dolphins, humpback whales and manta rays jumping.  We were within 30 feet of one of the blue whales and it left an imprint on our minds that will last forever. Highly recommend Julio!

352493066.name: Sights and Sounds of Loreto!
352493066.author: a TripAdvisor user
352493066.reviewBody: This was our first time in this part of the Baja and it did not disappoint! That this part of the ocean has been turned into a National Park is awesome !!

351994991.name: WOW!
351994991.author: a TripAdvisor user
351994991.reviewBody: Breathtaking wildlife, the most amazing scenery, and unforgettable memories. We went whale watching and fishing and the natural beauty and abundance of life here cannot be overstated. This is a gem, not only for Mexico but in the world.

350066011.name: Stunning scenery and very uncrowded
350066011.author: a TripAdvisor user
350066011.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful areas you can imagine.  The marine life is amazing!  We saw humpback whales, blue whales, common dolphins, bottlenose dolphins, huge manta rays and even a turtle on our outing.  The area is surrounded by islands and islets.  The water is clear and dark blue in the deep areas and crystal clear and a Caribbean green in shallow areas.  Not too many boats and the captains all seem to be very familiar with the area and marine life.  Fantastic place to visit what Jacques Cousteau called the \'Aquarium of the World\'

348953790.name: Danzante Island Tour - Incredible!
348953790.author: a TripAdvisor user
348953790.reviewBody: Saw blue whales, humpbacks, manta rays jumping out of the water, sea lions and many different birds.  The water is pristine, the area is huge and uncrowded.  Gorgeous islands with great topography.  An incredible part of the world!!

348307443.name: Outstanding marine park
348307443.author: a TripAdvisor user
348307443.reviewBody: We took a boat out to Coronado island for snorkelling and sunbathing. We saw loads of fishes, boobies, pelicans, sea lions and a whale in the distance. Had a great time and would recommend it to anyone staying in Loreto. Just walk down to the marina and and organise your own boat with one of the captains.

344520492.name: Untouched paradise
344520492.author: a TripAdvisor user
344520492.reviewBody: Between the flora, geology and marine life you are another planet.  Kayaking between some of the islands and camping out, one of my best vacations ever!

342660403.name: Dont miss going to the islands.
342660403.author: a TripAdvisor user
342660403.reviewBody: My wife and i took several excursions to the islands. By panga, by catamaran and even rented a kayak.
