The Coronado island is grat but we went to some secluded spots on the catamaran tour on the other island. Really an incredible beach. water was cold but warmer than back home. Great sea life and lots of dolphins. even saw spouts of whales in the distance.

339166040.name: Beautiful above and below the water
339166040.author: a TripAdvisor user
339166040.reviewBody:
Very well protected Sea of Cortez Marine Park. Great scuba and snorkel dive sites and beautiful deserted island beaches
to explore. Water and air in low 70's
Comfortable in and out of the water 
City water safe to drink too

338783347.name: Isla Carmen off shore
338783347.author: a TripAdvisor user
338783347.reviewBody: We were on an Un-Cruise Adventure boat and spent time in the park snorkeling just off shore on Isla Carmen and cruised around parts of the island in skiffs to explore the rock formations, caves and lots of bird life. Didn\'t see any whales or dolphins and there the last week in December.\nIf you visit Loreto I would definitely recommend getting off shore to see the local islands.

336009808.name: loved the biodiversity
336009808.author: a TripAdvisor user
336009808.reviewBody: Absolutely loved the marine life in this magical place. The dolphins, manta rays, blue-footed boobies, cormorants are abundant. Didn\'t see whale sharks. The sands on the islands are white. Lovely place.

332310197.name: World Aquarium
332310197.author: a TripAdvisor user
332310197.reviewBody: Cruising the Sea of Cortes within the Marine Park area surrounding Loreto, BCS is an incredible experience.  Most any time of year there are Dolphins, sea lions, seals, Blue Footed Boobies,  egrets, blue heron, and more sea life than can easily be named here.\n\nIn the winter months the whales migrate into the area and put on incredible water shows.

329715855.name: Amazing offshore playground that costs about $2. for admission.
329715855.author: a TripAdvisor user
329715855.reviewBody: Mexico took a huge step forward in creating the Marine Park.  Sustainability for everyone is the goal, and we all benefit from this effort.

328976525.name: UN VERDADERO PARAISO NATURAL UNICO
328976525.author: a TripAdvisor user
328976525.reviewBody: It is a wonderful big place to visit by a rental boat or arranged tour. It takes you around very beauiful islands just in front Loreto, clear waters, is a paradise for snorkeling, swim and wacht Dolphins by and in winter whales, etc.  The beaches are white sand,impolutes and color of the seas are great.

328696757.name: Well worth it.
328696757.author: a TripAdvisor user
328696757.reviewBody: By all means take a boat ride out to snorkel on Coronado Island.  The water and beach is gorgeous and you get to see Blue-footed Boobies too!

328231049.name: What a paradise!
328231049.author: a TripAdvisor user
328231049.reviewBody: This is as nice a stretch of coast and coastal islands as may be found anywhere in North America. The beaches are uncrowded, and most are reasonably clean. It would be hard to sit down with a pen and paper and draw out any more scenic vistas, points, coves and beaches. The fishing is NOT what it used to be in years gone by however. My group did not see a single porpoise, whale, whale shark, or manta ray in my 8 days here, though that was primarily due to the season and some off weather.

322701864.name: I can see why Jacques Cousteau called it the "Aquarium of the World"!
322701864.author: a TripAdvisor user
322701864.reviewBody: Amazing place to snorkeling.  Looking forward to returning for the whales.  Great views above and below the surface of the water!

321487715.name: Underwater Paradise
321487715.author: a TripAdvisor user
321487715.reviewBody: We toured and snorkeled Cornado Island, Carmen and Danzante Islands. Our Danzante tour was lead by Daniel who was very knowledgeable of the islands and pointed out many wonderful details.  We snorkeled in an area that was amazing! I saw fish that I have only seen in expensive fish stores. I saw star fish, eels, a large school of sardines, angel fish, etc... If you stick with Daniel, he will guide you to areas that are full of sea life. This tour was one of the highlights of our trip. We booked this tour through Danzante Tours while staying at Villa del Palmar and it was so worth it.

314047105.name: It is the World\'s Aquarium
314047105.author: a TripAdvisor user
314047105.reviewBody: Thank God for Jacques Cousteau, who was instrumental in making the Mexican Government make this National Marine Park because, as he said, it IS the world\'s aquarium!!!  Absolutely stunning.  so much life, so much bio diversity, such an important ecosystem!   we snorkeled and saw so, so many fish, it was incredible,  we even saw a "fish nursery" where the fish lay their eggs in the shallowest parts of the water.  the water was so clear because the salinity is so high. we saw mobula rays jump (awesome).. it was too hot for seals and sea lions and of course the whales were gone to cooler water.  but, we will be back in January to see the whales ( a trip on my bucket list!)

313324925.name: Loreto Bay the World\'s Aquarium
313324925.author: a TripAdvisor user
313324925.reviewBody: This is the world\'s aquarium.  Within 50 feet of Loreto Bay (Nopolo just south of the town of Loreto) you can see whale sharks, dolphin, stingrays, and tons of other sea creatures.

310016352.name: Skip it if your under 50
310016352.author: a TripAdvisor user
310016352.reviewBody: Really nice town, great for fishing. Kind of boring ir you are under 50. Coronado Island is amazing.

303892789.name: Scenery!
303892789.author: a TripAdvisor user
303892789.reviewBody: Awesome scenery and wildlife.  Neat to see the rays jumping out of the water and the sunsets were so spectacular they looked fake!

298329792.name: Fantastic fishing and snorkeling
298329792.author: a TripAdvisor user
298329792.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time seeing a variety of fish which snorkeling in the clear warm water, and we caught lots of Dorado on our fishing trips.

296931941.name: Don\'t miss this!
296931941.author: a TripAdvisor user
296931941.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time. Snorkelling, paddle boarding, dolphin watching, cave viewing (in our boat) yummy lunch

296369836.name: Heavenly1
296369836.author: a TripAdvisor user
296369836.reviewBody: Beautiful marine life! You can snorkel, paddle board, kayak, or take day trips by boat to islands surrounding the bays.

295038320.name: Unique in the World
295038320.author: a TripAdvisor user
295038320.reviewBody: Loreto Bay Marine Park is the heart of Loreto.  The abundance and variety of marine life is the essence of the Sea of Cortez.  Any season is the right season.  In winter see the largest mammal on earth, the Blue Whale as well as Fin Whales, Humpbacks and an occasional Orca.   In summer bask in the warmth of the summer sea and the profusion of marine life.  Be sure to take a trip to the islands.  To enhance your experience seek out a local guide.  From December to April a light wetsuit for snorkeling and swimming will make the experience more enjoyable.

294886322.name: Enjoying the Sunset While Walking along the Coast
294886322.author: a TripAdvisor user
294886322.reviewBody: We were staying at Hotel Oasis which is on the coast to the National Marine Park.  We enjoyed fitness walking along the coast with sunrise.  Then in the evening with a stroll back to our hotel. Very well kept up and clean.

291880300.name: Amazing location
291880300.author: a TripAdvisor user
291880300.reviewBody: Spectacular area with beautiful bays/beaches and widlife. Water is clear and warm, ideal for snorkeling

289693949.name: Photographers meca
289693949.author: a TripAdvisor user
289693949.reviewBody: Endless photography opportunities on both land and sea. We fish in the morning and shoot wildlife throughout our day

289691377.name: We live here, so our diving experience encompasses the past 23 years and I have photos  from all those years.
289691377.author: a TripAdvisor user
289691377.reviewBody: We live here, so we love the park, every creature under the sea and water so clear you can see everything without diving, just snorkeling...however, free diving is the best!

287473149.name: Beautiful Marine Park
287473149.author: a TripAdvisor user
287473149.reviewBody: The Marine park is beautiful. There are many, many boats available to charter. Scuba and snorkeling or just a boat ride.

285905277.name: Isla Coronado in December
285905277.author: a TripAdvisor user
285905277.reviewBody: Spent a week in Loreto December 2014, mainly to visit the marine park. Bad weather prevented us from venturing out for the first 3 days, but on the 4th day, we got a break from the high winds and rough seas. Splurged on a private panga from the marina to Isla Coronado for a day trip. \n\nDespite the previous bad weather, the waters around the island were very clear and calm. On the way out saw many boats collecting chocolate clams. Stopped first to snorkel with the sea lions on the rocky far side of the island. Water crystal clear, a bit chilly in December but a shorty wetsuit was perfect. It was great fun swimming with the sea lions and watching beginning scuba divers take their first open water lesson below us in such excellent visibility. Next was a lunch stop at the north side beach, gorgeous soft white sand and stunning turquoise water.  Then some more snorkeling near the rocky shore next to the sand beach (oodles of fish, lost count of the different species). On our way back to the marina in the later afternoon, we ran into a HUGE pod of bottlenose dolphin, who delighted in racing our boat & riding the bow wave just a few feet away - amazing memories of the sound of their underwater squeaks and breathing each time they broke the surface.  A GREAT day out!

283009129.name: Fisherman
283009129.author: a TripAdvisor user
283009129.reviewBody: They don\'t allow jet skiis and the fishing is usually pretty good.\nThe town is very clean and safe. The residents are cordial

282775559.name: The best fishing
282775559.author: a TripAdvisor user
282775559.reviewBody: it is well taken care of and the fishing is the best, a must visit spot if you like baja. stayed at villa del palmar, newest resort, good service and excellent facilities.

281832822.name: Beauty Preserved for Years
281832822.author: a TripAdvisor user
281832822.reviewBody: We have been coming to the Loreto Bay National Marine Park for yellowtail fishing for many years. Each year we paid a fee for a permit for the privilege. This fee has been worthwhile in my opinion. The quality of fishing has not degraded much. The water around the islands are as clean as the first time that we came here. Except for the areas close to the town of Loreto, the islands remains as scenic as before. I hope this area will preserve its beauty for many years to come

278507506.name: The contrast of nature in Loreto
278507506.author: a TripAdvisor user
278507506.reviewBody: What a spectacular unspoiled place. The park is a paradise for those seeking solace in nature. The contrast between sea and desert is outstanding although some areas can be improved it is safe and quiet.

278359189.name: Amazing sea life
278359189.author: a TripAdvisor user
278359189.reviewBody: Lived in the Caribbean for ten years and saw just as much if not more sea life here.  Great water clarity!

277672711.name: Loreto snorkeling
277672711.author: a TripAdvisor user
277672711.reviewBody: Dansante Island snorkel tour was very enjoyable. Watched Dolphins s playing in our wake & it was fabulous.

277411021.name: pristine!
277411021.author: a TripAdvisor user
277411021.reviewBody: The most beautiful water ever - clean and clear and calm. wow! Nice snorkeling opportunities. Paddleboarding, kayaking. Going back for whale watching!

274821124.name: Best yellowtail fishing
274821124.author: a TripAdvisor user
274821124.reviewBody: We have been coming here annually for yellowtail fishing in April or May. Probably the best fishing in Baja. There are dorados and bill fishing in summer too.

274095510.name: Don\'t miss this beautiful spot
274095510.author: a TripAdvisor user
274095510.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place and one that shouldn\'t be missed if your interested in Mexico. The location is a little remote but worth the extra effort getting there! The water is lovely, clean and clear, the marine life abundant and the roughed mountainous landscape absolutely gorgeous. We had great fun on a daylong snorkeling trip and it proved to be a wonderful way to see many of the islands.

273204141.name: Beautiful Water Area
273204141.author: a TripAdvisor user
273204141.reviewBody: The ocean area is teaming with Life. You can fish,snorkle,or just cruise around the area. Diving operations are available also.

271865305.name: Beautiful
271865305.author: a TripAdvisor user
271865305.reviewBody: Recommend VDP Loreto, Danzante Tours and Wild Loreto Tours, all out of Villa Del Palmar...had a great stay other than the time share presentation from hell, although Maki was a great breakfast companion, it was the salesman that irritated.....

271683871.name: Happy Birthday to me
271683871.author: a TripAdvisor user
271683871.reviewBody: What a beautiful Park. It was like our own private paradise and we hiked to the other side of the island as well. You need to pack your own food and beverages but well worth it.

271216467.name: Beautiful!
271216467.author: a TripAdvisor user
271216467.reviewBody: Great fishing . . . this trip we caught yellow tail, cabrilla, sea bass, pargo, dog snapper, marlin and dorado.  The contrast from the mountains to the Sea of Cortez is breathtaking!  Snorkeling is fun and fascinating!  Each island has its own character and wildlife to enjoy!

270731284.name: Wonderful place to kayak and explore
270731284.author: a TripAdvisor user
270731284.reviewBody: Spent six days camping and kayaking in the Marine park and coast. Windex clear water, wonderful beaches. Great snorkeling and glorious skies to watch at night.

270057936.name: Snorkeling and whale watching great!
270057936.author: a TripAdvisor user
270057936.reviewBody: Activities planned worked out well with Danzante whale watching and snorkeling trips well organized. \n\nDisconnect between marketing group managing this property and on site concierge services. Overpaid trips which required a refund and a lot of aggravation, which could have been saved.

269729110.name: Enjoyable
269729110.author: a TripAdvisor user
269729110.reviewBody: I have fished Loreto the last few summers and last year I took a tour to Coronado Island that included snorkeling. And this spring I was with my wife and had my fishing captain take us on a similar tour without snorkeling, the water being cooler.  Both enjoyable tours.  We got into a pod of about 60 dolphins for 20 minutes.  On the island we could see a large group of sea lions that love to bark at you.  A rookery of peligans was next, making the rocks white.  There is a protective cove with a large sand beach, palapas to get shade and a couple of outhouses.  The snorkeling was good, but not the diversity of Hawaii or Cabo.

269109016.name: Beautiful
269109016.author: a TripAdvisor user
269109016.reviewBody: Wonderful snorkel tour, and we loved all the dolphin.  The tour guide was very knowledgable and made the tour more interesting.

269097747.name: Sailors\'/Kayakers\'/Paddlers\'/Snorkelers\' Heaven
269097747.author: a TripAdvisor user
269097747.reviewBody: We sailed to the islands in the Marine Park and encountered the vibrant marine life and spectacular natural beauty of the Sea of Cortez. Watch the winds and weather, go with someone experienced if you are not.There are many ways to explore, and many ways to experience this beauty spot. It is like nowhere else on earth!

268116628.name: One Caveat
268116628.author: a TripAdvisor user
268116628.reviewBody:
Anything we'd say about the beauty of the Loreto Bay area would just guild others' lilies.  Exploring the area is a delight: beautiful, interesting.  Water, wildlife, without too many people.  

The purpose of this review is to alert others who, like us, may be unfamiliar with warm water fauna.  ignorance can be painful. 

In April and May, stingrays frequent the shallow waters off the beaches and camouflage themselves in the sand.  It works.  

You do not want to step on a stingray.  To avoid stingrays (we're told), you shuffle your feet to scare them away, then advance.  Make sure you do that.

267186948.name: Didn\'t want to leave this beautiful place!
267186948.author: a TripAdvisor user
267186948.reviewBody: The residents of the Baja take impeccable care of their park and the waters of the Sea of Cortez.  The respect they show for it is evident in the bounty of wildlife and the crystal clear waters.  I highly recommend a stop in this park to see the  various islands, birds, fish and sea mammals.   Amazing.  You\'ll be glad you went!!

266937038.name: You need to experience the ecosystem to believe
266937038.author: a TripAdvisor user
266937038.reviewBody: Either boat tours our through various Kayaking tours\' you must see this wonder of the planet. More wildlife then you can count and the most incredible snorkeling experience seeing so many fish that you can count. See to believe..

265909337.name: Amazing!
265909337.author: a TripAdvisor user
265909337.reviewBody:
Over the past 30 years I have stayed in a lot of all-inclusive hotels in many parts of the world.  I can say, without a doubt, that my stay in Villa del Palmar in Loreto has been by far the most enjoyable.
This hotel is small (180 rooms) so that if one asks for room service or a repair it is dealt with immediately.
Within half a day of my registering into the hotel, all the staff I had met remembered my name.  Where else can you find that?
I am a 71-year old woman travelling on my own and I feel completely safe here.
This hotel is a gem in a world where gems are hard to find.  There is something for everybody, young, old and in between.
The real gems though are the staff in the restaurants and pool areas.  
I especially thank Edgar, Gerardo and Ricardo in The Market Restaurant where I ate breakfast and supper most days.  They made me feel like royalty and more especially family.
At the pool I am grateful to Roberto and Emanuel.  They kept me fed and “watered” throughout the days I spent there. I didn’t even have to move from my lounger!
The evening entertainment was spectacular!  What talent from Alan, Eduardo and the rest of the entertainment troupe.
I haven’t had so much fun in a long time.  I only hope it is in the stars that I can come again.  Thank you all!

265457311.name: Villa del Palmar
265457311.author: a TripAdvisor user
265457311.reviewBody: We used Rammses for a tour of the sea lion Island. I had the experience of a lifetime as I slid off the boat and snorkeled with them\nA warning form a sea lion told me it was time to head back as the babies were around

265353499.name: Took a stroll along the beach
265353499.author: a TripAdvisor user
265353499.reviewBody: I want to come back and stay here to get a closer look at the marine life, maybe from a boat. Nice warm water. Enjoyed watching the many pelicans diving.

265229887.name: Loreto Bay
265229887.author: a TripAdvisor user
265229887.reviewBody: uncrowded, very pretty! Have to take a boat to get there however, but worth it!. Go during whale season.

264792172.name: Swim with sea lions
264792172.author: a TripAdvisor user
264792172.reviewBody: For  $100 per boat(up to 6 people), we were taken on a 5-hour tour to Coronado Island(about 45 minutes away) to see nesting blue boobie birds, snorkel with big colorful fish, eat a picnic lunch we brought on a dazzling white-sand beach with turquoise water, and swim with sea lions as they jumped in and dove right under us.

264116964.name: great trip
264116964.author: a TripAdvisor user
264116964.reviewBody: Have a local take you out to Coronado Island, sea lions, birds, mantas, tons of fish for snorkeling.  Take a picnic lunch and plenty of sunscreen.

264069547.name: Sea Kayak Adventures 3-kayak trip
264069547.author: a TripAdvisor user
264069547.reviewBody: Fairly strenuous 3-day, two-night kayak adventure, unforgettable! Our guides Antonio, Daniel, and Valente were knowledgeable, amble, hard-working, and great chefs! Highly recommend this trip.

262085963.name: Aquamarine waters on Isla Coronado
262085963.author: a TripAdvisor user
262085963.reviewBody: This was one of the most beautiful places we\'ve ever seen. The water was so clear and beautiful. The snorkeling was great and the trip there allowed us the opportunity to see hundreds of dolphins frolicking alongside our boat. Breathtaking and highly recommended!!

261572609.name: Stunning
261572609.author: a TripAdvisor user
261572609.reviewBody: A group of stunningly beautiful islands off the coast of Baja Sur.  Great for camping, snorkeling, whale watching, fishing, kayaking.

260801451.name: Lovin\' the Blues
260801451.author: a TripAdvisor user
260801451.reviewBody: Francisco Davis (his great grandpa was an English expat) is a knowledgeable pangero who speaks both English and Italian. He took us out to see (brace yourselves) sea lions, manta rays, adolescent dolphins, and blue whales - the largest creatures to have ever lived on earth. \n\nSpecial note: Blue whales are rather shy, so some visitors have taken to bringing drone copters with cameras to see the great beings up close (without harassing them, of course).

260132447.name: Scuba divers dream
260132447.author: a TripAdvisor user
260132447.reviewBody: Pods of dolphins rushing past you or being investigated by sea lions you cant go wrong with diving here.

259872591.name: Beautiful
259872591.author: a TripAdvisor user
259872591.reviewBody: Scenery is lovely with lots of birds and sea life. The water is a great way to see the islands and their variety of life.

259628966.name: Breeching  Hump Backing Performance
259628966.author: a TripAdvisor user
259628966.reviewBody: loved it all, couldn\'t ask for a better nature performance of a life time. Hope to return ASAP. However, a bit rough on the return ride home, hold on to yourself!

258492929.name: Whale watching
258492929.author: a TripAdvisor user
258492929.reviewBody: Saw 2-3 dozen blue whales in one days voyage.  Had a great lunch on a secluded beach.  We went with the nearby Eco \nTour company. Sarah was an awesome guide.

258293817.name: Whales of Loreto
258293817.author: a TripAdvisor user
258293817.reviewBody: While we stayed at the Viiia del Palmar in February 2015 we did the island tours with onsite tour company and were not disappointed.  The first question the captain asked us was if we wanted to go look for whales.  YES! was the resounding answer.  He found them!  The largest of the whales the Blues were in the area and they are amazing.  We have seen Humpbacks, Grays and Orcas but nothing to match the size or sound of these beautiful creatures.  So if you go during the winter months be sure to try to see them.  The rest of the tour was around the islands and coves of the area.  These definitely worth a trip.  They are so different than what we have seen in other parts for Baja and the sea life around them are plentiful.

258271730.name: Unbelievable landscape
258271730.author: a TripAdvisor user
258271730.reviewBody: The dessert and mountains meet the sea. Wanted to snorkel but the water was too cold (60 degree Farenheit). Later in the season the water is warmer and clearer. Abundance of sea lions, jumping manta rays, pelicans and blue whales spouting in the distance.

258066126.name: An area of outstanding natural beauty and tranquility...
258066126.author: a TripAdvisor user
258066126.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful areas on earth. The azure waters of the Sea of Cotez and the fabulously beautiful Islands of Coronado, Carmen and Danzante all visible from the Loreto shoreline. Take a panga ride to one of the islands. You will never forget it.

256648790.name: Wonderful!
256648790.author: a TripAdvisor user
256648790.reviewBody: this is a wonderful area for wildlife and birdwatching on land and from boats. A wonderful place to visit.

255648249.name: The day trip to the island was amazing.  We saw many Blue Whales and swam with Sea Lions
255648249.author: a TripAdvisor user
255648249.reviewBody: The boat rip was fun.  We used Dolphin Dive Shop and they took care of everyone\'s needs.  The trip was tailored to the desires of the group.

255621826.name: Beautiful spectacular
255621826.author: a TripAdvisor user
255621826.reviewBody: This park is the pride of Loreto for good reasons.  Mexico deserves recognition for having set it aside for protection.  It is beautiful and has abundant wildlife.

255265395.name: Worthwhile
255265395.author: a TripAdvisor user
255265395.reviewBody: Scenery just out of this world.  Saw a few blue whales from afar but the boat outing was definitely a great experience.

255139636.name: Coronado Island
255139636.author: a TripAdvisor user
255139636.reviewBody: Well worth a day trip to Coronado for a swim/hike/boat ride around the island. Easy to catch at the marina. Amazing water for swimming/snorkeling.

254127814.name: Great Marine Park
254127814.author: a TripAdvisor user
254127814.reviewBody: No commercial fishing here, only the locals from a nearby town who go fishing in Pangas. No parasailing or jet skis.

253865434.name: Blue Whale season
253865434.author: a TripAdvisor user
253865434.reviewBody: We went with Francisco on a Blue Whale tour. We saw a pod of at least 12 Blue Whales surfacing for over an hour.  Totally awesome trip, more than we had expected.  This whale watching excursion made our entire week!

253765308.name: A boat trip worth taking
253765308.author: a TripAdvisor user
253765308.reviewBody: If you want to see marine life, take a boat trip out of Loreto to see it all. The Dolphins were so numerous around the boat it felt like you could walk across them. Hump back whales, sea lions, several types of sea birds, rugged island formations and beautiful white sand beaches are all there.

252899596.name: Beautiful
252899596.author: a TripAdvisor user
252899596.reviewBody: Went with Sea and Land Tours out of Loreto. If you want to actually hike into the volcano, then ask them for that fare.

250341474.name: A wonderful experience for those wanting to view marine life!
250341474.author: a TripAdvisor user
250341474.reviewBody: Lots of marine life to view.  The whales were present for the winter and the protected waters create an oasis for many species.

249870495.name: Stunning
249870495.author: a TripAdvisor user
249870495.reviewBody: We went here to see the grey whales and their calves, and we were not disappointed. Couldn\'t recommend this highly enough if you like whales. We saw humpbacks, blue and fin. also dolphins . Loreto is lovely and we were made feel welcome.

248156907.name: Danzante Island
248156907.author: a TripAdvisor user
248156907.reviewBody: I have paddled sections of the coast around Loreto and my favourite paddle has been to Danzante Island from Puerto Escondido. It\'s about a 45 - 60 minute crossing and approximately two to three hours of leisurely paddling around it. I thoroughly enjoyed my paddle on the east side of the island. The west side has been places to beach but the east is more scenic. I recommend paddling to the island on a lighter day of wind as you can get trapped there (as some friends did).

247432906.name: Beautiful Rock Islands
247432906.author: a TripAdvisor user
247432906.reviewBody: Not tons of fish but enough to  be pretty cool! Morey eels, pufferfish, seastars, sea cucumbers and lots of colorful fish.

246555921.name: Wonderful day on the water
246555921.author: a TripAdvisor user
246555921.reviewBody: We booked a snorkeling excursion to Isla Coronado with Land and Sea tours, Sarah and Juve. We had a really great day of snorkeling, viewing the sea lion colony and then spending a couple of hours on the pristine beach of the island. We are so glad we arranged this excursion!

244062446.name: A Perfect Day in Loreto
244062446.author: a TripAdvisor user
244062446.reviewBody:
So you're taking your family to Loreto. Your idea of a perfect day is to hire a panga and go catch dorado, cabrilla and yellowtail...But your significant other and your kids want to go to a beautiful, white sandy beach and have a picnic and explore the flora and fauna of a fascinating, volcanic island....Es una problema,amigo! 

     Never fear!!! You can do BOTH!!! Go down to the marina and start talking to panga captains...
Pangas are the ever-present 23 ft. fiberglass boats that are common throughout mexico. They are fast, stable and safe. They rent for $150.00 to $300.00 depending on  how long you want them. Pack a picnic,your towels, sunscreen and snorkel gear. Tell him that you want to take your family to Isla Coronado and drop them off at the white sand beach park and then you wanna go fish for a few hours around the island and surrounding reefs w/live bait. Be sure and be clear on exactly what you want, who gets to keep the fish, whether there is a bimini shade top on the panga, etc.If you want them to provide lunch and drinks, be specific!

     Don't be afraid to shop around and talk to different captains. Your family will LOVE it, you will catch fish and everybody is happy!!!  Buen viaje!!!

242344946.name: Absolutely amazing!
242344946.author: a TripAdvisor user
242344946.reviewBody: I couldn\'t believe the water was more warm and more clear than Hawaii!!  The fish were unbelievable.  Great snorkeling, easy entry and exit.   Too many mosquitoes after the hurricanes, but other than that, it was fantastic!  Bring drinks and food so your trip will be even more satisfying.

240269761.name: Padi Diving
240269761.author: a TripAdvisor user
240269761.reviewBody: Had a wonderful experience learning how to scuba dive with Frank from Dazante Tours.  Beautiful conditions, beaches, and clean waters.

240135365.name: Isla Coronado
240135365.author: a TripAdvisor user
240135365.reviewBody: Take a tour - go snorkeling - spend a beautiful day!  Check if your tour includes plenty of water/drinks and or lunch.  Ours did and we noticed other folks were not so lucky.

240043715.name: 21 day paddling trip with Sea Kayak Baja Mexico
240043715.author: a TripAdvisor user
240043715.reviewBody: We circumnavigated Coronados, Carmen, Danzante and Monserrat. The geology is awesome!  The water is warm! One is paddling in the desert, with cardon cactus on the shore....and the desert, this Fall, is green after the hurricane rains. There were whales, dolphins, sea lions, leaping rays and colourful fish observed while snorkelling.

239585518.name: Stunning trip! A must see while in Loreto.
239585518.author: a TripAdvisor user
239585518.reviewBody: We\'ve taken two snorkle trips to this area. October 2013 we had the BEST snorkle trip ever. The water was crystal clear and there were tons of of big beautiful fish all around us. Our second trip in October of 2014 didn\'t have as great of a snorkle due to some recent storms but our captain still made sure we had a great day. We caught two Dorados and saw a big pod of bottle nose dolphins that came right up to our boat to say hello. Most definately the high light of our trip both times!

239510603.name: DANZANTE:  HIRE AT YOUR OWN RISK
239510603.author: a TripAdvisor user
239510603.reviewBody: I see that Danzante has gotten some rave reviews here but my experience was very different.  I had reserved a half day fishing trip that, due to illness, had to be postponed.  I did sign up for the sales pitch at the development they represent which gave me a $50 discount.  Property is beautiful, sales pitch fine including the free breakfast.  A day later when I talked to the Danzante folks about switching my deposit to a snorkeling trip, they said "No Problem".  Arrived at the Marina at 8:00 AM sharp two days later and found our guide who spoke minimal English.  Snorkeling equipment consisted of three mask and snorkel sets that looked as if they had seen better days and one pair of fins for the two of us. Again, not in tip top shape to say the least.  But we agreed thinking we could share and there didn\'t seem to be anything we could do about then anyway.  Heading out toward Coronado Island, our guide proceeded to do some electrical repairs to his boat and tended to his two fishing poles as we trolled slowly across the Sea of Cortez. In addition, the advertised lunch and promised cooer with ice were nowhere to be seen.    An hour later we had not reached the island when  a phone call came.  I was handed the phone and spoke to the caller from Danzante who asked if I minded if we returned to the marina to pick up two more snorkelers who\'s boat, so the story went, was not working - about a 25 minute trip back to marina and then, presumably, another hour or so to whatever snorkeling site(s) we were supposed to be going to.  At which point I said yes but decided right then that I\'d had quite enough of this trip.  When we returned to the marina we left much to the consternation of our guide and one of the operators on shore.  Maybe it was just a bad day for them.  But this kind of treatment and "customer service" is simply unacceptable by any business.

239414305.name: Forget Hawaii
239414305.author: a TripAdvisor user
239414305.reviewBody: Rugged,yet serene. Crystal clear snorkeling with amazing fish. pristine white beaches. Uncrowded and warm water. What more could you want.

239408086.name: Fishing trip
239408086.author: a TripAdvisor user
239408086.reviewBody: took a charter out of Loreto, fishing was not great but in Oct not sure it is great overall.  Water was awesome and boat was great.

239352842.name: Coronado Island--the perfect beach, reef and snorkeling
239352842.author: a TripAdvisor user
239352842.reviewBody: The number one reason I booked a cruise out of San Francisco and into the Sea of Cortez was to snorkel at this marine park and the waters around La Paz. The experience was perfect. Our guide took us on a little detour to the nesting area of the blue-footed booby and to get up close and personal with a colony of sea lions and then we had the additional joy of a pod of dolphins playing in our wake for a good portion of our panga boat trip to Coronado Island. Once there we stored our stuff under a grass-thatched shelter, donned our snorkel gear on the beach and swam out to a nearby reef in 80 degree water in late October.  The reef was filled with colorful fish, eels, trumpetfish, needlenose fish, etc. The horseshoe-shaped beach was absolutely perfect. After snorkeling our guide took us on a nature hike throughout the island, pointing out a variety of plants and allowing us a panorama view of the harbor and other islands. This is an unspoiled corner of the world. Let\'s keep it that way!

238365298.name: Rammses with Danzante Tours
238365298.author: a TripAdvisor user
238365298.reviewBody: So much fun! They took great care of us! This is the group to go with if you go snorkeling!~ They went out of their way to make sure everyone had a great experience.

236741282.name: Amazing
236741282.author: a TripAdvisor user
236741282.reviewBody: Clear water, thousands of fish, and dolphins made our snorkeling trip a memorable experience.  In addition we kayaked and paddle boarded the beautiful waters.   Enjoy- this area is great for relaxation.

236638842.name: Best place ever for snorkeling
236638842.author: a TripAdvisor user
236638842.reviewBody: We visited Carmen & Coronado Islands with a guide.  He took us to crystal clear waters with more fish than I have ever seen.  We were lucky enough to run across a pod of dolphins as well.

236266131.name: Gorgeous crystal clear water!
236266131.author: a TripAdvisor user
236266131.reviewBody: Went in Fall - hundreds of dolphins, lots of fish, rays, birds. Gorgeous mountains & islands. Uncrowded and unspoiled.

235432484.name: Dolphins, Sea Lions and an Island to Ourselves
235432484.author: a TripAdvisor user
235432484.reviewBody: As always, we enjoyed taking a boat trip to Isla Coronado.  The water was nice and warm for snorkeling and we got to see lots of wildlife.

233542339.name: amazingly great
233542339.author: a TripAdvisor user
233542339.reviewBody: Make sure you buy the daily pass, it helps the park and is required you can get big fine if you dont. you can buy at the marina harbor. fishing is the best here, dorado, yellowtail, rosterfish, pargo, harmerheads. snorkleing is great as well. ask for ramon a pangero that is great and resonable.

226512133.name: The sea of Cortez in Summer!
226512133.author: a TripAdvisor user
226512133.reviewBody: The water temps are warm and the water clarity can be amazing  especially on non windy days!   Snorkel or Dive in the morning for best visibility normally.  Take a Panga around Coronado Island and Dive in the back of Carmen Island. Stay at El Tiburon Casitas, just steps from the Marina!!

223970598.name: A marine treasure
223970598.author: a TripAdvisor user
223970598.reviewBody: Loreto Bay National park is amazing. Jacque Cousteau called this Earths  Aquarium, I can see why. From seeing whales to sea lions to varieties of fish in the crystal clear water was a joy. Coronado island from its rugged side to its calm white beaches on the other side, rival any Caribbean beach. Please do not over commercialise this little piece of heaven. \nA water sports haven.

220922420.name: Whale watching
220922420.author: a TripAdvisor user
220922420.reviewBody: Trip of a lifetime. Top of my to do list was always to see a Blue Whale. 1st day out saw 3 on the Sea of Cortez, and it just kept getting better and better Loreto was lovely to stay in, people very friendly and helpful. We also travelled to Guerrero Negro to see the Greys and their babies. Baja has to be the best place in the world to see so many whales...loved it!!

216833301.name: Mooray Eel Galore!
216833301.author: a TripAdvisor user
216833301.reviewBody: The diving here did not disappoint at all.  The water is very very comfortable (80 degrees in July).  Lots and marine life.  I didn\'t expect to see so much fish!  The one thing that really stood out is the amount of mooray eels we saw.  We saw multiple eels on each dive!  Beautiful diving!

215729682.name: Amazingly beautiful
215729682.author: a TripAdvisor user
215729682.reviewBody: We snorkeled with Wild Loreto excursions from our resort.  Saw Danzante and Carmen.  We got into a big game of chase with about 200 dolphins including little babies.  Beach at the island was pristine white sand tons of shells and sea creatures.  Saw an octopus, puffer fish, thousands of other fish.  Frank, our tour guide spoke perfect English and Spanish, knew so much about the islands and the history of the area, decent lunch and icy drinks, even beers after we snorkeled.  It was a perfect day!

214734272.name: Every visit you discover something wonderfully new!
214734272.author: a TripAdvisor user
214734272.reviewBody: From the air, it looks like plain old desert. Once on the ground, and you have slowed yourself, it is a very diverse and beautiful area. The mountains will tell you how Baja came to be; the water teems with life, water so clear that you can see, with the help of the contrasting white sand bottom, a turtle swimming 60 feet down or large rays "flying" through the water. This trip\'s "new" discoveries were a young whale shark basking in a quiet bay and a school of pilot whales that joined us for an hour or so as we headed back for Loreto. Even the Sport and commercial fishermen are good stewards and active in preserving this area. Definitely requires more than one trip.

214732821.name: Came here on a cruise
214732821.author: a TripAdvisor user
214732821.reviewBody: Loved Loreto, and the Loreto Bay at sunrise is spectacular! Saw so many bottle nose dolphins, and what we thought were whales spouting off the bow from our balcony! Just breathtaking !!\nThe rocks along the coast were filled with sea lions too.

211943760.name: Sensational
211943760.author: a TripAdvisor user
211943760.reviewBody: Stupendously beautiful rock formations and bountiful wildlife. The sea lions are inches away and on one trip I saw hundreds of dolphins.

211939451.name: Life in the sea
211939451.author: a TripAdvisor user
211939451.reviewBody: Saw whale, dolphins, sea lions, stingray, and lots of tropical fish all in one day! Fisherman, snorkelers and divers playground. \n\nI stayed at El Tiburon  Casitas...close to everything.

211239521.name: Surprisingly good snorkeling
211239521.author: a TripAdvisor user
211239521.reviewBody: I\'ve snorkeled in the sea of Cortez before, so I didn\'t have high expectations when we went snorkeling off a beach on Isla Coronado. It started out with just a few pretty damselfish, then quickly progressed to a really nice selection of reef fish, including yellow, blue and white tang. There were even a couple of triggerfish and small bass among the deeper rocks. The water was so clear and calm it really made snorkeling a joy. \nThe waterfowl and sea lions are delightful as well. And you can\'t seem to take a panga to any of the islands without running into a pod (or 2or 3) of dolphins. We saw a shark and a couple of manta rays for good measure. No whales, but since we went in June that\'s not surprising.

210843905.name: Snorkling
210843905.author: a TripAdvisor user
210843905.reviewBody: the islands and beaches are awesome.Also a good place to see dolphins and whalesIf you go on any wtare tours you will be in the park

210075969.name: Beautiful
210075969.author: a TripAdvisor user
210075969.reviewBody: Take a catamaran cruise through the marine park and around the islands.  Breathtaking and relaxing.  Saw a lone dolphin and had great company.

208498086.name: Nature at her best
208498086.author: a TripAdvisor user
208498086.reviewBody: Don\'t argue with Jacque Cousteau, this is Nature\'s aquarium..  Couched in volcanic engineering and landscaping this pristine sea park will bring out an \'OMG" from any visitor.  It can be explored by land, boat or in the water as sea life is abundant and growing each year in this wildlife protected, multi-island habitat.  We took the Sunset Cruise arranged by Villa del Palmar and next time we\'ll take every Park adventure they have to offer.  Keith & Sandy Froehlich

208105608.name: Unbelievable Wildlife
208105608.author: a TripAdvisor user
208105608.reviewBody: We spent a week at this pristine National Park and saw rays of all kinds, sea lions, dolphins, tropical fish so numerous I wouldn\'t know where to start, and so many interesting birds. The snorkeling here is better than Hawaii, the weather is warm, and the park is very very clean.  Already planning our next trip back!

207525596.name: A special place for the water lover
207525596.author: a TripAdvisor user
207525596.reviewBody:
The park is large and we have only explored the northern part.  When family or friends visit we usually treat them to a boat ride to Isla Coronado and/or Isla Carmen.  Activities typically include diving (scuba or snorkel), beach play, whale watching, playing with the dolphins (they love slow-moving boats) and occasional fishing.  Isla Carmen has several caves that can be entered with small boats - this always a big hit.  

During the Summer we like to find a big carpet of sargasso (sea weed), park the boat on it and explore beneath.  It's not unusual to see turtles, schools of small colorful fish and the occasional dorado.  

You can rent a local panga right at the Loreto Marina in the morning.  It's generally inexpensive depending on where you go and how long you stay.

205130306.name: Danzante snorkeling with Said
205130306.author: a TripAdvisor user
205130306.reviewBody: Said was a fantastic snorkeling guide. We had so much fun with him. He was incredibly knowledgable and accommodating. Witty sense of humor. He loves his job which made us love our experience. We would recommend his tour absolutely.

202962001.name: Overrated
202962001.author: a TripAdvisor user
202962001.reviewBody: We got very excited about an average place to pay big money to visit plus a fee for the park pass which they don\'t tell you till you pay the $150 US funds.. SHARE a boat as not worth the price if your going alone. Basically a pretty wading area once you get there with no door on a double outhouse. Snorkeling is a waste of time as barely a minnow in sight. Take your own lunch or pay big for what they sell. Best part was once you got to the rocks you get pretty close to sea lions and walruses.We ended up asking our captain to go back early.

202865091.name: Second largest marine preserve in world
202865091.author: a TripAdvisor user
202865091.reviewBody: The Loreto islands are colorful and huge, scattered in the Sea of Cortez . It is the home of beautiful fish, whales and dolphin, unusual birds and white beaches and emerald bays. Our guides were knowledgeable and fun loving.

201806081.name: Magnificent Loreto Bay
201806081.author: a TripAdvisor user
201806081.reviewBody: There is no other place on earth like Loreto Bay.  To explore the islands in a panga is the way to go.  The panga captains know exactly where the whales, sea lions, and dolphins are hanging out and if you hit it at the right time you will be amazed to be right there amongst them all.  There are parts of the bay that serve as dolphin playgrounds.  Hundreds and hundreds of common dolphins surround you leaping high into the air and cavorting around completely not caring that you\'re there.  If you\'re lucky enough to be there in early Spring, you can even see Blue Whales, and Humpbacks....another amazing experience.  \nWe visited an area where the sea lions hang out...as well as stopped at a couple of pristine white sand beaches with turquoise water, to do some snorkeling.  Truly one of the most special reasons to visit Loreto is to get out on the water.  One of the most beautiful settings in the world.

200532786.name: A beautiful area of desert islands and marine mammals.
200532786.author: a TripAdvisor user
200532786.reviewBody: Take a boat ride to see this area, perhaps whales and dolphins. \nFrom the water you can see the dramatic landscape of mountains behind Loreto, a waterfront town on the verge of taking off.

200507722.name: Spectacular Humpback whale experience
200507722.author: a TripAdvisor user
200507722.reviewBody: Took our family for a tour around Isla Coronado to see the sea lions, pelicans. We were also lucky to see pods of at least a thousand dolphins and on our return to Loreto we were surprised by a humpback whale breaching in front of the boat...AMAZING!!!

200239266.name: What a trip..
200239266.author: a TripAdvisor user
200239266.reviewBody: Not just another old church... Quite inspiring with the mountains surrounding and desert and trees to give contrast.  Trip to mission is an experience all it\'s own. At this time there is a lot of construction, so roads are pretty torn up, but marked well enough to know where to go.  There are a few places where you get to ford very shallow water that crosses concreted road. Finally getting to town is comforting, small restaurant to have a beer and some tasty snack.  Everyone helpful in telling you what to see and where, well worth exciting trip.... Which will probably soon disappear, as they can really throw a road together here quickly.

198934165.name: blue gem
198934165.author: a TripAdvisor user
198934165.reviewBody: the sea itself is just gorgeous to feast your eyes upon. We took a snorkeling trip to Coronado Island with Wild Loreto (see review under WL)....tons of tropical fish, some whales (we were mid-March, so late in season), dolphins, sea lions. A UNESCO protected Sea.

197896714.name: Enjoyable day on the water
197896714.author: a TripAdvisor user
197896714.reviewBody: What\'s not to like?  Sea lions, whales, dolphins, loads of birds, being on the water and a relaxing lunch on a secluded beach.  We made our plans with Sea & Land Ecotours www.toursloreto.com - they took us on a wonderful day trip and will customize the trip to you liking.

197496706.name: Isla Carmen
197496706.author: a TripAdvisor user
197496706.reviewBody: Fantastic avian and marine life; formidable landscape. Highly recommend a visit. Easy to rent a panga with a guide or kayak the area.

196689613.name: Incredible
196689613.author: a TripAdvisor user
196689613.reviewBody:
Incredible weather, community, water activity unbelievable with birds, dolphins, whales, rays and jumping fish..
Where the mountains meet the Sea….
Loved it so much we live here full time
enough said!

196654519.name: great opportunity to see marine wildlife
196654519.author: a TripAdvisor user
196654519.reviewBody: Loved the opportunity to watch birds, fish, whales and other marine mammals at fairly close distance in their natural (gorgeous) setting.

195593282.name: Great Day Trip Whale Watching
195593282.author: a TripAdvisor user
195593282.reviewBody: Beautiful and successful day trip watching the great blue whales.  Saw dolphins, seals and birds as well.  Visited Coronado Island. Had an excellent guide/captain.  Water was very choppy on the way back.

195273869.name: Exquisite
195273869.author: a TripAdvisor user
195273869.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Loreto and not go to the marine park. It\'s where you\'ll find the whales. And all sea life. I read Cousteau called the area the aquarium of the world.

194862055.name: Tons of Marine life here
194862055.author: a TripAdvisor user
194862055.reviewBody:
we stayed in Loreto to enjoy the Marine Park here and I want to go back, it was amazingly stunning… gorgeous blue waters, blue whales, saw two kinds of dolphins, many many birds, fishes, etc.   

From the Marine in Loret, rent a Panga out to Carmen and enjoy the white beaches, it's like a postcard.   The panga was 100.00 us dollars, and the 2nd time we took a snorkeling tour via Land and Sea Ecotours, which was 60.00 per person… the ecotour was better as our guide took his time in the water to let us really enjoy the wildlife we encountered, had lunch for us, etc.   I highly recommend as the cost is not that much higher and you don't have to worry about eating/water, and snorkel gear.  

  Water is cold in February, so we rented wetsuits and did our snorkeling around Carmen and it was amazing.    

Kayaking in the morning while the water was smooth was truly breathtaking.  We rented kayaks right from our beach in Loreto Bay (Nopolo).   A blue whale was nearby and hearing the breathing sounds, seeing the spouts, etc. wow.   We loved this place, because it was not crowded.  While on our kayaks in the morning, we were the only people/boats we could see in the Sea of Cortez for the two hours we were there in our area.    I would definitely recommend a visit and we will be back.

194673157.name: Wonderful wildlife!
194673157.author: a TripAdvisor user
194673157.reviewBody: We had the best boat ride ever.  Met the boat owner, Horacio, down on the Malecon where the whale statue is.  Horacio owns 3 boats, named Aliysia,   He took the 4 of us out for 5 hrs. For $100  US dollars.  He is very experienced and speaks come English.  Also he is very respectful of all the wildlife.  We saw so many Blue-footed Boobies, Blue Whales,  Humpback Whales, Dolphins, Sea lions! Sting Rays, Puffer Fish, Frigate birds,  and  Turtles and more.

194469419.name: Boat Trip to Isla Coronado
194469419.author: a TripAdvisor user
194469419.reviewBody: Hired a panga at the Marina to take us to Coronado Island.  We saw Great Blue Herons nesting, a ton of pelicans, blue-footed boobies, cormorants.  Then we saw a sea lion colony and we hopped out of the boat to snorkel with those curious animals.  Then around the island to see more sea birds and finally to a gorgeous white sandy beach for another snorkel and brief hike.  On the way back to the marina we came across a pod of bottlenosed dolphins who entertained us with their frolicking around our boat - bow riding, leaping over our wake - we could even hear them whistling to each other.  Fantastic day trip!

193717551.name: Coronado Island Fantastic
193717551.author: a TripAdvisor user
193717551.reviewBody: This volcanic island just offshore from Loreto, is a wildlife haven and geographically very interesting.  Our tour was through Wild Loreto Tours and they were excellent. The majority of the island is made of steep basalt formations in various shapes, with the west side of the island sloping gently to a white shell beach and lagoon, reminiscent of the caribean!  Beautiful blue green water on that side, and enough shallow rocks to make it a snorkelers dream!  We saw many sea lions, a smaller version than those in my native British Columbia, but we were able to get very close!  In fact, some swim with the sea lions, something that we passed on!  Great shots of an Osprey family and one area teemed with blue footed Boobies.  Commerants, gulls, pelicans abound.  Colourful fish near the rocks where we snorkeled!  Altogether, we highly recommend this trip - and suggest Wild Loreto Tours to take you.  The guide was very informative about the history of the area, the islands and very proud and protective of the Marine Park.  The boat was modern and comfortable; we saw others in tiny fishing boats and heard stories of people getting sea sick the same day that we went, and the water was calm.  More comfortable and less likely with this bigger boat that can take 6 people comfortably!  The trip to the Island took approx 20 minutes, including stopping to check out wildlife.  We did see dolphins off in the distance, and a large stingray, wetting our appitites for a return visit.  We would go back, the best recommendation we can give.

193717089.name: Coronado Island Boat Trip
193717089.author: a TripAdvisor user
193717089.reviewBody: We had dolphins swimming along the boat, humpback whales breaching and playing nearby, visited a colony of sea lions, saw a variety of birds and blue whales.

192811865.name: Best expereince on our Baja trip
192811865.author: a TripAdvisor user
192811865.reviewBody: We had many great experiences on our Baja trip, but the trip from Loreto to Coronado Island was about the best. We hired Francisco Mayoral Davis for our private boat tour, and he turned out to be a terrific guide. First, he spotted a blue whale off Coronado and approached respectfully so we got pretty close. Then he put us amidst a school of over 1,000 white bellied dolphins surrounding the boat, surfing the bow wave and playing with us. Then snorkeled with sea lions, photographed blue footed boobies, then spent a couple of hours on a pristine island beach, also with good snorkeling and beautiful mountain trails with amazing vegetation. His English is fluent and amusing. Price for our 5 hour trip was $80 for 2 (and would have been the same if we had 2 others along.) Francisco can be reached at 6131137037. A great experience.

192779550.name: Beautiful place
192779550.author: a TripAdvisor user
192779550.reviewBody: Quiet, clean, great camping spots.  Water is cold in March so come prepared if you want to snorkel.  Beautiful sun sets and sun rises.  Some nice places to hike or just hang out.

192601621.name: Superb marine park
192601621.author: a TripAdvisor user
192601621.reviewBody: Just enjoyed a wonderful day bird and dolphin watching on a tour organized by Wild Loreto tours and guided by Rammses. The marine park has a wide range of habitats in close proximity - that makes for fantastic wildlife viewing! Thanks to the people of Loreto for keeping the park so clean - not one piece of marine debris seen on a 40 mile boat ride - such a contrast to most places we visit!

190669627.name: Loreto Bay National Marine Park
190669627.author: a TripAdvisor user
190669627.reviewBody: The Marine Park is beautiful and uncrowded in December but the wind comes up alot. Nothing can be taken from the park so the beaches are littered with beautiful shells.

190053409.name: Wonderful area!
190053409.author: a TripAdvisor user
190053409.reviewBody: We took a catamaran to Danzante Island within the Park and had some of the best snorkeling we ever had.  The water is crystal clear and the weather in November is wonderful.

189290722.name: Great guide - beautiful beaches
189290722.author: a TripAdvisor user
189290722.reviewBody: Recently had an excellent guide who took us the San Javier MIssion and on the following day to two of the islands in the Marine Park. Ephrain was very accommodating, knowledgeable and helpful. We had a superb time - great snorkeling, wildlife (including three pods of dolphins) Highly recommended. Ephrain Martinez can be contacted at martinezefrain19@yahoo.com

189016549.name: Inspiring
189016549.author: a TripAdvisor user
189016549.reviewBody: However you get out there, take a trip out to the islands to snorkel, swim, hike, or commune with the world. The park is in excellent condition and the sense of pristine beauty is ever-present.

187446746.name: a beautiful place
187446746.author: a TripAdvisor user
187446746.reviewBody: We rented a boat with a skipper to run out to one of the islands,Coronado, that make up the National Marine Park and absolutely loved it.  The sea was calm and clear.  We saw a wide variety of birds, including an albatross, sea lions and a number of lovely fish.  We sat on the sandy beach and walked the rocky shore.  The half-day trip was worth the $120 it cost for the 5 of us.  If you want peace, quiet and the sense of Baja\'s oceanlife... take the trip.  Be sure to take your own food and water.  There is only one outhouse... at the third beach.

187287501.name: Breathtaking!
187287501.author: a TripAdvisor user
187287501.reviewBody: Beautiful landscapes, breathtaking views, gorgeous turquoise water, awesome place for kayaking! We loved our experiences and will be back for more in 2014!

186483524.name: Great snorkeling!
186483524.author: a TripAdvisor user
186483524.reviewBody: I was there in October before, during and after a tropical storm.  The water was amazing before the storm.  Clear and clean.  Lots of varsities of fish and birds to see.  Also saw sea lions but missed seeing any dolphins or whales.   Even when the water was in flux with debris from the storm it only took a couple of days to reach good clarity to go snorkeling again.  This park is amazing.  The locals respect it and keep it clean.   I can\'t stress how beautiful it is there.

186476787.name: Isla Cornado
186476787.author: a TripAdvisor user
186476787.reviewBody: We took a boat trip over to Isla Coronado and we especially enjoyed the sea lion colony, and the blue footed boobies that were flying and diving around us.  We also had dolphins swimming beside the boat and leaping into the air!! The beach on Isla Coronado was beautiful - white sand with beautiful turquoise water.

184992510.name: Great day on a boat snorkeling and beaching
184992510.author: a TripAdvisor user
184992510.reviewBody: We booked a snorkeling day through the concierge at La Mission where we were staying.  A real easy walk over to the Marina, and jump on the boat.\nSnorkeled in 3 spots, and saw lots of fish big and small. The last spot was where the sea lions congregate and I got to get within about 10ft of them.  Really cool!\nOur beach picnic was very nice, although a little too long for our taste; but we have a hard time sitting still and laying in the sun.  A beautiful spot on Isla Coronado though!

184732491.name: Great time with sea lions, snorkeling and Coronado Island was amazing!l
184732491.author: a TripAdvisor user
184732491.reviewBody: Recommend Francisco from El Pajaro fishing to take you there from the marina.  Great captain, very friendly, and speaks English.\n\nGreat time.  Best excursion of our trp.

182593223.name: Untouched Beauty!
182593223.author: a TripAdvisor user
182593223.reviewBody: AMAZING!!!!  We had no expectations going into things.  We took a boat ride around Coronado Island, dove, and paddle boarded.  The water was often glass with excellent visibility.  We were able to see dolphins, sea lions, octopus, reef fish, turtles, a humpback whale, and a manta ray.  It was beautiful!  The amount of sea life was spectacular!  We can\'t wait to go back and explore!

182585755.name: Kudos to the Mexican government
182585755.author: a TripAdvisor user
182585755.reviewBody:
It is great to see how healthy the underwater world can be when a government takes steps to protect the environment.

Having been a Scuba Diver for some 30 years, starting in the Sea of Cortez back in the early 80's, I have witnessed first hand the devastating decline in marine animal populations and diversity so during a series of dives at many different sites throughout the Loreto Bay National Marine Park I was pleasantly surprised to find such a healthy, vibrant underwater eco system.

From Puerto Penasco in the far north of the Sea of Cortez to Cabo San Lucas at the far south tip of Baja, including Cabo Pulmo, La Paz, and even the Gordo Banks, Loreto Bay National Marine Park stands above them all inn terms of overall health of the underwater world, the vast variety of animals, and the sheer volume of animals. From pods of bottlenose and common dolphins that numbered in the hundreds, to fish schools that were tens-of-thousands strong, lobsters, eels, cushion stars, even schools of Baracuda that had hundreds of members, this place is simply fantastic. The only other part of the underwater world that I have seen with comparable conditions is the south pacific, where the government of Palau put significant protections in place many years ago to keep their water from being over fished. Loreto Bay National Marine Park is not just an underwater adventure - there are many islands to explore top-side as well. My personal recommendation for either Scuba, snorkeling, or island explorations is Sea & Land Eco Tours.

181307615.name: Gorgeous!
181307615.author: a TripAdvisor user
181307615.reviewBody: The water was unbelievable. It looked like we were on the set of a movie. We snorkeled with sea lions, raced with Dolphins in the boat and kayaked around Coronado Island. Not enough people come to this vacation spot. It\'s worth a visit!

180540122.name: The Baja blue lagoon
180540122.author: a TripAdvisor user
180540122.reviewBody: The marine park was beautifully clear water in September and really warm. Sea life was abundant and included spiny lobster, tropical fish and sea eels. Access was easy and the costs were very reasonable. Great fun for day tours and worth a visit.

180355562.name: Loved seeing the sea life while out boating
180355562.author: a TripAdvisor user
180355562.reviewBody: sea turtles, dolphins, a whale, seals, lovely small fish when snorkling and no noisy jet skies to ruin the idyllic settings. Want to explore the islands more.

178177322.name: Scuba Diving in Marin Park
178177322.author: a TripAdvisor user
178177322.reviewBody: We were able to get 4 dives in on our visit -- 2 at Coronado and 2 at Carmen.  Lots of angel fish and eels.  Absolutely beautiful

177174159.name: Marine Life that you want see anywhere
177174159.author: a TripAdvisor user
177174159.reviewBody: Marine Life ,Swimmimg ,Diving ,fishing the people and the amazing scenery we travelled by boat and we would reccommend these way try and lease or hire a sailing boat from Puerto Escondido

175497392.name: Magic
175497392.author: a TripAdvisor user
175497392.reviewBody: There are 5 islands in the Parque. You can get a Panga ride to Coronado, Danzante, Carmen. With a park permit try camping. No frills, just nature.\nExcellent day trips for kayaking.

173426648.name: Oasis in the desert
173426648.author: a TripAdvisor user
173426648.reviewBody: Stumbled across the cutest little grocery / convenience store, right off highway 1 south of Loreto.  Good for gathering cold drinks and snacks before traveling 2 1/2 hours to the next stop south in Constitucion.   Right at the entrance of Nopolo as you leave Loreto.  Used the bathrooms (clean) and noticed they offer Wifi.

173045767.name: Amazing
173045767.author: a TripAdvisor user
173045767.reviewBody: Loved it, loved it, loved it!  The snorkeling is amazing, everything you could want in a snorkeling site- many fish to look at, calm, crystal clear water, warm water, no crowds. The beach at Coronado Island is gorgeous, the colors are amazing. Francisco "Pajarito" took us in his panga, he was very friendly,  professional and made it a great experience.

172553240.name: The reason why you need to visit Loreto. Amazing!
172553240.author: a TripAdvisor user
172553240.reviewBody: The main reason why I stopped and stayed in Loreto is to take a boat trip to Coronado island. To get a boat ride you need to go at the end of the malecon, where all the fishing boats are waiting to take you to the nearby islands, the main one is Coronado. The average price is 1000 pesos for a boat, and they don\'t include anything, so bring your own water at least. The trip is about 3 to 4 hours, and they will show you around the island and take to a white sandy beach for resting and snorkeling. The island is very nice, but the best part is that you are likely to see dolphins, jumping mantas, sea lions, and maybe small whales. Amazing!

166631996.name: Amazing natural beaty
166631996.author: a TripAdvisor user
166631996.reviewBody: We took an island snorkeling tour.  We saw hundred of dolphins, a couple whales, sea turtles and a flying fish on the boat ride to the island.  Whiles snorkeling we saw tons of sea life.  It was an amazing experience.

161845110.name: Coronado Island
161845110.author: a TripAdvisor user
161845110.reviewBody: On our way to Coronado Island we saw a fin-back whale and thousands of bottle nose dolphins. Snorkeling on Coronado, we saw a Spotted Puffer fish, beautiful anemonies, colorful starfish, and many types of tropical fish. On our way back from Coronado we caught several fish, and saw flying Manta Rays! It was simply amazing!

161407164.name: Dolphins, Whales and flying Manta Rays
161407164.author: a TripAdvisor user
161407164.reviewBody: We had the most amazing boat ride on our way to Coronado island. We saw thousands of dolphins, a blue whale, and Manta Rays jumping out of the water and doing flips in the air. Simply amazing!

159090849.name: Danzante Travel
159090849.author: a TripAdvisor user
159090849.reviewBody: A fishing dream come true! Thank you Captain Francisco, Uri and the fabulous Juan Carlos.  If it wasn\'t for you guys at Danzante Travel in Loreto Mexico our vacation adventure could not have been so wonderful!  Pictures are proof of the success!

156449383.name: Beautiful & Worthwile
156449383.author: a TripAdvisor user
156449383.reviewBody: If you enjoy watching wildlife (Blues, Humpbacks, Sea Lions), kayaking, or sailing, you should spend a couple days or more here. The bay is seriously beautiful and I dare say, pristine. The development is starting. I hope it stays protected. Right now it\'s incredible. The town of Loreto is quaint, fun, and friendly too.

156381070.name: A sea kayaker\'s delight
156381070.author: a TripAdvisor user
156381070.reviewBody: Spent 4 days kayaking around Isla Danzante and Isla Carmen. Wonderful beaches, snorkeling, wildlife, hiking. For novice kayakers like us, it was the perfect exposure to the sport.

156207689.name: Kayaking trip fantastic
156207689.author: a TripAdvisor user
156207689.reviewBody: Went with Sea Kayak Adventures and had an absolutely fantastic five day trip to the islands.  This is one of the best sea kayaking destinations in the world. My trip was superb due to the guides and top-quality gear.

154661279.name: Danzante Bay
154661279.author: a TripAdvisor user
154661279.reviewBody: The idea that it is preserved for the marine life that live there.  No motorized activities allowed.  Being a preserved area, there is not much in the way of activities except some trails to walk, volleyball on the beach, etc.  For now there is a little shack down the beach that will cook chocolate clams and whatever other fish they happen to catch. I did not eat there but everyone who did raved about it. the clams come from that very beach.

154124466.name: Loreto Bay, Whale watching
154124466.author: a TripAdvisor user
154124466.reviewBody: We went wahle watching in the Loreto Bay with Desert Sea company. Our captain, Nicky was very a respectful boat man. We saw Blue Whales, Black Fin Whales, Humpbacks, and Gray Whales. We also came across a school of Dolphins which stuck around the boat for what seemed to be 10-15 minutes. Tour leaves the dock early at 7 a.m. and you return to dock between 2-3 p.m.

152679588.name: Wonderful experience
152679588.author: a TripAdvisor user
152679588.reviewBody: No hassle, friendly and helpful locals. And the whales....Wow !!! We saw Humpback, Fin, and a Blue whale along with a very noisy (and smelly !!) sea lion colony, dolphins and birds galore.

152060530.name: Awesome
152060530.author: a TripAdvisor user
152060530.reviewBody: What an awesome place!  I spent 6 days canoeing around these island and sleeping under the stars.  Ospreys, dolphins and blue, fin and humpback whales abounded.  Highlight was sleeping out in the open on the beaches of Isla Carmen and being woken by the whales surfacing for air nearby.

151837420.name: Stunning!
151837420.author: a TripAdvisor user
151837420.reviewBody: Up close and personal to dolphins, sea lions and rare blue footed booby.  Water is so clear you can see fish (no need to snorkel!)

151433060.name: Sweet Gem not far offshore
151433060.author: a TripAdvisor user
151433060.reviewBody:
We arranged a day trip here through Sea Kayak Baja, Mexico.  Yvette, one of the owners, set up our group with 4 kayaks in very good condition.  These rough water kayaks were available for accomplished kayakers , as well as sit-on-tops for beginners.  Yvette was very helpful in providing all the information and equipment needed for our group of 8 to enjoy a day on the island.  We left the marina around 8:30 am in 2 pangas (motor skiffs) with all our gear and a lunch made by one of the captain's wife.  We circumnavigated the island first, seeing a colony of sea lions at one end, plus some blue footed boobies on the cliffs.  We were surrounded by a school of dolphins, and nearby, a humpback whale surfaced, much to our delight!  There are only 3 palapas (shade huts) on the beach, unfortunately, and I understand there are restrictions preventing more from being constructed.  We were lucky to have gotten there early enough to claim one.  

Yvette took some of us on a fascinating walk through the dunes, explaining all sorts of natural history and identifying plants, and pointing out tarantula collars which led down to their lairs!

There is an outhouse, built up on a small hill on a cairn of stones which is absolutely disgusting.  I wonder if it has ever been cleaned, and toilet tissue, used and otherwise is all over the place.  I assume the park wants people to use this facility, but one has to be pretty desperate to actually do so.  This is the only downside to this lovely island...

150058187.name: Beautiful!
150058187.author: a TripAdvisor user
150058187.reviewBody: I\'m glad to see the people of BC preserve the environment. This area is a jewel, rich in wildlife. Over a week, dive waters off Islas Coronado and Carmen, as well as south of Loreto. Saw no other divers, and just a few other visitors.

149471008.name: Clear Water!!
149471008.author: a TripAdvisor user
149471008.reviewBody: Go in the water with the sea lions!!  The are super friendly and curious in the water -- like dolphins.

147877243.name: Coronado Island
147877243.author: a TripAdvisor user
147877243.reviewBody: Beautiful island, sea lions, dolphins, beautiful beaches, clear warm water. There are several captains that can arrange to take you to the islands for a reasonable fee. Its worth it.

145845744.name: Finally Mexico Preserves its Nature
145845744.author: a TripAdvisor user
145845744.reviewBody: Clear waters and lots of life.  Restrictions will keep it lovely.  Very few people on the beaches or in the water

145702491.name: wonderful place
145702491.author: a TripAdvisor user
145702491.reviewBody: peaceful and beautiful -- snorkel with the Cortez angelfish, kayak from one amazing bay to another, see blue-footed boobies, frigate birds, sea lions... I want to come back in whale-watching season.

145339992.name: Best Snorkeling I\'ve Done
145339992.author: a TripAdvisor user
145339992.reviewBody: The variety of fish and starfish was awesome. The water was clear and warm. However, we did get some jellyfish stings, some worse than others. You might want to wear a wetsuit for protection. I\'ve snorkeled in Hawaii, Florida and parts of the Carribean and this was by far the best area I\'ve experienced.

143767641.name: Peaceful and relaxing.
143767641.author: a TripAdvisor user
143767641.reviewBody: It is unspoiled by the maddening crowds of Cabo and other overcrowded tourist areas. The snorkeling and diving is second to none and the people are wonderful.

143730564.name: Great marine sanctuary.
143730564.author: a TripAdvisor user
143730564.reviewBody: Wonderful snorkeling and scuba diving! A little murky when we were there due to the recent hurricane.

140416343.name: gorgeous day trip
140416343.author: a TripAdvisor user
140416343.reviewBody: Crystal clear water, whales, dolphins, sea lions, sea turtle and great snorkeling, white sand beach along with our fabulous captain, Francisco!

140340886.name: The sea of paradise
140340886.author: a TripAdvisor user
140340886.reviewBody: Kayaking and paddle boarding are incredible. The water is so clear!\nCatamaran snorkel trip with WIld Loreto was awesome!

138999533.name: True nature
138999533.author: a TripAdvisor user
138999533.reviewBody: It is huge and unspoiled, no mass tourist, lots of tropical fishes, also sea lions, dolphins and whales. Some white beaches are spectacular, one in Coronado Island and one in Carmen Island.

136159083.name: Amazing beauty
136159083.author: a TripAdvisor user
136159083.reviewBody:
7 days of diving 2 tank dives around Coronado and Carmen Island were insufficient!  So much beauty surrounds you in this marine park, it is impossible to appreciate it all.  We enjoyed seeing some unique species of animals only found here like some beautiful nudibranchs from 1 cm to 10 cm in length, octopi, eels (moray and spotted), fish of all colors and sizes, dolphins, sea lions, and bird life too.  Water visibility was 30-60 feet during this late July trip, which I understand improves in late August/ September to close to 100-120 feet.  Surface temps were 80-88 F with temps at 40 ft in the neighborhood of 72-80 F.  Coming from Seattle with water temps of 40-45F and visibility of 10-20 feet this was like heaven.  I wore a shorty wetsuit mostly to thwart the stings of noseeums and the tiny invisible jellyfish or plankton.  The kids wore full 3/2 wetsuits to help with core body temps during our 45-60 minute dives.

The most pristine and beautiful beaches of Loreto are found on the islands.  Consider a beach hopper trip or go to the Marina in the morning to catch a ride with a local fisherman to some of the best beaches.  The more popular ones have shade, white sand, a little outhouse, and are easy to access by panga with a 30-60 minute trip each way.

On our bucket list:  return to swim with dolphins, see the whales, see a whale shark, and see a seahorse (elusive masters of disguise!).

135259455.name: Gorgeous water and sea life
135259455.author: a TripAdvisor user
135259455.reviewBody: The sea life and water in this area are pristine.  I am so glad they have decided to protect it.  It is like swimming in an aquarium.

132827784.name: Absolutely Beautiful
132827784.author: a TripAdvisor user
132827784.reviewBody: The sea life here was incredible. We saw so many beautiful fish. You do need to buy a bracelet for every day you are in the park.

132692285.name: Come See this Sea!
132692285.author: a TripAdvisor user
132692285.reviewBody: The Sea of Cortez (which incorporates Loreto Bay National Marine Park) is awesome!  We are so impressed with what the community of Loreto is doing to preserve this beautiful area.  We did 3 activities around the Islands of Loreto with the company "Wild Loreto" and had a wonderful time with each one.  If you are a 1st time snorkeler, Said is the guide for you.! We saw what a wonderful job he did with 2 ladies who had never snorkeled before, making the experience memorable and non-threatening.  We went scuba diving with Divemaster David who was SO kind and patient - he also took some great pictures with our underwater camera.  Lastly, we greatly enjoyed our kayak and snorkel trip with Shary and Argento - great guides, skilled at their jobs, lots of fun.  Thanks for the photos, Shary.  If you go to Loreto and want to enjoy the watery wonders of the National Marine Park, check out these people at "Wild Loreto".

132195412.name: Snorkeling is Amazing
132195412.author: a TripAdvisor user
132195412.reviewBody: We went to the Marine Park on a snorkeling trip and it was amazing.  We booked this thru the Villa de Palmar and it was very reasonable.  The water is crystal clear and a bit cool.  Wet suits were provided and much appreciated.  A guide showed as all around the snorkeling area and point out many of the beautiful fish.  In addition we saw lots of starfish.  Did not realize that there we so many kinds of starfish.  Go and be prepared to swima bit of a distance, but the sealife is so worth the effort.

131146361.name: Amazing experience!
131146361.author: a TripAdvisor user
131146361.reviewBody: A group of friends took a panga boat to Coronado Island.  On the way there we were escorted by dolphins all around our boat - swimming alongside and splashing us!  Our panga circled the beautiful island and on the way we saw large sea lions.  Stopped at a gorgeous white sand turquoise beach for snorkeling.  Were surrounded by beautiful yellow striped fish.  FABULOUS PLACE!!!

130807951.name: Scuba Diving in the Sea of Cortez
130807951.author: a TripAdvisor user
130807951.reviewBody: A wonderful experience.  We dove with Wild Loreto located at the Villa del Palmar at the Islands of Loreto--more starfish than I\'ve ever seen, lots of variety of sea life including nudibrancs, many different kinds of fishes, lots of sting and electric rays.  And diving off the sea lion colony on the Island of Coronado was amazing--the sea lions came to investigate and essentially posed on the bottom five feet away from us! (I wasn\'t so sure about that but it was awesome!)  Their dive equipment was new and excellent--though the boat had engine trouble our first day out. Our dive instructor Alexandra went out of her way to be sure our dives were safe, interesting, comfortable, and informative.  She was awesome. Note, though, that the visibility was never greater than 30\' and we were chiiled despite our 5ml wet suits. Not Cozumel but well worth it, nonetheless.

130710804.name: calm seas
130710804.author: a TripAdvisor user
130710804.reviewBody: sea life abundant. Our captain on the way out, stops, we wonder why, then a diver pops up and delivers clams, fresh seafood drive up!

129769113.name: Great Scuba Diving
129769113.author: a TripAdvisor user
129769113.reviewBody: I never knew there were so many different kinds of starfish and nudibranch. The park is abundant with life and very healthy. Water temp in April was 65 to 70 degrees with visibility around 40ft.

128123122.name: Beautiful!
128123122.author: a TripAdvisor user
